title: Quintessential Quiet
author: jaelie
text: the frost of winter warms my trodden heart to hear footsteps crunch on the frozen lake while my eyes whisper the coldness of art and shivering lovers reach for snowflakes.   knitted by christ; kissed by god trees struggle to move their white branches under that holy blanket sacredly marked by the snowflakeâ’s dances  back mindedly,  questions arise of this purity:  a speckled fawn nibbles at the spotted snow oblivious to where it came from or where it may go.

title: My First Sonnet
author: jaelie
text: sandy feet trampled the gravel softly while burnt ears remained open and afraid,  while their sun-kissed backs turned to the shadows,  asking their creator,  â“why are we scarred?â” faith gone,  nothing was heard.  subconsciously,  however,  the brains of the broken saw their master violently running through fields of black and white petals on one flower.  tripping over their heartsâ’ wishful thinking and falling into ditches of despair,  they clung on to their last vision of hope.  while finding their glory,  they knew they were no longer separated by pigment.  joined,  heart to heart,  for blood is red in all.

title: Watermelon Kiss
author: james
text: stars so bright against the darkening night i search and search for one just right.   i look for only a second and already i reckend that a star like this does not exist.   but then i look to my side and what do i find? laying next to me a star so divine.   not up in the sky where she ought to be but laying right here next to me.   the most amazing star  that i ever did see sent from the skies to me how could this possibly be?  i've never done anything to deserve being handed everything but here you are my shining star.   my heart's about to burst love i no longer thirst for in you i have found the greatest love around.   but looking back on  all the pain,  the hurt and the lies shows me you really are a star and they were just fireflies.   but i'm no longer a kid with a net chasing flies i'm all grown up and ready to shoot for the skies.   but i can only make it halfway so once again i ask you to fall and i promise to catch you can you trust me? it's your call.   so if you fall an i catch you i will never let go and believe me when i say this because it's my heart telling you so.   so there's two things i ask of you your love is one and the other is this a watermelon kiss.

title: One Divided by Two
author: jamilah
text: i,  me,  myself,  two personalities very diverse as i walk through rough ways and hallways,  i find myself to be masculine,  not masculine as a man to be.   i seem to be the boss of my own authority i hold my ground and manage to make it seem as if i have strength of a body builder.   i admit,  i have muscles to hit someone harder like a boxer at a box meeting for training,  my status is an aggressive woman of light brown tone,  shorts,  button down shirt,  not your normal 17 yr old female.   growing on the south side streets of chicago made me that way,  white t-shirts and hoodies,  aggressiveness throughout every street and subway station.   other 50 percent of me is sweet,  sometimes shy and loving,  dislike to fight,  but to fight with my kindness,  i would rather have you to talking and wasting your breath,  instead of me hitting back 10 times harder i use my words of wisdom.   sweet as a honey bee,  i'll give a shirt that lies on my back,  a shoe that my foot sinks into,  my hairs give to donate.   i'm not your average person.  i'm sweet as honey,  but i can sting like a bee,  or maybe a snakes two front teeth.   i am who i say i am,  i can do what everyone is capable of doing,  i have two personalities,  i am me.

title: Charcoal Reign
author: jazmin
text: you believe you know what you are saying,  but in reality you donâ’t have a clue.  i think your judgement might be decaying,   because your statements seem to be untrue.  youâ’re always in command,  to never sway,  with eyes of burning pieces of charcoal.  where caged in this jail you force me to stay,  i am losing myself,  my heart,  my soul.  i am strong,  but you know where i am weak you use my own fears against me in vain,  like you will earn you the respect you seek,  but i will give you not respect but pain.  but not for too long,  your reign will soon fall.  my will is strong and my shadow is tall.

title: Nature's Song
author: jeanette
text: i get up in the morning.  go to the river to wash up.  i hear the trees whistling,  i smell the flowers.  i hear the ducks quacking.  i see the trout jumping.  i go back to the house to get my fishing stick.  go down by the docks.  the pond is like a flowing blanket of water,   i put my line in and wait for bite i lay back and watch the ducks soar listen to the trees sing there song smell the different fragances of summer lunch time as arrrived time to pack up and fish another day i walk down the trail there was a squirrel on the red maple tree munching on a niblet of corn each side of the trail you see for miles pine trees & oak trees.

title: Where do dreams come from?
author: jeanie
text: why does the wind whisper through the hollow trees,  where no one wanders,  looks,  or sees.  how can it be that it is make believe,  or a fairy tale under lock and key?  in this place a star will shine,  and is smaller than a ball of twine.  with crystal spectrums through a glass,  or is calmer than a rambunctious class.   when discoveries do take place,  finding them will take no hace.  when in doubt you do find out,  where this place is donâ’t shout it out.   from the back of childrenâ’s audacious minds,  where ideaâ’s and pretending make a chime.  for this is much very much more,  than behind your own secret door.  \t\t\t

title: For Whom The Bells Toll
author: jeff
text: in the darkness i lay my head the shadows my pillow,  fear my bed this empty black is comfort,  it is my home i canâ’t escape it,  no matter where i roam once i was happy and garbed in light but the darkness came and gave me night i watch them all,  the ones that grieve i envy them for they can leave and i am stuck,  trapped in this hell and i am sick,  never to be well i envy them for they are free and that is something iâ’ll never be but they donâ’t know the power i grab and with it i choose who i stab they will come with me and they,  iâ’ll break if they knew,  iâ’d burn at the stake but that is useless for i cannot die so forever i am trapped in this lie to madness the darkness has me driven and for my crimes,  iâ’ll never be forgiven this is my life,  and eternal plight and i canâ’t break free,  no matter how i fight i am the cause of all that is bad and the source of all that is sad so i sit waiting for the end and the will the guides me refuses to bend i am trapped,  watching the free i envy them for the things iâ’ll never see and i take them,  each has their turn they will come with me,  come to learn they hide in shelter to wait for knock shut their doors and twist the lock but they canâ’t escape the darkness from which i stem and now they know i do not envy them for i am death,  and their lights start to dull for i am death,  and for them the bells toll

title: Motherhood Is...
author: jen
text: your heart filled with joy as you watch your baby grow and with sadness at the same time.  your cheeks burning from smiling continuously at your little one just to see him smile back at you.  your tired eyelids as you rock your baby into a sleep that evades him.  your calm as you watch your little one peacefully sleeping in your arms.  your happiness as your baby squeals in delight at the little things.  your sense of pride with each new ability your little one develops.  your fear as you realize the awesome responsibility of raising this baby into an adult.  your outlook on life changed completely and forever.  your heart walking around outside of your body for the rest of your life.

title: For He Is Mine
author: jenna
text: you cannot have him for he is mine  on february 20th 2007 it was no longer miles that kept us apart,  but lifetimes.  it was then that i understood the void i felt when you left due to days of work would no longer be relieved with your return and only leave me with hurt something that a seven year old struggled to comprehend only with time did it take me to fully understand that with each day that passed,  your jacket would never leave the rack and never again would i have you there to always proudly pat my back you left me with sorrow,  a pain at which i had never endured a pain i felt so vividly,  an emotion that will never be cured with more questions than answers as to what was going to come i wanted nothing more than to leave this earth and be done as they packed your casket away into a wall that i'll never be able to reach any reason for the purpose of living became mildly oblique  no fury for a innocent child so badly scorned i became furious with my god who i no longer adorned whom i once believed to be my ultimate protector and guider above had selfishly ripped away the only person who i had every truly loved i begged and i pleaded for the chance of having more time i cried out to god you cannot have him for he is mine the only thing i have left of you now is of course your last name at which i proudly proclaim as it reminds me of the journey i overcame.  although you have missed so much,  and couldnâ’t watch your children grow that void once possessed me,  oh how little do you know i try to carry you with me every where i go hoping and praying that i have something for me to show that i have found my purpose in life again a meaning to life i am now able to comprehend healing my soul and minding my thoughts trying to make you proud with each chance i got your memory and absence can still bring me sorrow however it reminds me to be grateful of life and hope for tomorrow because with each new day im given im hopeful and pray that your watching me and guiding me each and every day i miss your mighty laugh that was able to fill any room and the presence you made known in which caused everyone to swoon the cussing,  the snoring,  and even the days with you that were boring you are nothing but a memory to me now but for this i must say,   the unconditional love i have for you will never go away.  i will no longer let your memory be plagued by grief and sorrow because your memory gives me a purpose for living and healing tomorrow and although though i know there will be tough days in which i'll make it out of just fine it won't take me long to remember that you are,  and always will be mine.  the best dad i could ever have through the test of time.

title: Winter
author: jeremiah
text: the chilling cold,  such as is winter usually is.  there is a forest nestled high by one very old oak tree.  as i stare at its beauty,  a snowflake puts itself ever so gently on my face.  suddenly the snowflake takes the form of a young lady,  smiling back at me.  i canâ’t help myself,  i feel so alive so free.  i turn around and take a look upon her face.  her beauty surpasses any other,  there is no comparison.  however her eyes had the look of sadness in them,  the saddest look i have ever seen.  then suddenly she left nowhere to be found.  the center of my passion,  all i see is her.  thereâ’s nothing not even a sound.  iâ’ll come back next winter.

title: The Moon
author: jeremiah
text:
the sun overwhelms the moon,  and the eclipse eats the sun.  the sun looks at the moon enviously; it looks at its pale green lunar light.  the sunâ’s will weakens,  and the moon appears once again.  the moonâ’s pale green light silently illuminates our dreams.  moving ever so slowly to the deepest part of our sub-conscience,  and yet it appears to be nothing but a dream.  an ocean fills our hearts and our dreams.  the moon and the ocean are connected.  as we stare and admire the moonâ’s sheer beauty we canâ’t help but to feel as if itâ’s calling on to us.  the moon silently illuminates our dreams,  and we canâ’t stop it.  we can only welcome it to the darkest corner of our minds.  <b< /p=\>


						</b<>

title: LIFE IS A BLESSING

title: Night and day
author: jessica
text: who you have become is like night and day there are just a couple of things i've wanted to say since i was little you were never there i went to bed at night wondering where and then one day you popped back in i was so happy you wanted to be moms friend from there you were home everyday praying every night you wouldn't go away but eventually love grew to hate i guess that's what happens when you did me that way every night left with bruises i didn't know what to do i don't know how or why you became so cruel then one day you moved out you weren't coming back there was no doubt when i was fifteen there you were again i didn't even know where to begin you said you were a changed man its okay i waited so long for that day then i moved in with you to see how it would go the feelings of relief started to show but i guess things can only go good for so long because where there's a right there's bound to be a wrong here i am today and i don't even know you but i don't even care who you are anymore or what you do hate is a strong word but i do hate you just think you were the man who used to pull me through but that's all down the drain all life is to you is a game you did this to yourself so please don't try because each time you come up with a stupid lie its been three years now and you still haven't been here even though it hurts i wipe away my tear.  you are my father and that will never change but some things are better when they seem strange.

title: Paint Brush
author: jessica
text: i keep a paint brush with me wherever i may go,  in case i need to cover up so the real me doesn't show.  i'm so afraid to show you me,  afraid of what you'll do- that you might laugh or say mean things,   i'm afraid i might lose you.   i'd like to remove all my paint coats to show you the real,  true me,  but i want you to try and understand,   i need you to accept what you see.     so,  if you'll be patient and close your eyes,   i'll strip off all my coats real slow.  please understand how much it hurts,   to let the real me show.   now my coats are all stripped off,  i feel naked,  bare and cold,  and if you still love me with all that you see,  you are my friend,  pure as gold.   i need to save my paint brush,  though,  and hold it in my hand,  i want to keep it handy,  in case somebody doesn't understand.  so please protect me,  my dear friend,  and thanks for loving me true,  but please let me keep my paint brush with me,  until i love me too.

title: A POEM BEFORE GOODBYE...
author: joana
text: sometimes i wish we never met sometimes i wish things are easy to forget i wish i had look the other way i wish i knew what to say  why did our paths have to met? why did you have to be sweet? why did feeelings have to grow? and now,  why did i have to let you go?  i hate myself for always thinking of you i hate myself for always wanting to see you i hate myself of things that are impossible to become true i hate myself for falling in love with you  you donâ’t seem to see all things that i do and it only leaves me feeling blue you leave me hanging on air trying to find out if you really care  im not sure of how you feel and i donâ’t know if what you show is real well,  magic spells donâ’t come true see and miracles donâ’t happen to me  so please… donâ’t blame for the way i act i gues it just that i have accepted the fact i know that its silly to wish for you to be here you should know that this feeling is real  thaks for the time. . .  thanks for the attention… thanks for the love and appreciation i hope youâ’ll remember me once in a while and whenever you do… i hope you would smile!  to show my feelings for you isnâ’t easy but i can try but to say i can forgety you is a lie! for no matter what i do and no matter what is say i know i will always be loving you

title: Christine
author: joe
text: have you ever stopped for a moment,  to appreciate the morning sunrise.  to look upon it in wonder.    the sun,  as it breaks the morning horizon,  itâ’s brilliance,  passing through the clouds,  creating a cascade of spectacular light.  each morning,   different,  than the day before.            i have taken advantage and looked upon many such sunrises.  yes,  each is different than the last.  it shows the wonder of our creator! the promise,  of a new day!      i have. . . . .  twice. . . . .  been given  the opportunity. . . .  blessed,  to see a sight  that is prettier. . . . . .  more spectacular,   than the breaking dawn of a new morning. . . . .  something that. . . . .  that. . . .   is so incredible,  my very spirit,  yes. . .  my very spirit,  leapt for joy.  there,  but,  before my very eyes. . . . .   in the breaking dawn of a new day,   a precious gift of gods glorious wonder. . . .   gods love. . . .   that precious  vision. . . .  you christine. . . .   twice,  i have been blessed to visit you,  to see you,   in the early morning light.   the vision before me. . .  so  stunningly beautiful. . . .  leaving my senses reeling. . . .  an image of pure innocence . . .  elegance and. . . . .  loveliness.   the first time. . . . .   bare foot,  wearing nothing but her robe,   complaining about her hair being a mess. . . .    oh!  my heavens above! . . . .  you  looked. . . .  so radiant!   you dressed.   then  we journeyed  out to look at the moon,   which seemed close enough to reach out and touch.   holding you close. . . . .  feeling my heart beat against your back. . . .  feeling your warmth against me,  in the cool morning air.    your hair gleamed in the morning light.  your eyes sparkled.   your scent. . . .  intoxicating. . . .  alluring. . . .   my spirit and heart were overflowing with joy!  to gently  hold. . . .  my dragonfly. . . . .  afraid of hurting her,  a precious creation of gods glorious wonder,  in my arms,   a gift that can only come from our creator.   all good things come in gods time. . . . .

title: When I Have Fears
author: john
text: when i have fears that i may cease to be  before my pen has glean'd my teeming brain,  before high-piled books,  in charactery,  hold like rich garners the full ripen'd grain; when i behold,  upon the night's starr'd face,  huge cloudy symbols of a high romance,  and think that i may never live to trace their shadows,  with the magic hand of chance; and when i feel,  fair creature of an hour,  that i shall never look upon thee more,  never have relish in the faery power of unreflecting love;--then on the shore of the wide world i stand alone,  and think till love and fame to nothingness do sink.

title: Poet Who Didn't Know It
author: john
text: a rhyme so fine it is divine,  one that i shall make mine.  rehearsed by many actors it shall be a major factor in deciding my role in time,  a poet who speaks or a mime.   said in television sitcoms,  sometimes by not so cool moms a rhyme so fine it is divine one that i shall make mine.   this morning when i awoke,  grumpy words when i spoke.  not knowing that as i tire,  i would be a poet for hire the rhyme shall be one made famous by me  i was a poet and i didnâ’t know it is a rhyme so fine it is divine,  one that i have made mine.

title: Pig Sty Bed
author: joleene
text: when i awoke one morning,  a pig was on my messy bed.   i asked,  ''what are you doing here?'' it looked at me and said .  .  .  ''what are you doing here? why are you sleeping on my head?'' ''on your head? you are a silly pig! for you are sleeping in my bed!'' ''look at this wonderful mess!'' replied the confused pig ''this is my house,  it is too dirty for you!'' i looked around and could not see the floor! ''my room is not messy,  just a little untidy! if you help me clean it,  you will see. '' so i cleaned all day and all night until i could clean no more! i peered around and my room was no longer a sty!!!

title: Dogsitting
author: jon
text: sonnet: dogsitting these dogs at home i do not really like,  they run around like little baby sheep,   they make me willingly take a long hike,   i pray they never make another peep.   constantly they ruin my momâ’s whole house,   i have to clean up all of their messes,   they tore apart my mom's favorite blouse,  as i sit there with my parents stresses.    these dogs i say i hate very dearly,   they aren't the worst that i have ever seen,  they always make me smile so severely,  except for when they get a little mean.   i am going to miss them when they leave,  it will make my family want to grieve.

title: -Purgatory-
author: jon
text: distilled loneliness,  i am blind in the dark.  i have no reason to live,  everyone has forsaken me,  i cannot be.   the living do not exist here.  the dead breed and flourish,  dark portals separate this world from the next,  my thoughts all lead to obscurity.   thereâ’s no contact to the outside world,  nothing reminds you of your family,  \t\tbodies atop bodies,  this is an undead morgue,  not a fantasy.   \t\tcorpses eating corpses,  \t\t airborne disease,  \tthis is a hellhole,  \t    the relentless sound of chewing plagues my soul.   there is no rank or position,  in this lonely shallow grave,  you cannot speak or talk,  in this crowded silent rave.

title: Evil Angel
author: jonahtebaa
text: evil angelevil angel,  born in sin,  gabriel's lil' twisted twin,  has his brother's angel eyes yet his daddy's evil grin!  evil angel fights inside 'gainst his greed and evil pride! can't be good,  and yet he tries. . .  he can run,  but never hide!  evil angel's just a boy,  mom 'n daddy's little toy,  seeking love and being wise,  but evil's growing in his eyes!

title: Eyes of a Spark
author: jonathan
text: a tear is like a waterfall dripping down from a stream.  as i glance into her blue hazel eyes from her pupil,  it is like blue sparkling diamonds that only i can see.  as i glance into her eyes once more,  my mind goes numb and everything around me becomes silent.  the pureness in her blue hazel eyes is like water sparkling with blue diamonds.  it is like snow on a cold winter day.  the joy in her eyes is the happiness she feel towards me and the joy in my eyes is the happiness i feel towards her.

title: Game Day
author: jonathan
text: the anticipation is in the air,  on that day theres no other care.  we practice all year for this day,  the coaches have nothing left to say.  the smell of baseball is all around,  on the first pitch there is no sound.  crack is the sound of the bat hitting the ball,  with focus and teamwork they are likely to fall.  we wouldn't have it any other way,  to be playing on game day.

title: A caring friend
author: jonathan
text: we're distant by miles,  we're close in the end,  the very same person that became my friend,  i made mistakes in my life,  getting injured was one,  seeing you worry about me,  would make 2,  and that's no fun,  i was considered a monster by people,  so i was left with a heart that became shattered,  other people told me,  ''johnny your friends will leave you like you don't even matter'' until one day we kicked it,  you and me just hungout,  i've never felt more happy enough to let out a huge shout,  that you are awesome,  and you are kind,  my vision maybe gettin blurry,  but i'm not so blind being around you is fun,  because i can at least smile,   you bring out the best of me,  which at times may take a while,  i appreciate your honesty,  i appreciate your care,  you mean a lot to me,  just know i'll always be there like you did for me,  i'll do the same for you,  if there is one truth to be told,  understand that this is true,  you really are the best in comparison towards the others,   it sounds pretty bad at first,  but not many cared the way you do,  maybe except my own mother

title: My lover

title: My Test Grades are Falling Down
author: jonathan
text: this was written to be sung to the tune london bridge is falling down  ''my test grades are falling down,  falling down,  falling down.  my test grades are falling down,  my 'fair' t. a. ''  ''take your d and please go home please go home,  please go home.  take your d and please go home,  my dim student. ''  ''how will i progress on,  move along,  sing more songs; how will i progress on,  my 'great' t. a. ?''  ''you must take the class again,  only then,  you'll break this trend.  you must take the class again,  my dense student. ''  ''but my schedule's much too packed,  i'd rather slack,  but can't hold back.  but my schedule's much too packed,  my 'wise' t. a. ''  ''take it during summer school,  it might be cool,  (yeah right fool).  take it during summer school,  my thick student. ''  ''but i am to work all day,   not run and play,  but slave away.  but i am to work all day,  my 'grand' t. a. ''  ''what about some time at night? there ain't no light; or fun junk right? what about some time at night? my dull student. ''  ''that time is reserved for sleep,  i'd like to keep,  my hours steep.  that time is reserved for sleep,  my 'keen' t. a. ''  ''well you've got a problem there, '' 'can't take class there, ' 'i'm busy- swear!' ''i'd mock you more,  but i declare,  my dumb student:''  ''you keep on writing silly rhymes all the time,  it's quite a crime.  you'd pass my class,  just use your time! my slow student. ''  ''oh. ''

title: That Day
author: jonathon
text: this seems to fall harder the part where the leader fails and the loser takes the crown  where the earth seems unable to turn in the light where your eyes begins to burn  shapes and colors,  changing ways struggling more & more,  each day falling short of whats expected a battle within yourself to become accepted  the dust calms the night,  another daily test,  another fight your arms,  scissors of pain your calling,  as if you feel not ashamed  the light shined brightly that fateful day,  where all the clouds opened,  as you began to pray  in the end were all apart where your only chance is  to restart  a clean slate,  a cleared paint,  of your life,  and when you lost sight

text: people are judged and people judge.  to those few,  some people are just a smudge.  not always being seen,  but they always see.  even though we are supposed to be free.   everyone is diverse and diversity can curse.  our thoughts of each other so averse.  not knowing about others or what others know about.  some people begin to feel shut out.   parts of the world so alone,  alone in the worldâ’s parts.  we all have our place,  places for new starts.  to have them is a miracle,  a miracle in our lives.  our hearts,  that one special person revives.

title: Toxic beliefs
author: jose
text: my blood is intoxicated by your wants,  your desires always freeze my heart,  i wanted more from you than you ever thought,  you treated me like a game you were the plot,   i believe many things and one is you,  i worshipped the feeling of having you,  i risked my life just to be with you,  and in the end thru this,  all i want is you,    it was you who broke me and it is you who can fix me,  i deny the love of others because none match you exactly,  my heart is shattered my tongue begs mercy,  can even love or a bullet hurt me?   can you feel the knife inside your heart,  can you feel the pain that tears me apart,  take a look at what you are,  your a monster,  to others some think your god,   divide a line between my soul,  one half is mine the other yours,  the half i carry itâ’s pain i hold,  the other half you took the half you stole,  it holds the memories of when my heart was gold,    so divide a line between belief and truth,  and what you find are lies in you,    divide a line between light and dark,  what you find is me torn apart.

title: Shame
author: josã©
text: i walk around my town in shame,  i walk around my town in rain,  every street i turn of you i have a memory,  every street i turn i remember what you said to me,    i will always love you i will never leave,  but youâ’re gone now iâ’m blind i canâ’t see,  for you were my vision you were my dream,  those promises of happiness i will wipe clean,    i walk around my town with tears,  i walk around my town with fears,  fears that i will fall in love with you again,  but the feeling of falling in love is far greater than the pain,    maybe i still love you,  maybe i still care,  maybe i still want you,  but thatâ’s a memory just like memories we shared.

title: Comida
author: joseph
text: my love for food is so great,  my heart melts for it til the end of the day.  the night weeps while it is just late,  i will eat and cherish until i lay.   its beauty is so very great,  all day and night i think about food.  while i call it love you call it fate,  and while i think of you,  so bright is my mood.   although you bring me pure happiness,  our love makes my belt size increase.  we will have to compromise the sloppiness,  while i put an end to this drawn out lease.   only one day i will be just that careless,  is when i have grown old and hairless.

title: An Illusive Friend
author: joseph
text: a friend that i want to find doesn't exist but should i remind,  that mirror hanging on the wall could be the best friend out of all.   i see a person in the mirror he is just like me and i dont fear to tell him anything,   he would listen always he is the best one in all the ways.   only one thing that makes me upset he is mute and he doesnt say anything back i ask him again and again just as quite he would remain.   after sometime it gets aggravating i cant stand this quietness,   cant understand the meaning so what i do is give him a warning.   i pick something,  hit him hard i see him breaking all apart,  then he scatters on the ground when he breaks,  makes a loud sound.   why did you just stand there? never answered left everything unclear,  i still wonder who you were were you the one who would care.   but now you have gone and i m all lonely there is no reason to live for me i pick up this gun,  shoot my head after a moment i m dead. . . .   nothing hurts now anymore my blood drains on the floor i am taking off from this place a new life i shall embrace. . .   *joseph khan*

title: Monalisa, elusive to men
author: joseph
text: violets may wither and fall,  lillies may vanish from mortal sight,  and the splendour of roses may begin to fade. but eternally preserved are your mediaval looks oh monalisa. fair still for the desires and passion of present day tastes. the work of imagination thou hast always been, in still manner, in a frame for over four centuries. yet your charming and tender looks, our loving hearts desire. but no more than a mirage keeps whetting our insatiable appetites for you oh monalisa, elusive to all men.

title: Lovely Winter
author: joseph
text: lovely winter winter is here letâ’s all laugh and cheer  you and i can play in the day as we may yes itâ’s cold  but we all know the snow is very bold the snow is fluffy as a chinchilla  white as a cloud itâ’s like fluffy flittering feathers  there is a lot of falling snow but it starts out very low when you go out without a doubt youâ’ll freeze your toes and when you freeze them  youâ’ll have to squeeze them you can eat cookies while watching awookies  and hope youâ’re cookies are swell the  end

title: Skin
author: joseph
text: those eyes,  there so blurry just by the scent of your perfume i can taste your fear i can feel your tension  this barrier between you and me differs from our personality the stage is set; my presence corrupts the minds of normal men can't you see what's between you and me? this hunger,  it's calling  i'm the cannibal that haunts your dreams i'm the lector,  the silence you will no longer scream this hunger,  it's calling me as i sink into the bone the stories you've should have never known my passion it's a crime enjoying your taste,  shattering your mind  is this what haunts your dreams slowly breaking you down laughs overlaying your screams this is my hunger,  this is my calling

title: Life
author: joseph
text: i sit and think of times gone past love is fading,  but will it last my hope is free but not for long who will i get to sing my song show me love because i need it so will i fade,  like the wind that blows or will i stand like the tree that sways i know god but not his ways so here i stand thinking of the past will this fade or will it last

title: Flying with me
author: josh
text: when i awoke one morning,   a bat was on my head.  i asked,  ''what are you doing there?''  it looked at me and said  ''come and fly away with me,  you know it will be fun'' i looked at him and sadly said ''i really cannot fly,  but our fun has just begun.  we can do other things,  such as prance around and run. '' the bat looked very sad,  as he readied his reply ''all i've ever known was flying,  but i can do new things i will try my best, all for you,  and see what the fun brings''

title: Addicted to love
author: josh
text: unstoppable,  unbeatable,  and determined.  i grow upon myself at an excessive speed.  i possess a strength that is all but under control.  he became the addict,  while i became his addiction,  but only i have no available treatments.  iâ’m not a drug,  although it may seem so some,  he knows himself he cant give up.  iâ’m visible,  yet i am still hidden to the human eye,  i know its fact he can feel me inside,  alive,  still proving my name.  i use self owned powers and his own mind to dig myself deeper within his skin,  eventually tapping into his heart,   causing the random skips in the beat.  i make no sound,  i am silent,   until he tells her â“i love you. â”

title: Book Report
author: joshua
text: the book that i really liked that i read recently was the things they carried by tim o'brian.   it is about a solider in the vietnam war.   he is with four other solders.   they become really close friends.   they stick together in the roughest time.   they are assigned to go through the different villages and look for suriviors.   the narrator is one of the soligers.   the book is fiction not not fiction.   it does however have some truth to it on the vietnam war.   the villages are full of stenches of death,  rotting bodies,  and smoke from weaponry.   the villiges are in complete ruins.   the war caused numerious numbers of damages.   the soligers are horrified at the number of deaths of innocent people.  as one could imagine it gets pretty boring out there at camp.  they consume contraband to help them cope with the situtuion that they are in.   they would also consume tranquilizer liquid.   later on in the story one of the comrades gets shot.   the other comrades feel great sadness for the loss of their army friend.

title: My beloved!
author: joshua
text: it's confusing now,  more than ever,  driven by the ache for us to be together,  these words i write seem nothing but wrong, it's as if our loves already written in song,  in bed at night i long for you,  long for your touch and your kisses too,  for it's you i love and cherish so,  these thoughts and memorys i won't ever let go,  with you on my mind and you in my heart,  i'll always be yours no matter how far apart.

title: Scholarly Walls
author: jovainã¨
text: within nine hours,   my mind is confined behind these towers- a place where they say nobility is placed,  discipline, decorum and dignity are the three 'd's' they try to embrace,  i try to express my avidity but it is outweighed by priority.  priority to escape the confusion of attempted content and alacrity.   save me,  oh save me from this malign foundation which they say laid sturdy and true,  bring me back to that place  where i can reconcile with the humanrace,  an egalitarian man they say but i just simply can't relate.   save me,  oh save me from this malicious place and spare me the solace.

title: My life without life
author: jovana
text: what is there to say? except my soul is  drowning away.  what is there to do? when every day that passes by i know nothing but to think of you.  what is there to think? when my brain seems to be  my body's weakest link.  what is there to inhale? when even my oxygen  seems to fail.  what is there to touch? when your body and heart are not even there.  the only thing i know now,  is not to care.

title: Autumn
author: joyanne
text: strolling into the leaves of color genuine autumns glamour with every step  life is glowing with a yellow pep sun awakes us to get on the poetry bus.

title: Study Of Me
author: joyce
text: the study of psychology should really be the study of me why i do the things i do? finding out is something i wish i could see  thereâ’s a time and place for everything people come and people went why they do what they do? the time iâ’ve wasted on that has me spent

title: Awakening Day at the Auction
author: joyce  e
text: out she pranced-a white beauty so elegsant and proud,   oohs and aahs echoed  throughout the crowd! spellbound at first,  the auctioneer came alive.   ''now,  what am i bid? i hear two thousand,  five!'' the bid began climbing:old memories start-  i'm torn between money and throbs  in my heart.  oh,  dear lord,  i must have been out of my mindâ— suppose her new owner is not  gentle and kind.  my loving companion gave her all out of trustâ—but became nervous around loud rowdies who cussed! my mare would nip at my sleeve,  as a gentle clueâ—of things that she knewâ— she thought i should,  too.  rose got my attention to retrieve oats spilled in a crackâ—or made me aware laborpains,  had begun in her back.  arabian ladies are proud and well bred.  buyers wanted her babies with that marvelous head.  how could money bring me such pleasure and joy?  oh,  the emptiness of pastures  without her frisky and coy.  hard put to the test,  i outbid the rest! no more pain in my throat,  as i reclaimed the best.   my beautiful-beautiful rosie.

title: My Little, Wild,  White Rose
author: joyce  e.
text: she was peeking through that cedar fence,  my little,  wild,  white rose, where black-   berry vines were growingâ—her pasture     to enclose.  all about were fern and heather,  on a breezy sunlit moor. â—there in a fragrant alcove-a shelter for songbirds,  galore.   i faintly heed the lilacs and blossoms on the trees, â—for my eyes were on the rosebud,  gazing back at me.  for in springtimes gardenâ—there are buds  of promise,  too. â—just beyond our reach to gatherâ—but not beyond our view.  and like that little temptress,  with a   heart,  i understandâ—i like to capture and hold spellbound thatâ—what's out of  reach of human hand.  at last,  i take the time to savorâ—and ponder at the spotâ—why it isâ—things  seem so much sweeterâ—when we possess them not?  a hard lesson this little wild rose has taught! (arabiab mare)

title: Sweet Loves Of My Life
author: joyce e
text: i get a softness in my eye,  my heart beats rapidly,  as i see my lovely mare searching out,  the places i might be.  she stands transformed - then knickers,  as she sees me looking,  too.  ''come be with meâ—play with me & brush me for i am missing you. '' then dear 'freight train ' woos me in goose talkâ—beats his wings and waddles  close beside me as we talk.  his brown eyes tell me sadlyâ— how he's lost without his mate.  then bows his neck and thanks me  for the bread that tasted great.  shonee' is a sheltie dog ; faithful as they come she keeps chicks and crows from the yard,  and coyotes on the run.  (i yelled at her for chasing the hensâ—and discovered it was a mother coyote  teaching her two babies to hunt,  and not a sheltie dog. )

title: The Seasons of My Heart
author: joyce e.
text: when summer comes and flowers budâ— i love to work the ground.  i plant the seed,  god gives the yield,  while memories of you dad,  is all around.  i see your wagon,  piled high with hay; your faithful dog behind.  you lower your hand and help me up,   as i grin into your eyes full of shine.  when autumn changes it's attire across the meadow and the hill,   geese get restless.  i hear the pheasant  screechâ—premonitions make us still.  words of emotion begin to growâ— i forbid the rising tears to flow.  my dad was getting restlessâ—to goâ— he'd be goneâ—before the snow.  in wintertimeâ—i'll light my lamp,   as daylight fades to night.  i watch the colors as sunset fadesâ— echoing dad's laughter in shadows light.  and when the warm winds blow in spring,  earth awakens life,  anewâ— i'll watch the sunrise as it bringsâ— sweet remembrances,  dad of you.

title: The life in the economical downturn
author: jumalan m
text: a poem: the life in the economical downturn  (in this poem i have utilized some advises of my master's thesis special adviser larry smith who had served in the vietnam war and twice fallen on a helicopter in the jungles of vietnam.  especially his death process teachings were quite helpful as i am illustrating the curve of death in my poem.  actually he was teaching these,  when the target finnish company was going through some tough layoffs in atlanta in 1991 during one recession of the u. s. a. )  by  di markku j.  saarelainen jumalan mies  it was the life,  the old life,  they are remembering,  that old life,  when everything was well,  before any worries,  worries that brought still the moment of hope for remaining in the life,  but no - and still no,  everything collapsed instantly without leaving any hope left,  the old life is gone never returning back,  everything is lost here in our depression,  the depression that brings those losses of our lives and our souls,  lasting to the moment of us seeing some light,  some hope of the new life.  but when shall the light come,  does it ever come? - guiding us to the new life in the new world.  as in the process of death so also in the process of the economical downturn,  we are just transferring our souls from our old lives to our new lives,  hopefully without any damage,  but until the recovery starts somewhere,  we are still traveling on the downward path,  not really knowing,  what the future shall be,  where shall we be going,  until the light,  a little sign of hope comes,  we and our souls are lost,  until it comes,  we shall just be dreaming without the bright future,  waiting this our hope to rise again,  hopefully without collapsing again.

title: One is too many
author: junaid
text: one is too many  as one we try to be part of one,  we try acting like one,  seeking for the one,  one of a kind,  one in a million.   one will always be one,  one will always try to break one down,  one never wants to see one move forward,  but hold one back.   to find one,  one needs to stand up against one,  to be one,  so take this one into consideration,  to be able to find the one,  one in a million.

title: Little Bombs
author: juniper and holli
text: bombing the art of using the fear of the unknown;  when is it going to  drop?  it starts off like any normal day just another work day at the world trade center  just another marathon  another 1st,  2nd,  3rd,  4th or 5th  time you will get on your knees facing the east praying this won't  be the last time you speak to your god  some men drop cliffs some men drop beats  and some men drop bombs because they have been taught  well  what exactly have they been taught?  who in their sane mind would find it  right to teach them that this is okay?  that it is okay to rip almost innocent souls away from the  ones who live them so  no one deserves that.    wartime  what is it they're fighting for?  dropping bombs on everybody and their mother  their children.   taking lives left and right  because they have to get their point across  because the only way to make an impression  is to drop bombs filled with shrapnel and  misplaced hate  just like hiroshima  thousands are reduced to ash  in order to frighten the enemy  into submission  millions of lives are lost to senseless  explosions  and always is there  killing,   killing,   killing  killing death some of the only concepts on  this planet that gives humans an  opportunity to take a step back  and say  '',  how can i live this way?  how can i live this way when  across the country,  across the  world someone just like me is  having their plans slip out of their  hands  along with their life a family just like mine is being  robbed of something  irreplaceable''  or so one would think  one would think that us as  human beings could empathize and see another side  besides our own our own petty problems  our own life or death moments  when starbucks didnâ’t get our  order right  take that step back  consider the bigger picture  death is not a little thing.   death is enormous.   it is bigger than the world  and to see it you must open your mind.   ''get the big picture!''  donâ’t get so close  that you become blind  take a step back  and realize the real lies  that you're being told  because life is a beautiful lie  and death is a painful truth  and standing there  with the truth in your hands  you wonder why everyone else  doesnâ’t rethink their  morals  why they don't change their ways and try to make a difference.   and suddenly  it hits you.   and it hits you  and it hits you  and it hits you  those words that pack a punch  more powerful than your wall  youâ’ve put up  youâ’re different  each and every god damn one of you is different  every one of your warm little bodies is beautiful  every mind has a novel  a poem  a world changing idea  but  what if they never lived to share any of that?  what if the words that you take for granted  become the center of someone else's world  they begin to think  and think  and then sink  sink down to the darkest places  of their minds  where not a single light can be found  and the candles have been snuffed out  by a hand  by a voice  by a facebook post  take time to consider that  not everyone can be strong  enough all the time to turn  around and fight back  imagine if you were the reason  for that gun to be loaded  for that noose to be tied  for those pills to be popped  i ask you please  just take the time  it's the hidden pain  caused by the careless  the ignorant  the cruel  that drives them to it.   suicide.   it is the cowardice of those  who spit hateful words  and because of them  thousands have died.   just like the 13 year old girl  half way around the world  she took her life  because the people around her  couldn't keep  their mouths shut.   i'd never met her  but that girl and i?  we were family.   nearly 30, 000 american lives  are lost to suicide  each year  so don't try and justify  the crime.   because there are lives on the line.   lives  hanging by a thread  trying to crawl back up  to the top of the cliff  or not  because maybe  they've already gone over the edge.    over the edge into a cavern where there is  nothing but the words that they  have shot at you  shot at you like an arrow that was pulled back with  the force of someone weak  someone too weak to speak with  words of kindness  instead they choose little bombs  little bombs that they ignite with  their own fright  they pull the pin with their own sin  and then they throw with their own sorrow  hoping that wherever it lands  the explosion will erase their own hurt  their own  insecurities-ies-eas-easing themselves into a place where  they can sit back relax and watch their little bombs destroy another's life  now listen  if you don't have anything nice to say  then here let me put the  duct tape of grace over your condescending face  no more bombing  just  peace  if you have nothing  kind to say  then do not even open your mouth  because your words  your little bombs  will change a life  so ask yourself  before you pull the pin  before you light the fuse  are you willing to use  your pain  to gain control  over someone else?  are you willing?  to witness another's strife  to beat them down  to push them  over the edge  in order to feel  better about yourself?  go ahead and  drop your bombs  onto those  struggling up from the abyss  let the words spill  from your mouth  make the fuse burn faster  and tell me  how does it feel?  to be responsible  to carry the guilt  to be the cause of death?  how does it feel?  to have that sound  rain down  from your mouth  to know that soon  theyâ’ll be in  over their heads  suffocating  on everything you've ever thrown at them  every time you shoved them to the ground  or drowning  in every ugly word you've ever said?  just stop!  just take a moment  to consider their pain  and think  do your words make their mark?  or pierce the heart  just like shrapnel  from  your  little bombs?

title: Football Life
author: justin
text: thinking of football really brings me down.  throughout the day i get really depressed.  practice after school leaves me with a frown.  with so little time i get pretty stressâ’d.   knowing practice is going to be tough.  i canâ’t think of anything but my pain.  when you hear time to run,  itâ’s not a bluff.  itâ’s not what you lose,  itâ’s what you can gain.   but then i think of friday night,  game day.  i get that rush,  feel my energy flowing.  itâ’s when all that hard work comes into play.  i know itâ’s going to be a great day.   this is when i look back at my decisions.  and say iâ’m happy i played football.

title: On the ocean mantled blue
author: justin
text: on the ocean mantled blue,  there was two lovers,  one a elven princess,  the other a human mortal.   on this ocean mantled blue,  the elven princess was immortal but could still be killed by a sword,  arrow or poison.   on the ocean mantled blue,  there was a great war,  a war between dragons and elves,  the human mortal killed a dragon,  the dragon king,  but as he died.     on the ocean mantled blue,  the elven princess weeps,  for her lover,  to never to be see again other than in the heavens and the stars.

title: M.O.M.M. (My Ode to My Mother)
author: justin
text: as red as a rose,   as white as a dove,  as blue as the sky,   as strong as my love,  you gave me the power to breathe and to see,  and when i was troubled,  you comforted me,  i wish there was some simple way to explain,  the way that you helped me surpass all the pain,  all the money and diamonds,  could never amount,  to all of the unconditional love you gave out,  as my mother,  my angel,  i owe you my soul,  for the strength in your spirit,  has kept you so bold,  as i walk,  as i read,  as i breathe,  as i see,  i am always reminded,  of the life you gave me,  and for that,  i am grateful,  i would just like to say,  you've earned and deserve it mom,  this is your day. . .

title: We belong to the sea
author: kabir
text: who am i in front of the mighty sea,  whose ends we can never see,  waves rushing to the shores  trying to escape it's might,  aren't we all doing the same this thought caught my sight.   waves trying to get to land which is oh so stable,  the might of the sea making them feeble,  we too,  be it financial or emotional ,  rush towards stability  always kept by limited capability and unlimited liability.   what i suggest to the waves,  is what i suggest to you ,  just think for a moment before everything you do.   the sea is full of life  with so much to offer without it we wouldn't have existed whatsoever.   similar are your difficulties in life they always return more than they take,  you just need a will to fight.   i hope the waves learn fast  and so do we,  because ultimately we all,  belong to the sea.

title: Brian

text: brian treats me very good he has a cute dimple right in his chin his eyes sort of twinkle when he tells me that he is deep in love with me his eyes are a dark brown perfectly proportioned on his handsome face and i can always tell when he has something to say to me

title: Her Morning Elegance
author: kagure
text: her morning elegance  the sun kisses me good morning  through the spaces in the blinds  my forehead,  my nose,  my lip     yet i wake not for any warning  be it even the most unkind  sleeping,  i lie here on my hip.      i dream of us two cycling  neither one behind i dream of always falling  bound,  gagged and blind i dream of never calling  for you to whom iâ’m assigned i dream of sweet rain dancing  for you who i will find there,  your coffee voice calling  for our need to be entwined.  then a breeze kisses me,  adorning  where i hopelessly wake to find  fading reflections,  long sailed on a ship.

title: Gated Freedom
author: kailey
text: when i was a child,  freedom was a myth;  i never knew the feeling of living a bliss;  i was always surrounded by a gate or a wall;  and i never expected what was next to call.   yet somehow i was pleased with all of my limits;  i knew the outside world was not a fun place to visit;  in my own little world i was safe and secure;  i'm now in the real world,  and have much to endure;  now i know,  just how lucky i was;  i now begin to realize i had never a flaws;  when i see how things today,  are just tossed around and hurled;  i then begin to wish that i was in my own little world.

title: Racing Raindrops
author: kaitlyn
text: a slight,  warm breeze gently sways everything in sight.  gray clouds fill the sky like dirty cotton candy.  i look up and my face feels the pinpricks of a fall rain.   the droplets descend faster and faster,  blazing watery trails across the sky and rolling down my cheeks.   i look at the asphalt beneath my feet and see pools forming.  tiny waves echo across each puddle as a raindrop strikes it.  soon,  itâ’s no longer just a drizzle.  the precipitation picks up its pace,  pelting my outstretched palms.  each drop carries an unbelievable weight and force.   i try to beat the rain to my car,  racing across the parking lot.  soaked and drenched,  i soon stop and just embrace the deluge.   i finally reach my car and see droplets running down the windows,   spreading into tiny rivers that split across the windshield.  the drops slip and slide,  always trying to catch up to the one before it.

title: If I Was a Little Older Than a Baby
author: kaiya
text: if i was a little older than a baby i use to think just maybe  maybe oneday i would find her  living on the streets of selling drugs on the corner  if someone would have warned her that she has a child out there somewhere  instead of her trying to find me she couldnt take care of her responsibilties  now i have to sit here and wonder  i refuse to hide under my cover  if only she knew how much i grew  im a women that wont make the same mistakes  i will do whatever it takes  all these years it felt like i had the flu  if i was a little older than a baby  i should have to think maybe  but you wasnt ready to get rid of my graffiti but you was greedy selfish and arrogant now i thank you because im confident i will never become you or a fool  or stand alone on this stool  if i was a little older than a baby  i could only think just maybe

title: Sparky's Sniff
author: kaley
text: when i awoke one morning the dog was by my bed.  i asked,  â“why are you staring at me?â” he tilted his head and said â“my nose detected something,  perhaps some bacon and eggs,   it rose up to your bedroom,  would you help out a dog that begs?â” i laughed and jumped from my bed,  and walked through the kitchen door,  i politely questioned my mother,  â“sparky asks if you have anymore?â”

title: The Old Diary
author: kanchi
text: for yet another a deep sigh,   brandishing the treasures,  memories all low and high!  reminisces,  a pleasurable delight,  carving the magnanimous band,   relief is set forth,  when drops of water bestow upon the deserted land!  reaping the enriched invaluable slots,  relives in the solitary thoughts,  shades of life never enunciated,  like leaves it grows and it rots!  eclipse befalls upon the already tarnishing oblivion,  now lost,  encompassed in the divine bubble rejuvenates the merry frost!  every negligent drop,  enhances the tank,  a journey too far,  yet it vanishes,  turns faint,   illusions is the teeming passion, realistic fancies never to elude,  one has to paint! and for just another sigh,  i go,  and lies replenishing the canvas of the exotic blend,  my life sublimes,  a moment high!

title: We are the stars and the planets
author: kara
text: you are the day sky i am the night sky neither of us can exist without the other you are bright,  open,  and hopeful i am dark,  void,  and pessimistic you have your cloudy days,  but the clouds always fade away i am forever dark,  only sometimes having the stars highlight my existence some people do find beauty in me,  appreciating the way i can vary but almost everyone knows you are the star of the show.  you are the sun,  and i am the moon my light cannot exist without you.  we make way for each other,  giving up the skies so the other may shine you make me remember that i carry universes and constellations within my soul if only i reach beyond the darkness i help you never forget that you brighten everyoneâ’s day we are the skies,  and the planets together and i donâ’t know what iâ’d do without you

title: The stork's surprise
author: kari
text: when i awoke one morning  a stork was on my head.   i asked,  ''what are you doing there?'' it looked at me and said,   ''i'm here to bring you a bundle of joy no it's not a toy it may be a girl,  it may be a boy does that matter? will your world be shattered?''   ''oh no, ''  i exclaimed with joy in my voice ''there's nothing better than hearing that tiny cry and then i rejoice.  thanks for bringing the greatest gift of all, ''  ''not me, '' said the stork ,  ''this was god's call. ''

title: I'm here for you
author: karin
text: don't do this to yourself  not with me. . .   don't be scared. . .  don't hold yourself back  don't push me away   cry if you want to  let out your feelings cause i'll be your shade when everyone's watching. .  i'll holdâ  you and tell you it's gonna be alright. . .   but don't say it's okay when you know it's not . . .  don't smile at me when inside you're hurt. .   don't hide your feelings from me too,  cause i can't stand seeing you this way . . .  let me share your pain cause it's us now and not only you. .   take me to your world ,  i'm here for you.

title: The Magical Love
author: karishma
text: what is love?  yet not found the answer.   is it sweet as chocolate,   or sour as the vinegar?     love is beautiful  brighter than the red rose  what would it look like  for a pic when it would pose?     love is vast as the sky  deeper than the sea  what must i do  when it drowns me?     love is shy and silent  but a melodious music!  burns itself to spread light  selflessly as the candle's wick!     love is a garden  colorful flowers with pricky thorns  sweet is the pain of parting  and hopes of reuniting on the lawns.      love is a book  new surprise,  brings every page.   you want to continue reading  throughout the age.      love is worship  pure,  honest,  true  having blind faith on it  such people are few.      love is a language  the eyes,  the blush,  the touch  are enough to say it all  need of words is not much.      love is crazy  weird things it'll make you do.   climbing up to the balcony  like a monkey in the zoo!     love is love  one of its kind  very powerful and magical  everywhere you'll find.

title: The Unkept Path
author: kate
text: i walk along the unkept path,  a shadow in the mist.   twas the ghostly glow of fallen snow that brought me to this place.   the tumult of silence screams in my ears while the laughter of the wind cuts my face.  the pine needles reach out joyfully,  at what is left  of a diminished soul.   the darkened night dances down,  smashing shards of light towards the heavens as the smoky fog snakes around the moss covered rocks engrossing me in its presence.   i stand here,  silent.  and watch the moments go as they may.  if hours could mend a broken heart iâ’d give all my time away.   perhaps my fate is left untold.  the secrets i never did say are locked inside my heart for all eternity they will stay.    but furthermore i've said too much or not enough but either way,  the path calls me back,  and i walk with it a ways.

title: The Bad Day
author: katelyn
text: let me tell you all a story,  a story about my day,  it started off quite bad,  and got worse along the way,  i woke up late for school,  and had to quickly rush,  i didnâ’t get my breakfast,  my teeth i didnâ’t brush.  my socks they didnâ’t match,  iâ’m in an dreadful fuss,  now whereâ’d i put my shoes,  iâ’m going to miss the bus! i grabbed my bag of books,  and out the door i ran,  iâ’m going to catch the bus,  i can,  i know i can.  i made it to the stop,  but something wasnâ’t right,  iâ’m the only kid around,  no other kids in sight,  and that is when it hit me,  now all i have to say,  is iâ’m going back to bed,  for today is saturday!!

title: From Colorful to Colorless
author: kathirvel
text: colors,  colors,  wonderful colors! thousands and thousands of colors do exist of which only few interest us,  become likely of us we come across so many colors in flowers,  in land,  in trees,  in the sky,  in the sun,  in the moon,   and what not on earth has no color? even the most complex creatures of god has colors in 'em.   colors,  colors,  intriguing colors! colors mark one's character,  colors define one's personality,  colors change one's perspective,  colors stand as identities,  colors convey emotions better colors help one effectively communicate  colors are the loveliest of creations.   colors,  colors,  disturbing colors! various colors signify various qualities white stands for peace,  red for violence and gore,   yellow and green goes for envy,   pink for the soft-natured,  purple for the determined and grey and black for the evil,  white? red? yellow? green? pink? purple? black? or grey? which color does characterize us???  may we pick any color for now,  only till we come to the last page of life weâ’ll be playing the picking game,  when the day arrives we donâ’t get to pick no color will i or you will see? only a colorless world that awaits our arrival for long will open up and there we lose ourselves along with the beautiful colors that once defined us,  characterized us and was likely of us!

title: Dear Mother Mary,
author: kathy
text: you are such a sweet person and you are so beautiful.  your love is like a candle.  your beauty comes from within and glows for the whole world to see.

title: Into My Heart
author: katie
text: you tiptoed into my heart,  i knew i loved you from the start,  your beautiful hands and face,  a world of filigree and lace,  your smile, your voice, so sweet and dear,  you filled my world with endless cheer,  your on my heart dear sweet one,  you fill my world with endless fun,  togetherness each hug each kiss,  tis all of these i wouldn't miss,  i love the time i tuck you in,  the morning when our days begin,  dear sweet one you'll always be,  the whole wide world and all to me,  i'm thanksful for each hour we spend,  and all the happiness you lend,  it matters not when we're apart,  you'll always live within my heart.

title: COLOR POEM
author: katie
text: if red were a color         it would be a rose           as big as a house            if red were a taset          it would be just like tigers                  blood snow cones                if red were a feeling          it would be love as a new born                if red were a smell        it would be smelly as a rose            if red were a sound           it would be soft as a humming                         bird

title: Impish Mind Games
author: katie
text: where mortals live is where you shall go-- anything better you will not know.  i on you will pour this dye,  upon your soul and on lidâ’s eye.  this place iâ’ll make evade your mind,  this magical site with its clandestine kind.  with me this encounter does not exist; this potion it your figment twists.  so,  still you are beneath the tree daydreaming of something other than me.

title: HUMANITY LOSE ITS MEANING WITHOUT TEARS
author: kaveri
text: she told herself many a times to cry when miseries happen.  but someone told her: ''the weak people cry'' while others told her: ''the sound of a cry is  a symbol of destruction itself''.   she listened to all and all she could find in herself  was a body without an architecture  of emotion.    she calls it stone-hearted.  all she could change in her  life without tears was transferring herself from 'she' to 'it'.   soon this stone-hearted thing was hammered with jealousy and pride  and found emptiness in life without comparision and judgements.   what else she could have done  when she didn't even felt the  tears of grief.   now that she realises that sound of  a cry is filled with innocence,  so she never tells her baby to stop crying when sad and lost.   she says: ''man cries even after knowing  they are mortal at the death of  his beloved.  this shows humanity  and not weakness.  this shows purity  and not self-harm''.

title: Stella in Sparkleland
author: kavita
text: every night in sparkleland,  stella wished upon a star!   one day the crooked witch planned to steal each and every star!   on her icky mucky stick,  she flew high up in the sky.    the crone played her nasty trick,  and plucked all stars in one try!   the hag stuck them to her dress,  it looked pretty for the dance.    so stella was in distress,  and wanted to take a chance.    she summoned the purple fairy,  who sprinkled pink magic sparkle!   she swapped all the stars stud glary,  with pure diamonds that did twinkle!   the witch was stirring her brew,  with her head inside her pot.    so never learnt what was true,  of her blue dress on the cot!   then the witch danced in the rain,  and the fairy flew afar!   and then every night again,  stella wished upon a star!

title: I love you

text: i love you  i love every piece of you.   my heart flutters when i see you and it aches for your longing when you leave  i love you  i love everything about you.   i love the way you brush my hair from my face when i fall asleep next to you  and the way you spin me around like iâ’m the only girl in the world   i love you  i love you beyond words.   i love the idea of us together  i hold onto the hope that one day we may but some things are not meant to be

text: the choir is going to start their song we walked on stage in position to dance we all knew it would go terribly wrong the whole group was in a hesitant stance:  when singing it,  it was going okay could've been better,  it could've been worse the choir wasn't content with the day it seemed as though we were under a curse:  there was nothing we could possibly do until the a capella walked forward we,  knightmusik sang and pushed our way through then the choir said thank you to the lord with happiness we were about to burst,  it wasn't the best,  it wasn't the worst.

title: Tweenage Years

text: if when i see you i am wearing toothpaste on my face donâ’t worry because it is a mask for my blemishes although it may just be mayonnaise from the sandwich i ate earlier.   even though i fiddle with the keys  on my old baby grand piano,  i donâ’t actually know how to play it.  since this may all be deja vu  from the whirlwind life i lived in my tweens,  pay no mind to it.

title: Consumed
author: keanu
text: what have you done to me? blood drips from the knife that's through me she was me,  as i was her,  but you couldn't shake the past and took it all away her sunrays that beamed me,  is now consumed by the darkness,  no longer free these demons crawling in by skin,  these scars deep within won't go castaway contagious smile made life seem to be ore worth to make last threatened with a government's joke and now death's hands around to choke demons now consuming every part of me and i feel i just got trashed jump inside my mind and everything is broke,  in flames and in smoke is there any light? can life back off cuz i no longer stand tall the shadow man stands behind me and it brought the old bullet back the same bullet that was shot at m,  though the war and thick wall i struggle to see,  i struggle to breath,  pain is what i want to lack i'm moving slowly,  life is a pain but take the knife out i'm going insane it's gone now,  a flicker of light.  this pain will no longer remain.

title: Enraged
author: kelli
text: enraged once again,   he strikes with a grin.  his heart black as night,   his soul filled with sin.  she covers her face as she weeps.   remembering every promise made,  he never keeps.  each night she prays not to wake before she sleeps.   every day another harsh word,  another harsh blow.  will it he retreat? she doesn't believe it to be so.  inside she feels broken and low.  she has lost her pride and dignity due to being abused.  bludgeoned,   battered,  beaten,   bruised.  her life is the only thing she has left to loose

title: A Child's Cape Cod
author: kelly
text: â“oh,  how i love the beach!â”  sandy,  sandy,  salty toes rosy cheeks and sunburned nose candy necklace 'round my throat love to sail in daddy's boat  suntanned skin and sunscreened hair shirtless,  shoeless,  feet are bare anchor tattoos and pirate chests sandcastles,  crabs and seagull's nests  buckets,  shovels,  trowels and pails rainbow colored sunfish sails penny candy,  ice cream cones shells and stones and crab claw bones  swimming in the salty sea yelling loudly,  â“i have to pee!â” sandy snack and sandy drink skies of blue,  yellow and pink  â“time to go, â” i hear mom say announcing the end of my beach day â“goodbye beach,  see you soon. â” â“how's tomorrow right around noon?â”  â“oh,  how i love the beach!â”

title: Untitled part 1
author: kellyse
text: how the world to me is not sweet but bitter how i feel so alone why canâ’t i be happy and chappy like i used to be?,  and i swore to myself everything would be alright but really can i fight this fight? because everything i do never seems to be right.  so i whisper to myself what a disgrace.  i want to hide away,  why canâ’t everything be okay today? my heads all over the place and itâ’s so hard for me so i guess i wonâ’t be able to attend the race,  its seems like people think iâ’m a waste of space,  i was obviously misplaced born in the wrong time and in the wrong place,  or didnâ’t anybody love me in the first place?  this is so like an obstacle race that i could never finish but iâ’m going to try again and again till it finally works,  amen.  i canâ’t wait for the day i look up to the sky and sing a lullaby because i know then i did try.  i donâ’t know whatâ’s going to happen,  but like i said before can i really fight this fight or will it have to be goodnight iâ’ve got cuts on my arms from my little friend the blade he helps me more than most from being torn apart,  he gives me pain that i need.  as the blood trickles down i try not to frown but will i ever drown? thatâ’s up to you to answer will anyone save me from this monster before the whole of me is gone or will i just build up and weigh such a ton? but my days are done my days are over as that tear runs down my cheek i know now itâ’s time to go to sleep with no explanation or no warning,  i guess itâ’s time to say goodbye  this is my little poem with not really an ending thatâ’s why itâ’s called untitled.

title: Race
author: kelvin
text: walking down the valley yearning for the other side,  of mountains and rivers i overcome,  i walk the very fast step uncertain what lies ahead,  so every step brings me closer to the triumph.   of dusty road that pilot to the boulevard,  each gulp of dust makes it harder for the journey,  with the passion of the trophy i trek even more,  knowing that after the boulevard all the dust will be gone.   of rivers i crossed my clothes as drenched,  each impetus pushing me forward like a duck,  as the fast moving water making me fall back,  with the river behind me nothing then is refreshing.   the climbs equally breathtaking with each climb a twig comes to my rescue,  unsure of the time i will take to make it to the top,  falling and picking myself not even scorching sun and thorns didnâ’t spared i,  the thought of where i have been keeps lingering . . .  you have to make it.   harder it is to make it through down the slope,  each step down the valley with anticipation,  the sight of the very spot the faster the strides,  gravity outshines my potency i takes to my heels.   prejudice obliterate my morale only a cliff was my sight,  weary i was that wish there was a fast rewind to my first step,  wishes they were; but i had to surge ahead and rally ahead for victory,  only to realize i was minutes late despite the effort.  again ! i was in water trying to swim myself out; it then came to my mind it wasnâ’t a race afterall- it was life!

title: Falling asleep in class
author: kenn
text: i fell asleep in class today as i was alfully board i laid my head upon my desk closed my eyes and snored,  i woke to find a peice of paper sticking to my face i had slobbered on my text books and my hair was a disgrace my clothes were badly rumpeled and my eyes were gazing red my binder had left a three ring indention in my head,  i slept through class today and would have slept some more exsept my students woke me as they headed out the door!

title: She..
author: kennedy
text: she wore her confidence like a thin sweater in august  barely staying on through the overwhelming heat   she loved like her soul depended on it  she quoted her bible like she was afraid the words would wither away   she sang her heart out like she would never express another emotion again she cried like she was the queen of the sea stars and the underworld  she was memorable like a black and white girl youâ’d seen in a picture frame when you bought it new she wore lipstick as if it masked her nerves and made her stand out   she read into situations with the eyes of truth trying to hide the hurt  she believed in others because she wanted the world to be a better place  she is more capable than she would ever know she loves with honesty and an open heart  she knows where her happiness lies,  because she seeks beauty in all things  she protects her heart poorly because she trusts her heavenly father she expects her own perfection because she strives to reach further  than the highest star in the stormy sky   she speaks to others with a tender loving voice  because she cares about her relationships with others   she soars through the world in search of her dreams she lives knowing she is loved  she wears her sweater with pride she is a free spirit with a wild mind.

title: The Porcelain heart
author: kenneth
text: the porcelain heart theoâ’s finest gloss,  painted by the finest artist past,  the presents,  of kings where made to last; inside words where inlayed unspoken,  never to be until broken,  the heart held her token the largest of diamonds be,  to never shine,  like she,  brought a crossed of endless seas for,  her,  above all of all beauties be,  not just spoken but fertile.  and; full of growth,  intimacies of love,  a white dove passing poets note,  to note.  from ancient time,  three words divine,  in flight to your heart and mine shall always be for throughout all kingdoms will see no flower will be without the iâ” the fragile heartâ’ holds the symbol of love forever with you,  my present,  words upon lips,  shall always be,  i love you….

title: Laughing Leaves
author: kenneth
text: the laughing leaves at play a translucent shine to a leafy crown of day the tire spun empty swung and flung  as if commanded owned was the leaves swirling around,  the ground she posed and paused in suns light  a momentâ’s glance,  just of sight so luck would say hear her,  in a load world,  for i had caught the leaves of brown showers of sound fluttering; like butterflies a close-up shot of ghostly eyes she shines in light of the sun,  basking in september,   blowing in a crown of leaves to remember their fun,  hid and seek,  the one  they both took,  at plays turn,   the princess and the ghost laughing,  walking on the wind  they whispered with crackled leaves flying hair,  that fluttered followed by,  disappearing.

title: Plain Ole Life
author: kerrigan
text: plain ole life  free your mind of the hurt that has been done unto you  free you soul of the sorrow and the sin that you often do  you can do it on your own remember you got this!  your life can be turned to a wonderful bliss  but if you insist. . .  on living so your emotions can burn to a crisp  you can! it's your choice. . .   your emotions,  your soul,  your heart won't be so cold  after you just,  let,  go!  you don't need our help we're mortal,  we're man  free your heart of all of the hurt if you can  its hard,  you're whole life you've been played like a card  and now all of a sudden i bombard . . .  you,  with the truth,  with reality  you now get to see its true barbarity  itâ’s hard to see,  if you ask just me…  you have to dig deep in the caverns of your soul  all of your pain can't just be pushed aside into one little cubbyhole  you've been lied to ,  denied your independence  you show your resentment and it doesn't work  you're inert to see the truth!!  and have yet to show ruth or compassion  that all the while . . .  just plain ole life was your assassin

title: Can I get out
author: ketly
text: a lot of people can get on my nerves.   on certain days i want to scream and shout.   i always try my best to dodge their curves,  but i can not seem to find a way out    when they give me a biter kind of look,   and i really do not know the reason.   on my bad days i want to throw a book.   it's only because they are the reason.    yet on my bad days i still understand,   yet i know that people have there problems.   iâ’m certain i know there life isn't grand.  eventually they will start to blossom.    when you look at it everything works out,    now i understand and won't have to shout

title: Wave of Peace

text: in conception we are created to come to life itâ’s even dated we start as babyâ’s small and meek we are not strong but oh so weak we drink the milk to help us grow it takeâ’s so long it is so slow we start to learn our lessonâ’s now from day to day from here and now we start at school and so we learn then we leave and start to earn  we go to work most every day there to earn and not to play  and through our life we hope and pray to meet our love to wed one day the time has come to create new life in godâ’s eyes as man and wife now comes the time we all will know for yes itâ’s time we all must go and so we leave this earthly plane the lessonâ’s learned the joyâ’s the pains the spirit leaveâ’s the earthly tieâ’s the tearâ’s the woes and loved oneâ’s cries and so the cycle startâ’s again the joyâ’s the loveâ’s the tearâ’s the pain

title: The Indigo
author: kevin
text: the indigo is in full bloom,  it knows it's time is soon,  born from the sky,  destined to fly,  the indigo will show us truth  people don't understand the indigo,   they tell it how to grow and where to go,  souls bound for different meaning,  the indigo shines like the sun is gleaming,  the people will put down the truth  the world is a filthy place full of deceit,   the indigo will bring an era of defeat,  to the current standard and regulations,  the indigo is here to change the nations,  the world will see and accept the truth.
