title: The Feather of a Peacock
author: kilion
text: the feathers of a peacock     mens mindâ’s like the feathers of a peacock,  both with twists and curves and colorâ’s splendor.   born unique to a  quite different flock,  greater powers want us to surrender.     tell us what is right,  tell us what is wrong.  happiness comes from a good job and wealth.   to me it sounds like a sorrowed swan song.   colors of feathers fade with our own health.     but maybe they know what is best for us,  living in my shoes,  walking in my mind.  teach us conformity,  thatâ’s what i see.  but they are removing the peacocks spine.    our souls are colorful,  all different.  letâ’s not regret the time on earth we spent.

title: Peace is...
author: kim
text: peace is waking up and being pain free.  peace is a quiet house.  peace is a world without guns.  peace is not free.

title: I Weep in Silence
author: kim
text: i weep in silence like the willow tree branches that blow in the wind.   i weep in silence for forgiveness in my short fallings.   i weep in silence for acceptance in who i am.   i weep in silence for knowledge i do not have.   i weep in silence for trustworthiness,  endearment and dignity.   i weep in silence for optimism and fulifillment im myself.   i weep in silence for approval to be myself.

title: One's Feelings
author: kimberly
text: i sat down put pen to paper to let you know how i feel about you.  days and nights go by and i wonder if you and i will be more.  thoughts go through my head.  should i try or let you go bye? our lives so different but yet the same in many ways.  you mean more to me than words could describe,  but yet i sit and wonder if you and i could be as one.  so for now i'll sit and wonder if you and i will ever be.

title: More Than That
author: kimberly
text: i love you more than words can say.  i wish i could see you everyday.  i need you to be with me so that you can see how much you mean to me.  oh boy i want to be with you through thick & thin,  good & bad & happy & sad.  i love you more than that.

title: Ride to the end
author: kirk
text: 19 years old,  i just had enough,  my family dont care,  they treat me too rough,   bullied in school,   and bullied through work,  i've always been nice,  never a jerk,   well its night time,  parents are sleeping,   im bored sat here,   tired of weeping,   the time has come,   to pack up and go,  my destination,  my friend,  i just dont know,   i grabbed my coat,  turned off the t. v,  this is the last time,  they will see me,   wont use the car,   will wake mum and dad,  they wont care,  all they do is get mad,   take out my bike,  and away i go,   through the breezy wind,  and the crisp white snow,    riding down the street,  cars passing me by,  i think of my memories,  im starting to cry,   where did it go wrong,  what did i do,  all i ever wanted,  was to hear i love you,   i see a cliff,   thats where i will ride,  no one will care,  when they heard that i died,   im as scared as ever,  as i've always been,  so lonely just me,   and my riding machine,    i approach the cliff edge,  the time has come,  my life isnt worth living,  i will say bye,  im gone and done

title: ANOTHER WORLD
author: kishan
text: i walk everyday through,  same street, same faces and same story,  i started finding the reasons of life,  why folks are living on this tiny planet,  since decades and no reasons found.   everyday woke up with the desultory,  of knowing the reason behind life,  so made up my mind to run away,  from all the cruel streets,  where money is not the only treat.   suddenly, i started following a light,  in the world of complete darkness,  i blinked my eyes ,  and i saw another world,  no discrimination,  peace and love.   i saw my mother in another world.  she kept calling my name,  bam! this world came to the end.  i found myself laid on the bed,  hope that world really exist,  i felt so blue.

title: Dry Eyes And Frozen Tears
author: kishan
text: dry eyes and frozen tears  an old man walks through the street his poverty finds noâ humanâ to greet so miserable and so hungry is this man to feed his family he does what he can his resentment can be seen on his face as his fate doesn't exist in human race this poor old man all tattered and torn god,  to survive in poverty was he born can he ever enjoy the chimes of pine god,  when his unlucky destiny will shine many questions his eyes want to know  to this merciless world why he has to bow from rain drops he has never felt any kiss why every opportunity he only has to miss god,  to him how can you do this injustice when in the heaven you are chief-justice he has no food to eat,  no cloth to wear god,  this discrimination how can you bear why this man was born poor and homeless who has never felt what is cheerfulness he doesn't know for whom the sun rises why he is destitute this question arises no sympathy,  he needs only a chance so that with enthusiasm he can dance god,  his dreams are hunger in his eyes that are eager to touch the blue skies' science has reached the moon and the mars  but to remove his penury thereâ are no wars we have piled up so many weapons for peace but nothing done for his poverty to cease god,  why his tears are frozen and eyes are dry why you have sent him on this earth to cry

title: If I Were A Pioet
author: kishan
text: if i were a poet  if i were a poet i would have sketched  my hidden thoughts on snow mountains for never melting when shining sun passes through the angelic heights of mountains he would feel happy  that a poet dropped  a birthday message for him  if i were a poet i would have painted the clouds with my dreamy thoughts never to evanescent stars and moon from the heaven would feel delighted  that a poet painted their dreams on clouds for their anniversary to come  if i were a poet i would have inscribed my poetic ideas on waves of blue ocean never to vaporize sky looking down the sea-waves would feel pleasure that a motivational poet  has left a magical idea for him to go through fire and water  if i were a poet i would have imprinted romantic words on the glowing face of rainbow never to fade away earth and sky from the horizon would fall in love with each other to read the romantic words on the rainbow a poet has left for their existent relationship  )

title: My Boss Is Retiring
author: kishan
text: my boss is retiring  sir,  your are retiring today from your job leaving us all with your memories to sob though you have always been a strict boss but to us,  probably,  this is a huge loss  many tangled files very clearly you resolved because you know our best team was involved how to keep the file pending for a long time sir,  you only taught us that this is not a crime  we will always miss your cute scattered beard and shining bald head that looked very weird missing from work you will be in the canteen  taking your new love ahead with ms.  jasmine  working under you was really a great pleasure you will not be here to gossip in our leisure your sensual and sly smile we will not see again your love tips will always be a healthy grain  sir,  for your new life we all wish you best of luck live like a young buddy and don't be a dead duck again you can fall in love with your cute wife and feel at home in her arms for the whole life

title: Always...
author: krupali
text: how long could you say no? how long could you overlook the beauty?  life's not to sulk with hands on head rather a fest to rejoice and glow though with thorns and not alone a rose bed slow down, take a chance to look around life's beautiful always. .   happiness isn't a drop of dew,  now it is, later it isn't.  rather it moisture in the air.  open your arms and breathe in,  happiness is within you always. . .   how could you possibly reject it? how could you not see through?  though oceans get wilder sometimes,  darker nights turn on the new moon night,  but not to forget, this too shall pass.  look through as the moon still shines bright.  full moon comes around always. .   life isn't straight but a maze,  you might get lost and lose track it might get scary and tempt you to quit realise you're not alone, as up you gaze,  have faith in him always. .   how could you not smile to the life? how could you not hold on?  stay calm, keep holding on.  spell is being casted , rising is the sun,  with a blink, the dark night shall be gone. .  a bright new day shall begin. .  always. . . .

title: These Feelings
author: krystal
text: the feelings i have for you are all balled up.  rocking back and forth like a young child hiding in the back corner.  these feelings that appear to be so close are not close at all.  they are the bloke at the fair saying catch me if you dare.  my feelings are premature,  not ready to be exposed to such a vulnerable world again.  these feelings are weak and new but are not far from being true.

title: Am i dead?
author: kyanne
text: one day i slowly floated away into an emptiness caused by the blank space circulating my thoughts.  i was left at dusk when the moon began to rise and the sun fell behind the clouds beneath the horizon.  i passed along the shoreline with my toes tucked tight in the white sand, the seaweed tangled around my calves and what was left of the rushing waves that caressed my feet.  i walked at a crooked pace leaving my footprints that were later washed away by the coming and going of the waves, the night air breeze crept up under my yellow crotchet blouse and the bestowed sand covered my tight curved skirt which barely reached the midst of my thighs.  the tide became lower and slowly swifted out which calmed the whirling rough sea of this morning, although the ocean waves whispers grew softer, the rubbing of the crickets legs didn't seem to refrain from the long high pitch chirp that irritated my eardrums.  i stared at the white crescent as it rested among the clouds and the stars gazed and twinkled in the center of my eyes, it also reflected on the sea making every crest shine a little brighter as it churned and crashed along the sandy sea-shell shoreline.  i made a wish upon every wave and thought new thought even dreamed a new dream but it never filed in my head it came and went just as the waves did.  i began to grow tired so i knelt down into the cold, moist sand that shifted as my feet collided with it.  since the night had become deeper and darker the sands color became a mysterious dull shade. i rested my head on a horse-shoe crabs skeleton it seemed to be clean and comfortable so i didn't mind.  the wind began to pick up making it colder and harder to find warmth. i reached out for this long shadowy shape which turned out to be seaweed, it reeked of salt and rotten eggs but it could have been put to use so i clasped it close to my chest and around my bumpy arms which were cold and wet due to the sea breeze that carried a salty solution.  i cried out for help in my head screaming, but no one would show, no one cared i was alone, alone for reasons i could not share because i hardly knew.  i dozed off into my empty thoughts and unsure it wasn't hard for me to fall asleep all due to my long walks and freezing white flesh that had been exposed to the midnights air.  i dreamed of nothing all i could see was a blank screen its like my entire life had been erased, gone, vanished, stored away into a box left on this beach, but for what reason that was my question.  the only possible i could think of, the only reason i didn't want to think of was am i dead?

title: A Seraphim Scene
author: kyle
text: your majesty is solely matched,  by still reflection waters cast; a glowing scene of life has hatched,  with naught but quiet peace yet passed.  no beast disturbs; no creature dwells,  to steal the silent bliss away.  dawn rings soft as silver bells,  heard ever clear,  without decay.  solitude then only bettered,  by trails angelic dancers leave,  sky across their joy unfettered,  distorted dreams of color weave.  such painted brilliance fills the air,  lights empyrean to canvas,  that shining psyche pines compare,  your beauty vast ascends boundless.

title: Thanks For All The Pain
author: kyle
text: thank you for the pain you have given me.  you set me up just so you can tear me down.  pretending to help me just to hurt me.  others see you as an angel.  i see the real you.  you are a snake in a fake skin.   you suround me,  like the snake you are,  pretending you want to guide me.  you point me the way just so you can stab me.  constricting,  choking i'm slowly dieing.  biting,  knawing,  you poison me.   your lies will stab me just like your fangs.  they infect me,  fooling me,  so you can play me.  i am not a toy,  though you see different.  you push and pull trying to control.  to you i am dirt.  and i mean nothing.   breaking news! this dirt has feelings.  feelings you hurt for your own game.  you hurt me,  so thank you for the pain.

title: Alone

title: On My Street
author: kyle
text: on my street there is a dog,  i stroll by everyday heâ’s small and soft and brown and white with not a lot to say  i wonder what heâ’s thinking as he sits upon his stoop he seems a little sad,  i think,  for his ears,  they seem to droop  i wonder if heâ’s waiting for his human to come home or maybe he is wondering,  â“whoâ’s gonna answer the phone?â”  but,  no,  itâ’s kind of funny and even sort of silly to think a dog could think those thoughts…could that happen really?  yes,  on my street,  there is dog i stroll by everyday but wait,  whatâ’s that? i thought i heard? â“can you come out and play?â”

text: when our lives begin we make many friends,  we make cherishing memories to keep,  some friends donâ’t stick around they just pretend,  and when they betray you donâ’t ever weep: those certain people will never be true,  they also lie and they say they will pray,  make the best of life and always be you,  god will not judge tho his words he may say: yet i have my woes that are by my side,  they make me remember what true friends do,  no matter what happens they always ride,  when we are happy i never feel blue,  even though i have one un loyal friend,  i have many that will stick till the end.

title: God
author: lalitha
text: in your smile in the sunshine in the leaves green in the azure blues as i lay upon my back and sleep in the nature's bed i can feel the touch of god tenderly he curls around in an aroma into my nostrils as a musical note into my heart as a raindrop when the hotness tears me apart dry he is in you and she yet i love to call him he he can dance and fight too in valour and modesty too he nests his eggs are kids of innocence in kind words he skates a by in timely help he glitters shy my god is not in churches nor in temples and mosques he is with me around my looks guiding me like a star giggling with humour every stride in my pain he silently sobbs watches me quietly when i sin papa is he,  mama is he,  you and me in love he is the full moon night.

title: A Woman's Dance
author: laramie
text: i pound the earth beneath my feet,  the air swirling around me sweet,  the storm inside gives way to calm,  as the veil flows and flutters in my arms.  the rain sparkles in my eyes,  velvet night and starry skies,  a smile of joy,  a glimpse of sorrow,  i live today and hope of tomorrow.  this is a womanâ’s dance,   grace of being and confidence,  born not of youth or even beauty,  but living,  breathing,  creativity.

title: Love
author: laura
text: love  love is a feeling you have for someone deep inside and you care for them so much,  when you love someone each day,  you always take care of them,  and be with them,  even if they are having a sad day you will hold them and tell them its ok,   love is always around us each day whether we feel it or see it,  its happiness all around us,  when someone is hurt or injured and you love them,   you will cry each day hoping they will become better,  love is emotional,  love is what fills the air with happiness and joy,  when you love someone you hug them,  kiss them,  hold them in your arms and tell them that you love them with all your heart and soul.  you will promise things to them,  promising that you will never hurt them or leave them and that you will always be with them for ever.  love is a great thing and beautiful and lovely thing.

title: If We Meet Again
author: lauren
text: stop telling yourself  that weâ’ll meet again,   and fall in love  just to make yourself feel better  over missing countless opportunities  to tell me you loved me,   or to treat me better because you had so many opportunities  and you just didn't take them.   and i promise you  that if one day we do meet again,   due to a miraculous twist of fate,    i will not fall in love with you.   we will not live happily ever after.   all will not be forgotten.   you will always be the boy  i loved so intensely   and i will always be the girl  who wasn't worth the fight.

title: HOW TIME LAPSED
author: lekshmi mini
text: i never knew how time lapsed my face all wrinkled now  that i once was a beautiful maiden the face i owned then was loved by all.   i never knew how time lapsed my memories dying now that i once kept them cherished  of those who i loved the most.   though time lapsed  my face wrinkled my memories dying i always kept my love alive.   it was lost forever from me but still remains in my heart all the love i wanted to give to get.    i never knew how i fell in love but i knew i was the feel was so nice like heaven on earth  the feel was nice so saccharine that i wanted it to last longer.   i knew it wouldn't and i was right as time lapsed it took me away far away but my love was cherished  and the face so clearly among all.     time lapsed,  my face wrinkled my memories dying my heart beating faster i lonely await that i once will get it back.   knew that was childlike but a ray of hope  still lingered in me.   itâ’s a moonlit night a night i always dreamed of i hoped ,  i wished ,  i prayed that i could live my life again  i could see the face i longed to meet.        my heart was giving up iâ’ll sleep forever if i missed a beat i never let my lids close for i still had a ray of hope lingering in me  awaiting the face i longed to meet the love i longed to get the love iâ’d lost forever…….   my heart giving up but the ray of hope can hold me on i thought……….   time lapsed i lost hope,  i welcomed death i knew it was coming i knew it was inevitable  my lids were closing the ray of hope vanished my heart crumbled to pieces  my lids closing my breath slowed…… i didn't want to die the darkness pulling me i wanted to live the dream  to get the love i longed for the face i longed to meet knew my life was worthless but still wished to live………  i hoped i wished i prayed in the new life i get i wanted the same love the same face to meet…….           i knew i was not wrong               i knew i was right it has happened i lived the dream i wanted to live.

title: Trickle Down Theory
author: len
text: trickle down theory by len b (copyright 2006)   imagine living life  out of a cardboard box,  selling matches in the snow,  walking barefoot through the eye of a needle,  on a downward spiral around and around,  collecting bottles and cans sideways on a ferris wheel,  riding on the bus or subway up to a crowded elevator,  nowhere to go,  just to arrive at a dead end down existant's escalator,  getting nothing more than crumbs to bite on baited hook,  drinking polluted water fro from filthy puddles,  through hoops and obstacle courses,  stoned with drugs and alcohol existing and not living,  suffocating in the toxic air dying on death's lonely streets,  barefoot and naked not affording shoes and socks,  helplessness and hopelessness for bag ladies and bag men,  on the east side and the west side about poverty's port and aft side,  not enough life boats to support us all.  where is the land of bread and honey? where is the land of milk and promise? the titanic sank,  there was nineteen hundred,  twenty-nine.  then came the great depression,  throngs of forsaken people jumping out of port-holed windows,  jumping over blood-crimsoned rails,  jumping through ensnarled spider webs.  dolphins and porpoises watch out for the piranahs and the sharks,  falling,  falling out of rafts riddled with holes.  has the new deal become the raw deal? for only impoverishment is trickling down.

title: Through My Eyes
author: lexie
text: trying to see the world through my eyes is hard  it can be difficult leaving me scarred  all my insecurities and flaws you don't see  wishing all i could do was feel free  i feel trapped like no one can hear me i just wish people would let me be i wish they could feel the pain i feel knowing that it is very much real  my life was turned upside down feeling the tears in which i drown i couldn't see the light i could feel my throat begin to get tight  the pain just won't go away living with the struggles day by day it feels like no help can be found trying with everything i have to keep my feet on the ground  i feel trapped inside this place wishing people would just give me my space i feel like there's no hope  always finding and learning ways i can cope  i now feel like iâ’m being heard my life is no longer being blurred i slowly begin to; again see the light i now have nothing to fear at night  realizing those feelings don't last forever  i won't feel like that again,  not now not ever  my life gets hard at times  but i sit alone waiting to hear the wonderful chimes  life can get hard but never be afraid to let down the guard it will all be okay  just never let it get in your way

text: nice people everywhere,   donâ’t know the shame,  that clouds the air.  bad people next to,  nice people who donâ’t know,  that bad exists.  but nice people donâ’t understand,  where problems arise,  that makes the bad people exist.  why are there bad people? who bring others down,  and damages them from the inside out.  who were once nice,  now they think twice,  whether to be bad or nice.  now nice hardly exists,  in todayâ’s world.  we were born innocent,   and died arrogant.  in order just to get somewhere,  in todayâ’s world,  you got to be bad,  because the nice guy dies,  with nothing to show for in his life.

title: MY MATHEMATICAL LOVE

text: solving my love problem is the hardest thing to do it is like finding for the square root of negative two i know it would be impossible to computa for the answer but i am very sure it's not an imaginary number  my love has the greatest exponent,  the highest degree but still in your world you want to cancel me my feeling for you is not congruent to what you feel but still,  i want to prove to you that this is real  i want to factor-out all the worries in your life but how,  if there's another variable in your mind and heart hoping that even a little percent,  i will have a part but i can't think of any formula that is right  so many questions,  but still i have no solution how did i arrive to 143,  without any operation and now,  i finally have my own conclusion that it is you,  who will satisfy my love-equation. . .

title: My teacher's desk
author: lily
text: i saw the mess she had on it,  my teacher's desk is pretty bad,  with all the junk strewn across,  i say it looks pretty sad,   i asked her if i could clean it up,  all she did was shake her head,  she said, ''i'm waiting for recess,  i have to eat instead. ''  she pulled out her sandwich,  and left the wrapper there,  she got mustard on her desk,  and ketchup in her hair.   then she drank some of her milk,  but spilled it on her paper and pen,  she did it once,  twice,  and all over again!

title: My Best friend
author: lincy
text: you can't give answers to all of my problems,  doubts,   or fears.  but you listened and gave me choices.   you couldnâ’t change my past with all its heartache and pain,   or my future with its stories.  but you have been around to care.   you canâ’t keep me away from stumbling,  but you offered your hand that i may hold it and not fall.   your joys,  triumphs,  successes,  and happiness are not mine;  but i can share in your laughter,  even though i failed many times.   your decisions in life are not mine to make,  or to judge;  i tried to support you and help you whenever you asked.   i can't prevent you from falling away from this friendship,   or from me.  but i can only wish you the best and hope to talk to you now and then till i rest.   i can't give you boundaries which i have determined for you,   though now and then i tried to just make you stay,  because i would fall apart when you go away!  i can't keep your heart from hurting,  when i go wrong,  i am trying beyond all,   but even when i cry the broken pieces are never back in place,  and i am struggling hard to seek solace.   i can't tell you who you are,  i canâ’t tell you what a blessing you are.  i can tell this that when your apart,  itâ’s too much for my heart.  i will always love you and be your friend.

title: THE LITTLE GIRL INSIDE MY HEAD
author: linda
text: there is a little girl inside my head my head that cries  each night as i go to bed.   she cries for her mother who is long since gone.  and she cries for her father who left her alone.   she cries for the times when she remembers the past.  and the pain that she she suffered that forever lasts.   she cries from the memories of innocence lost when she was but ten.   and relives the memories over and over again.   that is the story of the little girl inside my head who cries each night as i go to bed,

title: The Image in My Dream
author: lindsay
text: every night since i was thirteen i have dreamed of a knight in shining armor who has come to rescue me.  i have never seen his face,  that is  until the day that i saw your face,  and those eyes.  as you walked slowly toward me,  no words were spoken for your eyes for you did speak.  i knew that you were the one for me.  my thoughts proved true that night when in my dreams your face filled the empty space on the knight on the white horse who had come to take me away.

title: Morning Attitude

title: The Beauty That Once Was
author: lisa
text: he came like a shining star,  floating in the summer breeze.  his hair was golden,  like the sun.   he had a deep love which no one knows but i alone.   he wore a crown upon his noble head.  his rodes were silver and gold,  but not all that sparkles is gold.  in a far away land dreams he dreamt of pure enchantment.    there were angels at work thet made him happy.  his eyes reflected pure sympathy and love for all.   he was as beautiful as a pink rose.   but at last he will never see.   he did not see it,  nor did he feel it.   it became his journey's end.  and into the light his soul now goes to be free once more.

title: The Miracle
author: lupe
text: people tend to think that winning the lottery is a miracle or surviving an accident that should have killed you!!!  but the true miracle is something you donâ’t see at first itâ’s what you have that counts most,  not wanting more being proud of what your given  family ,  friends,  freedom,  and a safe place to call home.   it is the people the places and the things that make you happy the things that bring you up when you feel like everythingâ’s lost.   this is what makes your life seem so real and nothing can take it away these are the things that make it a miracle.

title: The Little Shy Girl
author: lupita
text: at school this little shy girl felt trapped inside herself.   she had so much to say but just couldnâ’t get the words out or get anybody's attention.   the little shy girl always wanted to answer the questions but someone was always faster than her to answer.   the little shy girl had a lot to offer but offered it in silence.   the little shy girl didnâ’t have a hundred friends but she new she had one friend that she could always count on and make her feel better.  at home the little shy girl would disappear.   she would talk to her family about all the new and fun things she had learned in school,  but would leave out that she may not have spoken a word that day until that moment.   she was talkative and really outgoing at home but she feared tomorrow because she new the shy girl would come back.  this little shy girl grew up and left behind parts of the little shy girl she once was.   she  still had pieces in her but was not as shy as she use to be.   she would go off to college and pursue her dream of becoming a teacher.   she knew becoming a teacher would help a lot of those shy kids in the class room.   she knew she could help them because she knew how it felt to be shy and not being able to express all those thoughts she had in her head because someone always beat her to it or she was just simply afraid to even ask.   the shy little girl will become something extraordinary.

title: Iron Wall Heart
author: lyla
text: an iron wall up,  lest you will bequeath your untamable pain,  to my soul,  that is undeserved of it.   your heart,  a dark,  lonely cave,  pure hollow,  careless to the affliction of my past.   inhale,  exhale,  breathing,  never seemed so burdensome.   the heart is broken glass now,  shards of it puncture through my chest.  you have annihilated me.   no new chapters,  and you shredded up,  previous pages,  and left me with this,  tarnished cover.   this suffering,  has no healing,  this pain,  has lasted too long.   walking down this future path,  i know not to rely on,  an iron wall,  thatâ’s not so strong.

title: Old Glory I'm Free
author: m
text: the sun was beating down upon my face.      the wind was blowing me about.  the american flag,  i pledge my life to being free.  independent i am.  my flag old glory i'm free.  fireworks bursting in air gave proof that our flag was still there.  old glory i'm free.  no other flagso gracious, strong and proud,  of seven red stripes for our shed blood.  six white stripes for purity and tranquility of hearts.  fifty stars that shine in the light.  waving old glory i'm free.  a sight to see,  watching over our father's land.  old glory i'm free.  am a little older,  little wiser,  even a little tired.  a salute to all americans,  old glory i'm free.

title: Softball
author: makenna
text: i take the field,  and wait for my play.  watching each bat swing,  will the ball come my way? making my move,  to catch the ball.  the ball is in my glove,  protecting it not to fall.  one out,  two more to go,  ready to show them all i know.  softball is my sport,   as anyone can see.  i love the outfield,  because it is a part of me.

title: Unprepared soldier

text: he was an unprepared soldier he was a soldier without a weapon he went to a battle field without a skill it was difficult to fight without a shield he tried to fight back and he could have been killed  he felled down into a deep hole without a phone but no one heard him because his voice wasn't loud  he was on his tired body made and pleaded for a wish swollen eyes soaked in tears wished that he did not exist his life was a bad joke an egg without a yolk  somewhere in the night a quiet professional is waiting he does not care that he is tired that his hardened body is sleep deprived he is unbroken and vigilant in his task he has trained all his life in brutal conditions day and night

title: The Truth
author: malefu
text: fantasy is what we desire.  reality is what we need.  life is a meteorite.  life is beautiful.  in a form of fire, but in a form of water.   from a a ninety degree angle,  i see only one side if it.  from a hundred and eighty degree angle i see only what i can  from a three hundred and sixty degree,  i see clearly what my god provides.   it is fictitious or rather a paradox,  but actually it is true.  it is reality.  it is how we feel that matters.  it is how we see that shields us.  it is the life of creativity.   though i feel it is the life of deceiving nature.  it us not our fault.  we are all born of the sin,  but it is how you see and give away,  that counts the race for you.

title: World of the Labyrinth
author: manpreet
text: i stress my eyes pushing them through the ocean full of words.   like a newborn turtle on its way out of sand.   his mosaic-like shell painted with every shade of green.   he ages as he learns more about swimming through the different spaces in nature.   his slow pace back and forth understanding each step he takes.   he learns and teaches young ones until the time he dies out.   i will do the same for i will never have enough.

title: What I see ....
author: marc
text: i see her but she does not see me,   i hear her but she does not hear me,   her perfume committed to memory,   her smile lights up the room,   but her eyes are deep and dark,    i see her soul,   i hear her soul,   i feel her soul,   through her eyes,  deep and dark.

title: But a Sip of Wine
author: margaret
text: come and sit here with me you can spare a minute or so of your time please,  just spare a moment and sit with me i am not a drinker,  but a sip of wine i can always spare i prefer wine over beer or vodka one glass to pass the time  a few to match a champagnes brewery now if you want you may leave not many care for my misery my drinking habits are dull as you could see or will you so kind to have another drink? the taste is quite fulfilling for those that are willing itâ’s almost like sitting outside in victorian eras let us sip this wine as if it were tea w/some candlelight though we are not royalty,  we have one thing in common we both sat down to for but a sip and now we are consumed now let us have one more sip,  would anyone like to join us a bit…

title: War
author: margot
text: war is the one thing that can turn a father against a son.  for when the fight is over,  and all is said and done.  there is no victory,  but a continuous sadness for who,  of all of you,  will have the heart to stop this madness,  sisters,  mothers,  daughters and wives are left now to face this fate.  as of this fateful day,  on this wicked date,  their loved ones met their early death never again shall their bodies fill with breath.  thus is how millions die for one soulâ’s good  and what do we do,  stand by and would that we could in all total,  but save a very precious few,  for they,  in the morning,  shall be covered in dew.  as the cold icy sun rose upon the blood red hill the survivors never forgot those they had to kill.

title: PURITY AND INNOCENCE
author: maria ann
text: she floats on high,  her spirit is free for she has seen inside herself,   a white bird,  feathers soft yet strong.  female and a brilliant white in colour.  she brings her out at night,  she brings her out with peace and joy.  she brings her out to soar the sky,  as she flies to rooftops high.  she reached a building of white,  flying through the soft clouds and cascading sunshine.   resting till the dawn of morn.  rayâ’s of colour thrown all around,  dash,  dashing,  she is dashing to the ground,  spreading the span of her wing taking as she watched,  the whole world in,  a haze of sunshine,  a blanket of morn.  one small child tilts her head in awe,  a little girl of three years old felt and saw,  the beautiful bird and the wondrous rays of love,  she is that pure white dove,  she felt the span of its wing as the bird comes home to rest deep inside her chest.  written by maria ann câ©

title: Healing Open Wounds
author: mariah
text: the aroma of the coffee warm and fuzzy makes me escape my crazy life  sapphire eyes meet mine a scared glint but dulled by abuse dulled by life  soft lips touch mine the door opens dark brown eyes meet mine i pull away  â“you!â” a strikeâ— aimed towards me sounds become silence i black out  my eyes snap open not knowing where i am blue eyes meet mine and the pain subsides

title: Smile
author: mariann
text: you are the sun in my day sky,  and the moon in my night sky.  you are the cause of my happiness,  and the cause of my smile.  you are the reason i wake up every morning,  and the reason i go to sleep at night.  you are in my thoughts all day,  and in my dreams all night.  you are all i think about,  and all i see in my thoughts.  you are the reason for my existence,  and the reason  i am happy right now.  you are the point of my love,  and the owner of my heart.  i love you,  and you love me.  that is all that matters now,  and all that matters ever.   the end

title: I dreamt upon a Poem
author: marianne
text: i dreamt upon a poem,  so delicate as such.  i dreamt upon a poem,  so enchanting to touch.   i dreamt upon a poem,  boy did i ever did cry.  i dreamt upon a poem,  i thought i would touch the sky.   i dreamt upon a poem my darling did not wake me,  i dream upon a poem,  nor did he sting like a bee.   i dream upon a poem so lonely and dark as one could be.  i dream upon a poem,  enlightening beauty set me free.   i dreamt upon a poem i sought thee in the night.  i dreamt upon a poem i saw you like the sun so bright.   i dreamt upon a poem it was you that i saw nearby,  i dreamt upon a poem it was you who taught me my poems could fly.   i dreamt upon a poem.

title: The Quest I
author: mario
text: have you ever been down to the lowest pit & you felt no one gives a hoot keep climbing your day is coming to let the sun in with good vibrations through temptation,  ex- communication & soul vibrations coming apart at the seams filtered through such evil schemes the devil is a viscious fighter but he lost the battle like a cow away from its cattle he thrives on the weak never the meak goes in for the kill with such a cheap thrill comes to kill,  steal & destroy this is his chief aim with ploy  so stand fast in god my friend the one you can depend the surface of the sun has tainted my inner vision setting out on a mission we got friends we need to lean on folks we need to bring along out in the streets where people meet we can mingle playing second fiddle everyday thereâ’s a brand new baby born every night love to keep you warm some may beg to differ by cursing the very day they were born yet wait your turn one soul will soar will the other faint to burn  there is a deep yearning inside of me with hearts to agree stop living in the land of make believe there is more to achieve only one life is soon to be passed only what counts out of love will last yet no one gets by on any free pass a special glance to take things ever deeper start to love your mother and father so why i even bother the message is so simple yet so very true god is never through with you we each go through things in life amidst its added spice think twice vanity of vanities all is vanity never seek for vain glory now this is the end of the story

title: The Journey Where I Found, Knew and Loved
author: marisa
text: i  once climbed atop a staircase  and sat in view of this whole place as it crumbled to the ground,   i looked under the rubble,  i found me.   i once jumped out of the window and watched my shadow as i flew over clouds and skies of blue,  and upon seeing a rainbow,  i knew me.   i once looked at the stars above,  and at the sight of them i couldn't move,  then i felt as light as the wings of a dove,  and it was then that i felt love for me.

title: Little stork in my dream
author: marisa
text: when i awoke one morning,    a little stork was on my head. i   asked,  ''what are you doing there?''   the stork looked at me and said. . .      what do you think i'm doing ?     little lady sleeping in the bed?     today is the first day of school       and you are ''sooo'' late!    the little stork was just tryin to wake      me up . . . when a bigger stork flew in     trying to attack me !    i jumped off my bed ,     and tried to run away     when from afar i heard a voice     calling my name !    it was my mother waking me up     and i told her all about the         interesting dream i had!

title: The Diamond and the Jeweler
author: mark
text: it came from deep within the earth,   a million years or more ago,  god formed its awesome beauty,   from a tiny piece of coal.  though it seems small and delicate,   itâ’s treasured greatly for its worth,  it has more inner strength and beauty,  than all the other gems on earth.  but all alone…untouched by man,  its qualities remain in doubt,  you see,  the diamond needs the jeweler,  to bring its beauty out.   now a man may choose to travel,  many roads throughout his life,  but the road traveled by the jeweler,  takes years of practice,  patience,  strife.  he only has one chance to choose,  he must be right above all cost,  for one mistake…one careless cut,  and a treasure would be lost.  but all alone,  without the gem,  his tools would all be still,  you see,  the jeweler needs the diamond,  to show the world his skill.   when the diamond feels the masterâ’s touch,  its veil heâ’ll soon condemn,  and bursting forth…in all its beauty,  the rough stone becomes â‘the gemâ’… so they become entwined together,  its brilliant luster…his rare skill,  and theyâ’ll both share all eternity,  until the hands of time stand still.  the moral of this story is,  in â‘true loveâ’ there is no â‘rulerâ’,  you see,  they need each other equally,  the diamond…and the jeweler.

title: Last Chance
author: mark
text: at the edge standing not knowing where to go or what to do there your light came shining just like the sun lightens up the darkest room  for this edge was deep and desperate so more thankful i am that you reached out for my arm you reached out for it when i needed it the most didnâ’t let go till i was standing straight again  i do not possess a skill worthy to thank you who can thank for a gift like that only accept,  appreciate and never forget i can all that is a man like me can offer  yet i do not believe to be satisfied it is the hand you reached out to me  that gave me back the fire that fire burning in my heart  for long it was just the little flame remaining silent i canâ’t though with all my heart keep it silent we tried and lost before i know i am in the knowledge you do not desire to repeat it  though must i ask you to do so for i know deep inside it is worth all its while worth every pain imaginable give me the last chance  i promise by my heart i wont disappoint you

title: A Storky Morning
author: mary
text: when i awoke one morning,  a stork was on my head.   i  asked,  ''what are you doing there?'' it looked at me and said,   ''i wanted you to find out if you find the morning great. '' and so i rose and turned about to find i woke up late.   and so i went a-rushing to the bath and to the hall,  i ate a little breakfast and bumped into a wall.   the class was just starting,  my teacher a little cross,  my classmates were all wond'ring at the bruise atop my nose.   did i have a great day going? oh yes,  i did at least,  a stork to wake you in the morning,  is indeed rare and great!

text: mary jane       1-800\tgrandma                  by mary jane   â“let us talk  talk today.    grandmas  have lots to say. â”  when you are   down and out grandmaâ’s are there   so donâ’t pout  grandmas do love you   for whom you are.  they always feel    you are a star  grandma   grandma   what can i do? i am feeling    so very very blue  grandma grandma    i have so many threats nobody likes me   iâ’m nobodyâ’s pet  my dear the advice   i give now is you are a star   so take your bow  â“grandchildren are special     to have and to hold without their love     my heart would be cold. â”  â“i pray to god    high and above thank him for my daughter    for all this love. â”  â“if i had a son,     say another prayer thank him for my male      who is so dear. â”  grandmaâ’s find it hard     to thank everyone  especially god

title: Unknown Place
author: mary rose
text: started as a seed and implanted on a womb.  i see no light but darkness.  i cried for help ,  but no one seems to hear.  tired of waiting ,  i fall asleep.   weeks had passed and still i couldnâ’t find my way out.  iâ’m starting to lose hope.   but alas! someone has touched me,  a touched that no one could resist.  and with that gentle touch,  i find new hope.  boredom and eagerness dwells inside me.  but i tell myself,  i have to wait and be strong.  being stuck there , i figure it out that i grew bigger and bigger.  i started to feel and hear things outside nowhere.   after struggling for several months.  a beautiful me was created.  my departure was set to unfold and my arrival is expected so soon.  at last i could finally witness what would life be ,  outside of the unknown place.

title: Secret Pledge
author: mathato
text: what more words  does a dictionary  have to describe  you?   i tried watching  lot of romantic movies  just to collect theories  about love. . . . .    travelled the whole journey  visiting aunty google  to tell me more about you but unfortunately she had more suggestions and none of you. . .    believed in fairy tales  hoping that one day  a handsome prince would come and rescue me  but it was outdated.    heartbroken i slept  brimmed with tears  i dreamt. . .    in the middle of nowhere i heard a voice calling  my name but instead of  listening,  i put on my headphones and chose to ignore.    you took two steps forward  and left me miles away. . . .  i sat down,  closed my eyes and heard  a sweet voice close to my heart. . . .    i opened my eyes  and besides me,   it was you. . . .  caressed i was,  and listened to your  heartbeat full of  promises. . .   ''i'll always be there.  '' was a pledge.

(end) i would like to get a response because i have not shown anyone my stuff before. tanx

title: Please be informed
author: matthew
text: please be informed that when my narratives are absent from your mailbox i am not intending to be coy.  i am not witholding my treasures,   resorting to schoolyard tactics in an attempt to win your favor.   rather,  on those mornings and afternoons,  and the moments that surround sunset when the world seems balanced and level i have simply decided to let the city speak for itself.    traffic pumping through an intersection,   a dog with his back in an unnatural arch,    a silent kitchen filled with the light of a blue winter sunrise,    opening the door onto my street and taking the first steps of the day out into chicago,    the glow of neon lights as the sky turns pink then orange,  just dark enough so that i can't tell if the lights are on or off these things seem so huge,  so urgent,  so significant that to capture their essence seems criminal,  so i let them be.   in my head they are perfect.    life seems really vicious,  more concentrated like ultra tide or drano max.   so next time you check your e-mail and there is no message from matthew,  listen instead to the sound of the traffic outside your window and let the tea pot whistle just a few seconds longer,  smile at yourself in the mirror as you brush your teeth and know that you are contributing to a song being played  throughout the world and that makes you a rockstar.   good morning.

title: Iron Beast

text: black vintage fuel burning beast a blast from the past seeping from every crack speed and power are of the very least i just hope it doesn't put me in a cast i tame it and strattle its back 1984 is the year that this beast was born the light shines from its one eye slightly crooked the noises of growling and barks the feet made from black  it tears the road apart

title: Beautiful
author: mauricio
text: loneliness and sorrow are delicately beautiful.  they're just magnets for the depressed,  nonetheless.   dark eyes and hopelessness lure the depressed; impress the oppressed  weâ’re often obsessed with what we canâ’t possess.   isolation and depression  go hand-in-hand  when youâ’re too far away  from where you should stand.   peopleâ’s manners questioned  all forms of metaphysics.  a depressed,  pitiful,  lonesome,   oppressed,  hypocritical caste system  is the world we live in,   living,  only to sin,  repent  and commit them again.   the world's ambiance  is faint with joyous ominous; a hypnotic,  contagious  spellbinding,  infectious rhythm mesmerizing hallucinations  echoed like the voice of the phantom.    forever entrapped in a form of procrastination.  reverting back in different dimensions.  ricocheting self-glorification as a manifestation of catholic biblical religious,  faithful hypocritical salvation  and free will new world interpretations.    procrastination isn't a vital disease but like any religion  it will bring you to your knees until you're ''so far gone'' you're almost deceased angel's cry,  can't you hear their melody?  loneliness and sorrow are delicately beautiful.  they're just magnets for the depressed,  nonetheless.   dark eyes and hopelessness lure the depressed; impress the oppressed  weâ’re often obsessed with what we canâ’t possess.

title: A New Day
author: maurie
text: 5am - darkness 5:30 - colour changes pinks,  blues,  purples yellows   kookaburras cackle as a new day dawns roosters crow dogs bark birds awake fresh with life   thump-thump : noisy joggers calm----calm---the quiet of meditations all atune to mother nature   new creations,  today as always: babies,  flowers,  plants,  damp grass,  fresh breezes   all creatures great and small all united in this cosmic universe.

title: Suddenly You
author: maxine
text: suddenly you  i've moved through my life without a rhyme nor a reason i walked bold and unaware into a cold winter season  suddenly you appeared on that 8th november day i looked into your hazel eyes not knowing what to say  i wondered about this longing in my heart so true i wondered what i was feeling of course it was suddenly you  suddenly you were there always in my heart suddenly one day i knew that we would never part  i felt our growing bond the days full of ice and snow you aced me,  '' don't you love me yet?'' i thought,  how did you know?  on february 15th,  i happily said,  ''i do. '' my life had been missing something but then there was suddenly you  i spend my days right now so anguished and afraid please help me to get through this god in this bed i've made  when i'm in the darkest place i feel a love so true what and who is it i wonder when i'm feeling so tired and blue  i can almost see a face i can almost see right through i close my eyes to see it and suddenly it's you

title: Lost in an abyss
author: may
text: who am i? she questioned afraid of the answer.  i have a body,  a mind a soul,  a heart,  things,  i have everything,  but why do i feel like i have nothing.  iâ’m tired these thoughts eat me like worms gnawing upon my flesh,  as if i were dead.  i cannot silence myself as introspective as i may be as neurotic,  and vulnerable,  i am one of a kind.  i have been chosen by god he who has afflicted me with thought when all i want is silence but there is no god.   there is only life.   nature beauty pain galaxy death sadness i am nebulous within my own right oh,  are you terrified? death is my company  and i a living corpse.  i no longer feel,  iâ’m catatonic,  the reflection in the mirror  is cadaverous i am no longer human i do not breathe,  nor do i eat,  or love.  i am the abyss.

title: Another Face

title: Never say Never when all you do is lie!!
author: megan
text: you are my keeper,  your promises are meant to be kept,  not meant to get deeper.   you were apart of me and now your gone,  you and i never had a good bond.   i love you with all my heart,  but you have to understand we will always grow apart.   you promised me things i deserved,  things i didn't even care about.  you put me through so much pain,  there was never any dought.   you told me you were going to die.  you almost killed me i never wanted you to make me cry.   i will always love you,  now it's time to say goodbye.  never say never when all you do is lie.

title: It's Raining
author: megan
text: it's raining outside,   it's ben raining all day.  i'm stuck inside,  but i want to go out and play.   inside is boring,  there's nothing to do.  i've already read five books,  and i drew ten pictures too.  my mom says,  it's too wet to go out,  and when i come back in,  i will track mud all about.  i think i'll tell mom i'm going out for a run.  that way i can be out in the rain,  and i will get to have some fun.

title: Busy, Busy, Busy
author: melanie
text: i sit at the desk not knowing what to write i look around at the mess thinking of what i have to do tonight  i sit and write this poem jotting down line after line iâ’m trying to venture into the world unknown i start to hear a little voice whine  mommy mommy read me a book once again i have to take a break a snack she wants,  i have to cook how long will this poem take!  my poem is almost complete i can just picture my bed i canâ’t wait to get out of this seat after my day,  i feel half dead.

title: If your asking
author: melissa
text: if your asking if i need you, the answer is forever.  if your asking if i'll leave you,  the answer is never.  if you asking what i value,  the answer is you. if your asking if i love you, the answer is i do.

title: When You Find Yourself at a Fork in the Road
author: melissa
text: believe that you are being taken care of.   have faith that god is leading you to exactly where you need to be.   remember,  that lifeâ’s greatest gifts have already been given to you…love that heals & forgiveness that sets you free.  they are the only tools you will ever really need.   find hope in the fact that godâ’s great love for you makes you worthy enough to ask and divine enough to receive.   lastly,  draw strength in the simple truth that the beauty in life that you have created is a direct result of who you are.  therefore,  it is you that possess the power to magically re-create it in an instant with your warm smile,  a handshake or a kind gesture wherever you go!-

title: TOUCH UP
author: melissa
text:
''touch upâ”   all dreams are made in the square.   two people.   two goals.   one result.   fists balled like fire. . .   punches pounding,  drilling,  beating to make the message clear that all dreams are made in the square.   one of the only places where blood,  sweat,  and tears speak louder than howard cosell,  or in todayâ’s world max kellerman.   you canâ’t help but stare at the bodily debris flying,  clashing,  and crashing everywhere.   all dreams are made in the square.   brutal some say  as the spirit of death is always near…  even dreams deferred are made in the square.   from haymakers to the 1,  2 punch.   prepare for battle,  â‘cause in some instances you only live once.   when you are ready to join the rest of us come on inside,  weâ’ll be waiting for you down by the ringside.  <br< /p=\>


						</br<>

title: My Flower pot
author: melissa
text: unoticeable flower pot i look and see its bright flowers shineing at me.   something about this flower pot makes me smile. bringing me back to a place i havent been in a while.    the pots curves reminds me of the past on how i tried so hard to make our love last.    but theres one part that stands out from the rest this pot has a crack that makes it the best.    its beauty out shines its unoticed mistake,  its is unreal as if it was fake.    whoever that fills this pot has luck because its shape makes anything look better than a millon bucks. . . .

title: Jezebel's Poem
author: melissa
text: hurt them first,  before they display their hate to you all you want is love and so you add that spell to your stew.  jezebel  why won't you tell us how it feels to be so very beautiful and how satisfying life is when you get your way spreading the cure for their thirsts and making them hunger for every sweet word that you say you've gotton what you wanted but somehow sacrificed so much respect.  who would have conceived that your desires would have this type of effect as you walk the high wire in the sky based on whether somone loves you too much or not enough intelligence reminds you that you have to be tough but still the selfishness of your own individuality bids you to make a pilgrimage of sacrifice.  some act that will prove that deep down inside you are quite nice the struggle is about pleasing another while at the same time pleasing yourself.  fear or respect at your discretion is it obsession or protection how does one interpret loves symbolic tug of war nature correctly or is it only meant to be a mystery dissected and discussed respectfully as is hides behind a wall eluding us all.

title: Hope
author: mena
text: hope  hope is what we have left  a lot of pain but not yet depressed looking for it all my life   with people that feel left   surrounded by people that donâ’t understand  they ask me how i feel?  nothing because i feel dead  air coming  in and coming out but i only feel hopeless  where is hope?  is it still alive ? thatâ’s why iâ’m looking for it  do i believe it ? your not the only one i also feel that way  when we talk i feel strong  and never feel death  you give me hope for tomorrow  and all the time is it us or life?  i guess itâ’s about time to show us  what is wrong  and is right ?

title: Michael
author: merideth
text: heâ’s precise about his actions,   he never colors out of the lines  dare him to be different  heâ’ll say no way … another time  michael strives for excellence  which is a noble goal  but if he couldnâ’t get a 300  heâ’d never try to bowl  i wish one day that michael  wouldnâ’t try so hard to please  i wish one day that michael  would come and tell me that heâ’s…  gonna write a little sloppy,   take a couple chances  shake his little bootie  when everyone freeze dances  write a silly poem,   that doesnâ’t even rhyme  and when he sees that mountain  heâ’ll challenge himself to climb  iâ’m not asking michael to change himself,   heâ’s such a terrific child  iâ’m only saying,  â“michael…  itâ’s okay sometimes to get wild!â”

title: Thick Black Fog
author: michael
text: iâ’m trapped  stuck in this horrible place the walls slowly caving in,  i need some space they threaten to crush me to end my very existence i can feel the darkness creeping in ready to engulf me whole ready to end me and take my soul the life in which my mother gave is now being slowly drained\t the darkness has now overtaken me but thereâ’s nothing i can do i canâ’t even see no matter how hard i try i canâ’t escape this empty abyss my only goal in life is to have just a little bliss no matter how small i little is better than none at all i canâ’t seem to smile anymore and i forgot how to laugh my life was once whole but now itâ’s only half locked up,  trapped,  caged away in my mind is where these terrible games are played i canâ’t forfeit or even get a time out iâ’m the withered corn dead from the drought no more life within completely crushed,  nowhere to begin the blackness is me itâ’s in my soul it heals me it once again makes me whole i am the epitome of depression but the darkness fuels my aggression embracing the night makes everything alright helps all problems fade everything turns gray these walls cease to collapse allowing me to breathe

title: The Ambiguous Run
author: michael
text: i'm here on top of the bridge looking around i'm here huffing and puffing with my arms out like wings  the sun sets into the west like a nuclear explosion in pensacola i must remember this moment because that's all we really have  who knows when i'll see something as beatiful as this or feel as alive  as i do right now  i feel that einstien winks at me as i head on back down the bridge huffing and puffing with my arms out like wings.

title: When Love Turns to Hate
author: michael
text: for the rest of my life i will remember this date itâ’s a time for me when my love turned to hate! you can share wonderful memories and times you will never forget but those are the things i now truly regret.  iâ’m sure this would be different if the reasons why where clear.  but with more good than bad itâ’s stupidity not fear! with that being said i fear what i feel is true the deepest love i have ever felt is turning to hate for you!

title: The sneaky Stapleopegus
author: michael
text: in the shadows of my office,  by the pens and pencils lay,  the sneaky stapleopegus just passing time away.   each ruler and eraser,  and lonely paper clip,  know to well the pain inflicted by his mouthy grip.   the papers,  in their stacks so neat make sure they stay away.  but if there's only one of you i think that you're ok.   he goes for pages two and three,  but loves it when there's more the sneaky stapleopegus one day ate twenty four!   i am 60 years old

title: Cat and Mouse
author: michael
text: you sit above me curled up like a cat.  you are majestic and free.  your sandy yellow hair completely intoxicates me,  and your beauty,  it extends down to your lovely white tail.  but i lie at the foot of your chair,  as your loyal dog.  i joke you laugh.  and secretly i wish to be invited up to the warmth of this make-shift bed,  to curl around and protect you whilst you slumber,  in the place where i belong.  but that wonâ’t happen,  so forever iâ’ll be at your feet,  guarding you while you choose the tree as your protector.  but i do this happily

title: Judged
author: michelle
text: the judge stands up  and points his glaive  my doors to purgatory opens up and iâ’m falling,  falling down into this pit of no exodus my eyes open in my dark and desolate room i call a home water dripping down into a bucket  clanging,  clanging like a never ending drum  i stand up and look out the window  so many things i see,  but i canâ’t explain  tears fall down my face  if there is a god  why am i and many others suffering  i turn my head  and look at my sickly brother laying on the mattress  i walk to him and go on my knees  iâ’m holding him in my arms  rocking him,  rocking him singing a hymn to him his warm body shivering  and crying  mommy,  daddy,  big brother where are you? i know that question is from the fever he knows what happened to them  his last breath exits his lungs  â“god help us,  if not that someone hear our pleads. â”   his body goes limp and cold tears still staining his once rosy cheeks i pull him closer even though heâ’s dead.  rocking myself in this external purgatory

title: Dear Soldier...
author: michelle
text: they never told you how it would be,  how many lives would be lost.  when you imagined it what did you see? how many people would pay the cost?  i never realized the pain you went through,  how much you left behind.  your family,  your children,  your wife too.  their visions dance through your mind.  as the fire spreads through the bunkers and your comrade screams in fear.  when you take one last look at you family,  you wonder ''why am i here''.   i'm sorry for your suffering,  and the misery you endured.  my heart goes out to you dear soldier,  where ever you are!   i wrote this poem in 10 grade when we were learning about the vietnam war.  something about that war effected me in a very big way and i wrote this poem and submitted it in a book my school was sending to the vietnam memorial.  so it is at the wall for all to see.

title: Why Us Lord
author: michelle
text: lord why us? why us women? i have looked at the women who become mothers.  some good mothers,  some bad mothers; but they are all mothers.  why us lord? why is it lord that people get babies,  and they don't want them or give them up when some women try so hard to have them and would give their right arm to just have a little angel of their own.  why us lord? why me lord?

title: Im sure you are an angel..
author: michelle
text: im sure you are an angel sent from high above,  im sure you are an angel sent down to show me love. .  im sure you are an angel when we kiss the heavens sing,  im sure you are an angel im sure i glimpsed your angels wing. .  im sure you are an angel i see it deep inside your eyes,  im sure you are an angel with spiritual heavenly ties. . .  im sure you are an angel ive felt it from the start,  inside i felt your angels wings flying round my heart. .

title: What Once Was
author: mikayla
text: my untouched infant ears hear the yells of a man and a woman.   harsh words tear into each of their sinful souls.   the stench of alcohol rots deep within the throat of the man.   rum stains the dusty carpet beneath their tensely curled toes.   that same carpet was once clean of disloyalty and lies.   it used to be pure white radiating the scent of pride of a new home.   there was no pressure of the dirty feet stomping against it,   and every touch was gentle like a glass of water set on a nightstand  or a bed peacefully rocking back and forth in unison to two heart beats,   creating an infant who would eventually turn the water into rum.

title: You

text: i could not see behind these eyes they were filled with despise i saw you kiss her on the cheek but then i could not speak i hate you for forever more you are never welcome to my door.

title: THE MORNING SOUND
author: mike
text: i woke up the moment before sunrise.  i stood and look at the mountains for long.  i heard the morning sound knocking on my ears.  i immediately realise that the sun will rise soon.  the morning sound hopefully arose with fortune.   the stars became dimmed,  performing its duty.  clouds then disappear,  allowing sunlight to infiltrate.  significantly,  the darkness succeeded by lightness.  lightness then accepted shadows within the valleys.  flowers heard the morning sound and started to smile.   after the morning sound follows the plans for the day.  everybody were doing nothing but doing their daily duty.  i realised that there's no time like the present.  simultaneously,  i did what i have to do.  since too many cooks spoil the broth

title: Season of Turmoil
author: mike
text: when did this season go out of control? i can not figure out this whole season.  we have wound up on the bottom of the pole.  i ponder on what could be the reason.  i worry â‘bout what i can do to play.  we come to a new hurdle at every single turn.  have i done something wrong and gone astray? i sit and wait for many things that i yearn.  what can we do i questioningly ask.  what happened to the season we hoped for? this whole season has been a giant task.  i almost want to stop and close the door.  i will keep going for the rest of the team.  soon enough we will have our chance to beam.

title: To whom it may concern
author: mindy
text: to whom it may concern. . . . . .   i hope you find someone who understands  your scars,  because they have been hurt too,   i hope you find someone who doesn't ever judge you,  for what you're not or cannot be,   i hope you find someone who sees past your flaws,  because to them you're perfect. .    i hope you find someone that doesn't care so much about luxurious things because you're all they need,    i hope you find someone who does everything that they can just to see you smile,  not because they have to,  because they want to,   i hope you find someone  who is always there for you,  and never leaves,   to whom it concerns. .  i wish that someone could have been me

text: she got upset,  claimed i bumped into her claimed i didnâ’t like her when i really barely knew her screaming in my face claiming what i wont do to her iâ’m holding back anger and frustration making my face bluer.  sheâ’s getting on my nerves and i donâ’t want to have to hurt her and if i get into a fight i may as well commit murder causeâ’ the schools gonna suspend me and my mom will go crazy but if this girl touch me iâ’m fighting forget being lazy.  sheâ’s screaming in my face but iâ’m still pulling her card â‘cause with all the talking sheâ’d doing action for her is pretty hard my fists are clenched and my muscles are tense my mother donâ’t even yell at me like this her words of disrespect are leaving a stench let me tell you something miss &*#$%@. . . . . . .  so in the process of knocking her out in the middle of our petty bout in all the commotion i heard someone shout â“mona whatâ’s this all about?â” i came to from a familiar voiceâ’s call iâ’m swinging at air and swinging at walls swinging at myself and my downfalls flailing my hands in the middle of the hall realizing in the world of my mind i am so very small i really donâ’t know myself at all.  disappointed in me and why iâ’ve changed for everyone else the me they want me to be has forced me off the shelf lost,  dazed,  and confused,  a feeling iâ’ve never felt i bumped into this girl i donâ’t recognize as myself.

title: The Missing Piece
author: mohammad
text: i couldnâ’t keep them together!  having to live without your parents together isnâ’t easy.  going through the stress of knowing that your mother is suffering really hurts.  having to deal with emotional problems alone,  because your father isnâ’t a woman.   feeling incomplete darkens my world like an eclipse.  being depressed,  watching my father hide the pain which comes from missing his loved one.   having to live with the burden of fault.  always thinking what she is doing; what she is thinking,  what she is wishing,  but most all who is she loving?  i couldnâ’t keep them together!  waking up to two parents is the best of both worlds.  emotional support from your mother,  motivation from your father.  their marriage is a sunny day,   a day without guilt,   a day without pain,  but a day with gratification  there is no way to go but forward.  live each day to the fullest,  loving your father.    but not forgetting your mother!

title: May be at once

title: A Scanner Darkly
author: momina
text: i drop death and dream images  of a vaulted room.  it has me inside.   iâ’m a faint blur,  a shadow formless,   in natureâ’s big capsule of art.   â‘surrender me imagesâ’,  you call.  i listen  with a turning of the head,  a start.   what could a girl like me do,  spaced out,   fatuous,  unnerved,  with a crawling within,   a spasm threatening; like a nark;  a full-blooded gargoyle,  in my dreams.   the dark,  toothless grin of a maniac,   the smell of his supercharge.   i slip from worlds to worlds,  i see portals,   the heavens of god.   his minions are the stuff of my trip.   i hallucinate the joyless desire of my anima.   drop death,  iâ’ve been locked up,   inside the vaulted room,  with mirrors on either side.   my brain is cut into two; the uncompromising halves.   serenade me,  substance d! i canâ’t tell  the difference between my reflection,   my photograph.  are we the same,  the same faces,   the same sounds of a single monotone?  or am i looking the glass wrongly,   through a scanner darkly,   it is me,  but unlike me,   a human,  an automaton.

title: Inner hapiness
author: monica
text: the doors are closed,  the lights are extinguished,  the darkness spreads,  and i close my eyes,  but sleep doesnâ’t come.  i slowly sing and call sleep to come.  the midnight bell strikes and i get up i go outside i watch the moon its every shape i have watched everyday and the sleep which disappeared after the loss of my treasure the peace of my mind and now i look at the moon asking it couldnâ’t i be as peaceful as it is and glow with an inner happiness as it does…

title: That Feeling
author: monika
text: when you're little it is your dream.  waiting is all you do.   you'll know when you are.  you'll know when you've found it.  there is no mistake.  i have found mine.  never will i let go.  the way i feel is unreal.  it feels like something from a dream.   gives me butterflies.  thoughts of us together forever fill my mind and a smile begins to appear on my face.  i have found this extraordinary and rare feeling.  love.  never will i let go.

title: Frozen
author: morgan
text: sometimes i feel like i'm frozen.  coldness inside of me,  about to break into pieces.  besides the slices of skin,  splater of blood.  i feel real cold.  cold enough to freeze to death,  cold enough to die.  no one cares,  no one sees.  look into my eyes,  don't touch me.  i'm frozen,  frozen i am.

title: Lonely
author: morgan
text: lonely i am sometimes,  but i am sometimes strong with myself.  myself is invisible,  i am predictable or maybe i am unpredictable.  sometimes i feel no pain,  so just hurt me.  i have no feelings,  so feel what you feel.  my pain is strong,  plenty real.  lonely i am sometimes,  but i am sometimes strong with myself.  i am awake,  this is not a dream.  awake i am.

title: I am a Teenager
author: morgan
text: i can remember the bike rides we would take across the park in early spring.  together we would ride with the wind,  watching mother robins feeding their newborn babies.  like this time of year,  between dad and i was itself a new beginning.  as the ages pass,  and years go by in a flash i can sense a sort of change in and around him.  the way he talks,  with deep anger,  sends a train of nervous chills down my spine.  the piercing yell that he uses continues to ring repeatedly in my head.  i look up at this man,  and sense the beginning of a new person.  now i am a teenager,  and days of sunshine around him turn into horrific years that cannot pass me by.  the love and affection that had once filled my fast beating heart,  now churns with hatred and gloom and feelings that are hidden deep inside me.  this is a feeling that has deeply taken over my body and mind.

title: The Beauty of Creation
author: mundenga
text: everything in apple-pie order balancing rocks sitting on each other flowing rivers zigzagging across the plains mountain ranges rising above the valleys the gentle breeze whispering past our ears god made all things lovely and wonderful  blue hills from a distance the music of assorted birds from the treetops chilly freezy making many fizzle in winter the sunrays appearing in the far east like a messenger carrying good news god made all things at peace and in harmony.   green beauty in the countryside lilies dressed in glad rags like solomon yet the queen of sheba never visited them ravens feeding on the crumbs yet they neither sow nor reap god made all things pretty and beautiful.   hats off to the craftness of the creator he made all things in apple-pie order the heavens giving their rains in season to the gentle slopes and rugged terrains with fiery streaks of lightning and a rainbow after the storm god made all things bright and colourful.

title: Ghosts are not scary
author: muskan
text:
iâ’m sorry,  but,  ghosts are not scary.  they live inside me.  they live inside you.  and without realizing,  they consume us whole of course,  they are here to destroy but the destruction. . ? itâ’s so silent and silence,  so to say,  is never scary.  these ghosts,  they are not like monsters at all not even close to appearing evil or disastrous.   i am sorry,  but,  ghosts are not scary.  once,  they forwarded me their hand and we ended up building a friendship together.  they told me their secret of being disguised as self-doubt,  anxiety and anger.  and i told them mine; of being vulnerable.  wish to know their hiding spot? itâ’s beneath our skins,  inside our hearts.   i am sorry,  but,  ghosts are not scary.  i think we have developed an in-depth understanding of each other.  they told me,  â“we ourselves are suffering which is why we make you suffer. â” i sympathised.  i think so do you.  and us being ever-so-welcoming,  we let them in.  ghosts of me.  and ghosts of you.   i am sorry,  but,  ghosts are not scary.  not to me.  iâ’ve been acquainted with them for far too long now theyâ’re as much a part of me as i am of this world.  though just a tiny speck,  but effortlessly infinite within.   i am sorry,  but,  ghosts are not scary.  once,  they forwarded me their hand and we ended up building a friendship together.  i even told them my secret of being vulnerable.  they are. .  not scary.  how can they be? yet i am afraid.  <br< /p=\>


						</br<>

title: If this could last
author: myah
text: if this could last look at its beauty so calming and brightly,  trees swaying left to right all in motion,  the birds in the night chirping so lightly,  it makes you feel like youâ’re in the ocean:  down by the water watching it glisten,  the crickets singing their song for tonight,  hear the frogs croak if you truly listen,  big starâ’s up in the sky sparkle so bright:  the moon in the heavens oh my so big,  such a bright light that shines down on the land,  then morning comes and the animals dig,  the start of day that is newly brand:  as the day goes on the sun starts to sleep,  that last thing you hear is a simple peep.

title: Angel in the Sky
author: nadia
text: as a calm breeze lightly uplifts the leaves of a crisp autumn day a man peers from behind a glass window scared and confused like a young child he looks out into the world and as the sun brightly shines gently kisses the apples of his cheeks he wonders about the mystery of life as one begins one is ending into an afterlife where lovely faces with gentle wings keep guard of the lost souls on earth up there that is where the man now gazes down from soft,  silky clouds much like an angel into our world of bitter cold days a comforting sense overwhelms us all because we know we have an angel to watch over us

title: World spinning too fast
author: naomi
text: i look into your eyes,  seeing a million stars.  you look into my eyes,  with that deep and understanding stare,   my whole body feels electrified and every single nerve is pulsating.  my world is spinning faster.   one step closer,  your sweet,  familiar smell makes me dizzy,  so dizzy,  my world is spinning faster.   one step closer,  i can see your lips moving,  hear your soft,  melodic voice,  yet i can't make out what you're saying.  it doesn't matter,  doesn't matter.  your voice tingling in my ears,  my world is spinning faster.   one step closer,  the touch of your hand on my cheek,  my neck,  my shoulders,  so soft i can hardly feel it,  yet so intense,  my skin seems to be on fire.  my world is spinning faster.   one step closer,  i hear my heartbeat,  hear your heart beating faster,   having a race,  until they agree on a common speed,  finding each other and beating together,  even harder,  even stronger,  even faster.   one step closer,  my world reaches its top speed.  i can't keep up,  so i let go and watch everything disappear.  nothing is left,  just a spark of hope.   maybe one day,  i will find you.

title: Sweet Baby Attributes

title: The girl with the broken heart

text: there was a girl with a broken heart  she'd been there for him since the start will they make it in time to her room or be to late she can't even keep a mate why did he break me hurt me so much he broke me in two  he dosent know how much i'm hurting not a clue  does he know i cut my body from head to toe  bet he dosent even know he broke my heart though  he's moved on so everything's okay for him now  they had a row and he left her on the street crying  he was always lying  when did he stop treating u like a princess  the bruises were always more never less  you weren't so great because you raised your fist  all the things you did wrong could write a list  i smelled like cigarettes when you wanted me to smell like a rose  you seen my scars that's why you left i suppose  i send a text you don't reply  now i just want to die  you said i was a flower then told me you don't like them cos they die fast now what i need is a cast  can't you see what you did is killing me oh well they say get over you but i never will guess i'll pop another pill
