title: Pain In A Word
author: natassia
text: why do you hurt me with your words?  why must you put me down to bring you up.  all you ever say is how i'm never good enough.  but what makes you good enough for me.  why must your words pierce me like a sword,  a sword that stabbed jesus as he hung on the cross to die.  why do your words persecute me and make me want to run and hide.  words,  thats just what they are,  letters and sounds that can make or break you,  but they do not break me; they make me strong,  they are my weapon against you.  no matter how many times you use your words against me,  i am made stronger knowing my words are of value and yours are of discontent with life.  why do you hurt me with your words? all i want is for you to love me.

title: The Sky as She  Appears Tarnished
author: nathan
text: day awakes grey and gelid,  turning toward the near ocean,  she'll find skies afire filled red.  falling from her green hilltop,  she'll rupture the cinder ash.  mind placid fights burning eyes,  wind this saving fall,  painful.  crashing grays into greens sing,  'with great haste and hurry,  come,  meet me in keen dark depths. ' countenance turning charcoal,  the saved sky's smirking revealed,  tunes in only echo,  warmth now froze,  chatter beats death into cliffs,  the sky goes grey,  one day dies.

title: A Solitary Embrace
author: naushad
text: shining blue eyes in the bright day light,  what can i say where can i hide,  everything that i think starts with you in my airy glide,    when you walk on auburn sands,  in a far-fetched momentary land,  with me in your embrace,  my cold eyes burning with your gaze,   leave me alone but never let me go,  for the death is sweet when i see your glow,  your lips are mists holding me to kiss,   i forget the world in your lovely bliss,   my world is you your hair the cloudy skies,  drown me tonight in sapphire- sea of your eyes,   when the ghosts of the past knocks your door,  donâ’t get awake just lie on the floor,   are you afraid? just come to my embrace,  it will keep you warm from the glacial sun,   with you every minute,  my love is infinite,  the sense of heaven since our love first began,  is still in my mind,  is still in my heart,  when my stained soul turned into crystal glass  for my love was with you since we were starting through,   and donâ’t look the time the whole world is blind,  let's hide in our ruined castle lit with starry light,  for this wreck of rose granite all left for us to fly,  between the green velvet forest in the ocean flame sky,  only us living alone for never to say goodbye.

title: Youths with vision

text: i see so many fake photos around so many celebrations,  momentary! beneath which dejection lies.   i see so many people around  pursuing happiness but gets little,  limitary! beneath which depression ties.   i see so many youths around running after career,  objective of life! which is supposed to be why he lasts.   i see so many youths around followers,  not leaders!  forgetting the identity what he should rear inside.   but! yet many youths,  grasped very roots their identity!  overrode the fears and deceptions  holding a vision,  equipped with knowledge and belief.   i see hope,  a vision,  a milestone! upon which many are gathering heading towards,  to lead,  to succeed,  to conquer!

title: A Dream That Will Never End
author: nelson
text: this is to you the one that has reawaken the fire long since forgotten.  i am descending in the deepest part of the ocean.  everything black,  air is thin; the pressure only remains.  when will i take my last breath? many thoughts run through the mind as the wind flowing in the world.  a game is being played where the heart is being tossed around by two figures,  one in dark the other in white; however one is blind.  the game carries on the question are which one will win.  this is a dilemma for it is like half of me want what i canâ’t have and the other want to keep what is already in my possession.  \ton one hand of it is to give into the feeling of righteousness which would lead to chaos.  that is something i want to avoid.  for the decision i make someone will be forever hurt.  it is not right for anyone to go through a lonely road.  peace is the answer and it shall remain that way.  the problem of it is the feeling i have are spiraling in a watery vortex in complete confusing with no walls to cling to end the suffering.  \ti wonder to my self that as you read this,  these similar emotions occur.  i donâ’t mean to let this torture continue,  for i know it is like a dream.  it was whispered to me and echoed forever more in the darkest part of my mind.  in a sense i donâ’t to wake up from this dream,  but have to face the reality of it all.  it hurts me to even mention or think of it.  what bother me the most is reaching for something that can never be in your grasp.  so i want to say donâ’t feel sorry for these words i say here.  it is my expression my plea i say onto you.  \tthe feelings i have for you grow stronger every day i wanted to throw that out to you.  i will try my hardest to keep it tame as this beast with no remorse remains hidden deep within.  i will give it time and see where it leads us.  i know this is a dream that will never end correct? or should be the question being does this dream need to end? or let it fade as the bright star in the blacken sky.  or the fire blown out from the candle where vapor remains.  nelson

title: I, too, Can Succeed
author: nicole
text: i,  too,  celebrate america.  i am the straight a student who got pregnant in high school.  they put me down and say i will now,  never succeed.  they say my dreams have no way of becoming reality.  but i push on,  and do my best,  and prove them all wrong.   one day soon,  i'll be a graduate student of college.  when they see my degree,  nobody will say again,  ''she ruined her life, '' or judge me for my early gift from god.  instead,  i will be praised,  then.   soon,  they will see how brilliant i am,  and be amazed.  i,  too,  can succeed.

title: My MerMer
author: nicole
text: i have a friend that i call mermer  she just got diagnosed with breast cancer  2 surgeries,  chemotherapy,  and radiation her bald head exemplifies the beauty of her condition  life throws you curves when you donâ’t expect it with faith and courage we can get past it  i look up to my dear friend who has the strength of a tiger my prayers go out to her but i already know sheâ’s a fighter.    since i was a young kid,  mermer took me under her wing now itâ’s my turn to give her all the love and support i can bring.

title: What what I deeply missed
author: nicole
text: the distance between us tore me apart  because even though we're far away  you always have my heart.   i had the chance to take this trip,   to see the one who stole my heart  and heal my wounds by a mere passionate kiss.   i love you,  did you see,   did you believe me?  did you see it in my eyes?  did you think what i was saying was lies?  there's just something about you  that i can't resist. . .   seeing you again put me in realization  on what i deeply missed.

title: I Miss That
author: nikki
text: as motherâ’s day is drawing near i miss the time i had you here the times that i could hear you laugh oh dear lord,  i do miss that   when the sound of your voice was but a phone call away when i needed to hear from you â“everythingâ’s okay. â” those days when i thought i would not survive when it was all i could do to breathe and cry   oh mom how i miss that infectious smile that saw me through every heartache and trial jesus i know itâ’s much grander where sheâ’s at but having her here,  from my very depths i miss that   i am thankful and grateful for all that you did for just being you in the simple life you lived you taught me to love and take joy in little things will i ever live up to such a great legacy?   as i look at your picture on the wall everyday at your pretty blue eyes on your very kind face my soul aches with the loss of my very best friend my only hope comes from knowing i will see you again   yes iâ’ll see you again,  but until that day to my knees i go as i beg and pray to him who called you,  who at last gave you rest proving that he only takes the best   so mommy dear mommy i send you kisses and hugs with a heart and soul brimming over with love when this lifetime of bereavement is a thing of the past and never again will i say how much i miss that

title: The Light is in you
author: nimish
text: i get up and spend all day along,  when it comes to the dark i feel some wrong,  all the directions blind, and no light around,  i feel like trapped in a cave with no way out,  i stay awake and stand still till the sun rise,  because in the dark i was afraid and never dared to walk,  as it seemed like i may fall and end , but deep inside i knew i can do.   once was raining heavily, and there was storm too,  i took a deep breath and dared to move,  as i walked along it was dense but i moved through and through,  the raging wind drifted and swiftly blew,  but slowly i moved on and on with a desire to overcome my fear,   slowly the rhythm of the rain matched my beats,  and the wind to my breath,  at start it was hard but then became easier,  i dared and overcame my fear.   the dark had ended and i was all alive ,  this all made me understand that the light was all in mine! the light was all in mine!

title: He
author: nishant
text: he was the son of my mother the most precious like no other he had a very charming personality filled with joy,  prosperous and dignity.   he always had an enthusiasm for the work but his luck doesn't favour on the war spot showering of bullets,  bombs and canon in the crowd of soldiers he found himself alone.   a very cheerful morning for a good nation an awful moment for separation as it was the appearance of my brother so in fear i shudder.   as he was resting in peace i ran to grab his hand and kiss and as from every bond he's now free the soldiers along with the rester flee.

title: Just one more time!
author: nita
text: just one more time, i lay my head unto your shoulders,  and cry bitterly as if never to stop tear trickling,  trickling down my cheeks which were once like rose,  now, i seldom recall what is joy, what is laughter,  no i havent forgotten the winters gentle breeze.  i recall running helter-skelter for a hiding place,  you werent there to help me then, then why?why?why? do you ask me now, ask me to forgive you for that,  after all you have done to me, how can i think  and feel like forgiving you, you who had once my  uttermost trust and then blew it up to pieces.  my heart shall not control my head this time,  and though i weep bitterly unto your shoulders,  i know that things will now never be the same not now and maybe and possibly never again.  and you ask me forgiveness just one more time!

title: Everything is better with music
author: o
text: there is nothing i can say,  loud echoes i heard everyday everything is better with music the noise made me angry and sick  heard a boom right in my sleep,  like an explosion of a cargo ship i never took the time off to realise until that night i was really entice  i challenge the man calmly but his response stunt me comically everything is better with music,  he said.  i interrupted him so that awkward statement wonâ’t spread  his mother died the booming got worst.  the music raised a public outburst.  still,  everything is better with music he is rare,  but very eccentric  where he sat in his room listening to hymn    assassins came,  to kill,  and swim in a pool of blood,  but he was flourishing in music flood  well,  his wife and children was killed he was not aware the assassins was fulfilled in their very mission,  because he could not help while in deep attention.   now,  there is nothing he could say  loud echoes of pain he felt everyday everything is better with music the noise made him depressed and sick

title: In Memories of My Father
author: olenka
text: under silken blanket i'm holding in my heart,  my sparkling feellings,  father. . .  today you're a ghostly light.   now you belong to heaven,  i'm crying in the rain,  my tears drop with rain drops,  my soul is black pain.   with a candle in my hand and a rose from deepest love. . .  today i'm far away,  i'm sending words. . . my dove.   i'm holding memories of your words and charming face,  my love is under a blanket,  in me. . .  with silk and lace.   . . . . dedication to my father.

title: Growing Up
author: olutayo
text: a babe i once was  smiling and crying! basking in the love  and safety mama provided watching everything  and everyone without a meaning to them.  beautiful it was to live in a world  that lacks fear and hatred.   but then appeared nature,   clothed in her colourful garment,  decked in priceless ornaments,  with her drum over her shoulder,  and her drumsticks on her rugged hands,   eager to play her music called life! everyone beckoned to me,  ''oblige her with a dance she will take you through life only nature knows the path!''  how could i leave my own world where everything i needed i got by a cry,  or just a smile to dance to nature's music? a place where mama's love feels like hate through punishment and her protection like repulsion through tasks of life so i panicked away in thoughts as mama lifted me for a dance!  a difficult rhythm it was,  but mama took me through softly.  perhaps if i had a say i would have chosen to live  my whole life as a babe but then,  how can i grow up? nature has the key to it so i obliged her as she beats and now i am grown  and everything has meaning!

title: The Rhythm of Life
author: olutayo
text: clocks ticking hearts beating showers running children shouting what's this rhythm prevailing in life?  all comprising full of meaning; joy to many others for mourning such's the rhythm sustaining this life  set in motion since creation no ceasation nor reducton that's the rhythm the orchestral by life

title: My Wife: one as me
author: olutayo
text: my wife,  my love my early morning rose fresh and beautiful full of live and sweetness  my wife,  my world peaceful like the stillness of the night wonderful as her smiles loyal as a dove  my wife,  my everything the one that moulds my smiles the one that races my heart and thesame that comforts it  my wife,  my best friend my missing rib she is my wife,  my wife one as me

title: Say
author: omar
text: what am i supposed to say  to that,  that i see all day.   am i supposed to tell you to stay,   or tell you to wait till may.   am i supposed to say  tomorrow will be another day  so leave it all to faith.   no i canâ’t just wait  for all i am going to do is hate.   so what am i supposed to say,   i hope its not to late  to tell you i want you to stay.   so tell me what am i supposed to say  wait,  wait,  wait.

title: Being in love
author: onyema
text: being in love,  but he hurt us badly  being in love with a person that treats you badly being in love but donâ’t work out with that person was in love with you.   being in love we you but donâ’t work out most of time.  being in love but you say donâ’t hurt us badly.   being in love it makes cries sometime and make bad sometime.  being in to love fools donâ’t want you anymore.   being in love her but she hurt badly to him.   she makes him look badly about himself.   being in love with yourself to let it go.     donâ’t be say you love that person but you donâ’t at all because you donâ’t feel same way about them.  but they do.  why you say wonâ’t hurt us or him but you do best.  i donâ’t have love for people  that hurt other people .  you are some hate doing that?

title: The Edge
author: orion
text: to see the sea  i went to the seashore searching the seashore i saw a see-saw sawn by a saw as i as on the seashore

title: Winds
author: oscar
text: oh this breeze the calm nature of the calming winds they spread the cheer of the new seasons that are yet to come this breeze brings back memories of those loved ones that we held close and dear.  oh this breeze it helps soothe you when things go hectic.  it helps all of our moods fade away it sweeps the land of all its morns and sorrows like it does to all the autumn leaves that it picks up when fall passes by.  they fly away far from sight so you can take part in what is in store for you tonight oh this breeze  how you do so many good things it stirs the land to clear all the fogs in life.   it erodes the debris to expose lost treasure for our delight it spreads the seeds of live throughout the land in its hope of bringing the growth of a new spring.  it cools our lives with such simple and elegant measures oh this breeze it is such a pleasure.

title: Love blinds a kind soul
author: oscar
text: she does everything for him  she puts him on a high pedestal.  she thinks nothing bad of him she will love him till the end.  he does not have a job.  he does drugs and has emotional instability he beats her up and makes her weep.  he gives her bruises and strangles her  yet she still cannot see he is not the right one.  she is now pregnant with his child.  she does not have a job any longer.  she lives with her mom and he lives with them as well she feels like there is no hope for raising her child.  he has neither car nor a truck she cheated on hi,  with a guy from starbucks he does not want to own up to these new responsibilities what can she do? she does not care what he does she will forever love him eternally.

title: My first Baby
author: oscar
text: i remember the first time you opened your eyes.  hat sparkle in your eyes they were filled with so much love and hope.  your body fit perfectly in my arms.  that very first laugh brought me tears of joy.  those first steps she took were the most precious strides of all.  she had the cutest little toes and little nose.  i miss seeing her play with her light brown golden hair.  she was the happiest of children never would you hear her bother.  until she got sick and sad,  she never got this way she never used to whine.  there was something very wrong it brought us such sorrow.  the doctors explained that she would not have a lot of time.  we cried and never slept until that dreadful morning came.  the sun rose nice shiny and bright but our baby was lifeless cold and descended from this life.  never again will i see that small smiling face again.  never again shall i hear the pitter,  patter of on the floors within my doors again.

title: The Crashing Game
author: osita
text: the crashing game   the ball is rolling though kicks are feeble players are limping while keepers are unstable defenders are attacking when attackers are defending  goalposts expanding crossbars drifting higher defenses staying porous offence striking slimmer scores very deficient  coaches raining curses referees hanging biased linesmen posing perplexed pitch losing grasses spectators lacking cheering as the game comes crashing lost game,  nigerian politics.                        by osii,  ojobo.                       ogwuiyimbuke nsukka,                       30th march 2007.

title: Messy Brother
author: ouit
text: my messy brother was  always crying when he was washing dishes he'd rather catch fishes.

title: Of Shadows and Winds
author: ovi
text: in the morning light,   i will come like a wind.   windows of horror; hovered the past night.   calling my name at the witching hour  and the vultures hovered nearby,   gathering and revolving in a four square junction.    did they call my name?  did i ponder and wonder?  did i sail away?  did i get frightened?  where did the vultures go?   banners of shadows trailing everywhere; the witches of night's terror in motion.   waiting for an unholy rush and they scattered and shattered,  in one little touch.

title: A Proud Man
author: p
text: its strange to me  how these females fail to see the beauty in me i wasnâ’t trained to be  the man u see  but it was i who thought me to be a man i am my father wasnâ’t their to guide me  so forgive the wrongs i do  i did the best i can  and i am proud of the man i am so just love me for who i am

title: ''Green Is All Around Us''
author: paige
text: green green is the grass gently swaying in the breeze green is the grass stains on your knees green is the stem of an elegant flower green is the color after a rain shower green is the wild vines tangled on a tree green is the color of a never ending canopy green is the life of the new and old green is a story you haven't been told green could be an inmpossible dream green is a lily pad in a flowing stream green is a nation coming together green is shown after stormy weather green is the beauty of a single peacock feather green is a glow that will never get duller if you think about it green is more than just a color.

title: Why me
author: patricia
text: as i sit on my bed,  i hear vioces in my head,  are these my fears? why i am i here,  my face is drowned with tears thinking to flee.   i wish i was free. . . . . . . . . .  just tell me , why me?

title: Snowy Love, Lovely Snow
author: patrick
text: snowy days,  winter days.  hands numb with cold fingers,   i find myself thinking of my love,  her images always lingers.   always and always,  i have been forever in love,   she makes my mind fly away,  like a soaring dove.   trudging through this thick snow,  i see my love everywhere,   but she always out of reach,  oh my despair.   profess your love for her,  make her yours forever.   do not be a fool,  that is only for a dream,   oh how i long to look into her eyes that gleam.   thick snow,  cold snow,  thick heart,  cold heart,   always been silent,  ever since the start.   fly away,  away from the snow,  away from my love,   close your heart and stow.   forever in love,  forever in snow.

title: the cat
author: patrick
text: i saw a cat.  it was very fat.

title: I Am Beautiful
author: patrick
text: i am so beautiful.  to everybody.   oh yes.

title: My Neighbors Dog
author: pattie
text: my neighbor has a dog.   that always comes over.   he is nice and sweet   but runs when i want to meet  because if he won't afraid  maybe he woud't run away.

title: ''Billy the Kid''
author: paul
text: billy the kid        lies in a boot hill grave out west.   denied his three score and ten  by a bullet from the gun of a friend.   some say he got what he deserved.   is he mourned by anyone  this captive of hollywood movies -   this smiling little killer   forever aged twenty-one .

title: Lost In A Dream
author: paula
text: i sit in a beautiful meadow i do not see the beauty around  me for my eyes are filled with tears i hear a soothing, warm voice just beyond the willow tree. . . .  why are you cry? i have come for you just as i said i would, i told you i would always be here for you and i am .   he comes to me,  gets on one knee and wipes away my tears as they fall. . .  he takes my hand and gently says to me ''please do not shed no more tears for i am here now with you where i will always be,  even when we are apart i will still remain with you deep in your heart where i shall stay. ''  i look up into the most deepest blue eyes one has ever seen,  i smile and say ''yes you are here today,  you will be by my side tomorrow but what about after that? will you be with me forever till my last breath is spent?'' i do not get to hear his answer for i am awoken by the ring of my phone. . . . .  but my pillow is soaked with tears,  i know i will be forever lost in the dream for you aren't really with me.

title: Summertime
author: paula
text: i wish it was summertime,  it would be warm.  i wish it was summertime,  i would sleep late.  i wish it was summertime,  and we would not be at school i wish it was summertime!!!!!

title: The Answer to the Holiest Believer
author: paula
text: sweet believer,  bend your ears,  let me now assuage your fears! all the sins you fear you feel now is cleansâ’d from head to heel.  rivers flow upon your shores,  feel your anguished guilt no more.   i see the work your hands create and feel your passion,  oh so great and in return,  i offer you that sweet respite you scramble to your lack of goods gives me no pause thy soul is clean,  so good your cause  acknowledging your humble prayer i give to you a gift so rare cloaking you in love and peace offering your soul a lease - a place in heaven waits for you; your rock of ages hides you too.

title: Shopping
author: paula
text: i love to go shopping even when i feel like dropping.  when the clock strikes seven pulling into the mall feels like heaven! i love the mall,  stores big and small.  nordstrom,  limited,  even the express to buy clothes,  shoes,  or a cute dress.  my favorite thing is to accessorize necklaces,  bracelets no matter the size.  money is easy to spend as you can expect,  being a teacher money is no object! so of all the places n the world to be,  i would always prefer a shopping spree!

title: Love
author: pavel
text: i've been fooled,  hoodwinked through bliss by a slayer who came from the abyss that living convulsion,  irrational shove the endless-mirage,  celebrated as love

title: Through  My  Eyes
author: peggy
text: my dog is soft and fluffy, kind of like when he was a puppy, but then he grew up and no longer a pup,  and the pup is a big dog now.  sometimes he looks so scary but thats just because he's so hairy.  his black fur is still so soft and fluffy,  and i guess thats why when i look at him,  all i see is my little fluffy puppy.  my dog is all grown up now,  we have a lot in common,  sometimes in the afternoon we both like to take naps,  but he forgets how big he is and can no longer fit into my lap.  i wonder if my dog remembers how we used to play and stuff,  and no matter how big he gets,  or if he whines and cries,  he'll always be my little puppy,  even if it's through my eyes only.

title: BORN TO BE
author: pertunia
text: some people were born to be musicians some people were born to be singers while some people were born to be teachers n give knowledge some people were born to be doctors and heal people  me i was born to be a singer, dancer, poet n a novelist i was born to make my dreams comes true i was born to have successful life n do what is good for me as i know that i am in a journey i was born to make good things for my self because if time wasted it will never regain no, no, no i can't just do nothing with my talents because my future is in my hands  later on i was having doubts. . . wondering if i will be able to reach exactly what i want in life but suddenly i just find a good way to make my dreams come true i've just realise that who ever i want to be first thing i must have hope n ambitious in order to successed  as i knw that life is all about opportunities me too i've receive opportunity to show others what i'm capable of now i'm ready to make my dream come true no, no, no i don't feel guality and shame for how i am or who i am but what i can say is dat i am a special human being and i deserve opportunities like others i was born to live this life ouh what a life!!!!!! the end

text: phil  is not ill phil likes to chill phil is cool!

author: phoebe
text: spirits send the words,  from all across the land allow me to absorb them,  through the touch of either hand for 24 hours from 7 to 7,  i will understand all meaning of the words from here to heaven.

author: phoebe
text: i am one too strong to fight,  return to dark where shadows dwell you cannot have this halliwell.  go away and leave my sight and take with you this endless night.

title: It's nice to eat rice and pork with a fork!
author: phuoc
text: almost every afternoon i eat rice that i cooked the night before it's nice to know that  when i am hungry as a loon i can always eat my rice heated up in the microwave oven  i also make my own stir fries sometimes slow cooked chicken or pork i use a fork instead of chopsticks but when the rice sticks to the bowl then a fork won't do  when i cook my own food i know what's good for me  i trim the fat,  skim the salt i use fresh ingredients  without all the additives  store bought food cooked in salt fat and all bad stuffs  when i am done eating i know i am all good to go without feeling bad that i've done the right stuff for me it can be addictive  if you give it a try! you won't want to buy  store bought cooked food but want to make more stir fries!

text: burning in th oven u love the pie but dont eat it (to hot)

title: Fear
author: piper
text: locked in,  boxed in.   full of fear,  my panic grows manic.  till i canâ’t hear.   in need of reprieve.   so that i can breathe remove my fear.   please make it leave.

title: Truth Spell
author: piper
text: for those who want the truth revealed,  open hearts and secrets unsealed,  from now until it's now again after which the memory ends for those who are now in this house shall hear the truth from their own mouths

title: The unexpected life
author: piyush
text: life is so unexpected, it takes so much twist and turn,    at each turn waits a new experience to judge your earn,  giving you a misty way to travel on a road full of pebbles,   with the hope of achieving eternity and love as you move on you are knocked down by obstacles,  still i stood up,  dressed up and showed this vicious world my confidence to walk,   having mild smile on my face and the name of my lord in my talk,  life is so unexpected that when you think you actually got someone he slowly slips away,   moves away swiftly as the feathers blow away,   you try to catch him,  hold him to stay,   he is like a floating cloud which always sway,   life is so unexpected yet majestic it tones you up for everything,   making you hard as shell so that you never repent for anything,  life fills many sparkling and shining experiences but has some black ones too,   at each step it illustrates we have to accept them too,  sometimes it offers joy and happiness,   sometimes it offers disappointment and sadness,  yet it's life and it goes on like a beautiful flowing river taking manifolds,   it's up to you whether you enjoy the journey or let it beholds,   life is so unexpected it offers you pain so tactfully just to test your courage,   when you handle it you get purified with the tears of your sage,   lies in life a never ending process of rebirth,   everyday you grow up with a new lesson tied to your girth,   life is a one time opportunity use it wisely,   love everyone, spread knowledge of wisdom likely,   life is so unexpected it often goes the opposite way we think,  just as to test our patience and often makes us wink,  still in this unexpected life lies a marvellous relation of friendship,    the most prestigious and pure form ofâ  relationship,   it fills joy in everyone's life irrespective of your nature and age,   giving you strengh everytime you loose your courage,  a true friend is the life's most precious treat to a person,   his silent care,  love and support carves you out a better person,   there is still tenderness connected to this unexpected life,   as it gives you most beautiful parents which always care for you no matter how much agonised is your life,   never wish to break their trust since they make your way to success,   they act as friends sometimes stern and rigid,  sometimes soft and loving only to make the best that you can posses,   life is so unpredictable you never know what a new day may bring,   might be happiness or sorrow but they are a temporary thing,  life is unexpected only for the mortal,    but for my lord which is immortal it's just a stage where we all are merely players in his hands playing their roles which are subtle.

title: I Want a Car
author: pj
text: i want a car like the jetsons fly small and sporty and buzzes through the sky.   i want a car like the beverly hillbillyâ’s drive rocking chair included and that horn…to let everyone know iâ’ve arrived!  i want a car like the general lee the one the good oleâ’ boys from hazard had and outrunning the cops is a hazard guarantee.   i want a car like the batmobile with itâ’s fancy fins and grimacing grill  gizmos and gadgets aplenty to thrill.   i want a car unlike what my parents own stranding me,  strapped to the back seatâ’s safety zone until my parents deem me fully grown!

title: Kitty and Squiddy

text: kitty had a friend his name was squiddy.  squiddy liked kitty who lives in piggy.  piggy is a city.   the end

title: My Sister
author: portia
text: my sister is a little brat she hits and kicks and throws a bat my only problem is i spoil her. she gets all the attention from my parents.  it really does'nt matter because me have fun any way.  do'nt forget beware of the sister she will get you.

title: Under the moonless sky
author: prabhudatta
text: under the moonless sky two full moons have already gone,  but my sky is still dark and alone. . .  the moon which was glowing there,  shining bright,  pouring love n care,  never rose again from the horizon,  after that cursed night of the season.  again a humble-heart did get scars,  it was all seen by me and the stars.  in this dull desert i am a wanderer,  with same scars of the past nearer.  roving around to forget the departed,  to fetch bliss, this journey was started.  fountain of joy,  water of truth,  shade of care,  grass bed of youth,  nectar of love,  moonlight so cool,  are all phrases so poetic to fool- someone like me who gave his heart,  had-have loved though she tore it apart.  the path was gorgeous unlike it ended,  the sky and the stars have me befriended,  these empty nights are empty no more,  the dim starlight is brighter than before.  i was to cross deserts,  mountains,  oceans. .  to heal my heart,  to bury those emotions. .  to search the lost moon across the horizon,  the sky stopped, stay here for a reason.  stop looking for a disc with fake light,  my friend,  the sun is real n burns  bright,  the night was long,  but hope is a boon,  stay awake with me,  the dawn will come soon.

title: A True Friend Ceci
author: pramu
text: she came with lot of passions,   energy and friendship. . .  expecting little love,   care and comfort…  she devoted completely to the friendship  without fear and gave everything to the relationship. .  she had full of confidence,   never lost hope till the last day even then. .   was expecting the ultimate word till the last day. . .  however she could not ask the reason of rejection  and never believed the kind of outcome. .   probably her friend was not trust worthy,   having less confidence. . .  not made for each other… probably,  he was in dilemma,  what to do. . .   to choose between the fear and friendship. . .  may be he was not brave enough  to discuss the problem and confusion. . .  so ultimately the fear won over friendship. . .    was it worth?? her friend believe so. . .  as it is good to miss a friend than  missing the love of his life. . .  as love stays forever and it wins over friendship. . .   love never dies and fails,   it stays till the last moment of life. . .  friends get changed over the time  but not love and feelings. . .  it stays in heart and will stay  as it was somebody's pure feelings. . .  this could be one of the relationships,   but unique to her friend… as it was of full of passions,  joys,   beliefs,  trusts,  true feelings. . .   god should be kind enough to give  that kind of feelings to every friendship. . .   every moments of his life will miss that friendship  and a true friend. . .   she didn't care of anybody's response,   feedback to her friendship. . .  was always ready to give everything  possible to the relationship. . .  she was a brave person with great heart and soul. . .   her friend could not get a chance to explain  and not brave enough to say sorry or goodbye. .  but it was one of his toughest decisions of his life  to ignore a pure friendship. . .  was he brave enough?? could be or may not be. . .   but that was the destiny. .   she is one of his twin souls,   but not the ultimate soul mate. . .   as she came and changed his life  with lot of care and love which he was not worth it. . .   now he wishes her every day for a better and happy life. . .  hope she would have forgotten everything  and enjoying the new chapter of her life. .  which she deserved of it…

title: Life
author: pravinay
text: a seed that sprouts hearing the thunders of the clouds will see the water and air in his lifeâ’s first round it will,  have small,  tiny leaves like eyes of a bee it will,  grow a bit big finding its place to be now it would have learnt how to live what to ignore and what to believe it will become a grownup plant a bit too angry and a bit slant dreaming to be a big fine tree  without any worries and feeling free it will have branches and a millions of leaves like our relatives and our buddies it will,  also laugh and cry for its fury but now it is a grown up tree feeling 100% free after passing many seasons,  sometimes living without any reason has passed many phases of life,  with fruits,  some birds and bee hives its seeds have gone deep into the ground to take a deep sleep no disturbance and  no sounds to rise up one day giving company to its comapanions  either cherry,  banana,  oranges or it may be lemon now its roots has loosen,  as it is on the phase to be fallen  but still it is happy,  at this ending page as clouds have started thundering it will be raining again and that old tree will have new children to live ahead

title: And We Should
author: preston
text: the future is forever unknown.  its all inside our heads,  we fear what we can't control.   everyone's doing it wrong,  thinking of what will be and not what is,  the future is forever unknown.   imagining what's in the darkness thats what drives us crazy; we fear what we canâ’t control.   not knowing what's coming all you have is hope,  because,  the future is forever unknown.   the cat and the lion one domestic,  one wild we fear what we canâ’t control.   growing old,  dying,  aliens,  gods? all part of life,  the future is forever unknown we fear what we can control.

title: Agony
author: priya
text: there's an agony held in my heart,  agony of dereliction,  dereliction towards most important years of my life.  could have left no stones unturned to reach my aim.  but i got caught in the game of vain.  flying colours did the judges claimed,  maybe i got flowed away insane.  judgement day turned out to be my doom's day,  no answers did i have for the blame.  life took an unpoised turn and i found myself standing at a crunk.  everything happens for good,  some heavenly whispered in my ears i give you a second chance,  he declared.  that was a boon for me; but my heart roamed abouy just pondering on dreams.  gathered myself to hit back hard now here i am,  waiting. .  anxiously for the bricks to fall apart. . .

title: Sometimes I feel…
author: priyanka
text: sometimes i fight with you,   to make our relation strong.   sometimes i advice you,   to show that i listen your words.   sometimes i solve your problems,   to prove that i am with you.   sometimes i make you happy,   because i canâ’t see you in sad mood.   sometimes i hug you,   to make you comfort.   sometimes i kiss on your forehead,   to show that you are my princess.   sometimes i hold your hand,   to tell that i am always with you.   sometimes i keep your head on my shoulder,   to show that i care for you.   i always love you,   as your my god,   and you are the one,   for whom my heart pumps the blood.

title: Laughter
author: qatreh
text: laugh me,  your laughter is beautiful.  among all the colors and rocks your name is; your laugh; and your grace that's beautiful.  do not be afraid of me and not enough that i am empty of all

title: Scarred
author: radhika
text: to build a house of brick and stone is facile as could be,  but gluing it into a home was something left to me,  i lay my love,  dedication,  care; unsullied for family,  but still i perish every day,  silhouette of misery  of black and blue,  my skin escapes from my tired bones,  a contusion to my heart,  a jolt to the past,  every time my name he groans sickle eyes,  claws for hands and soul tough as stone,  he pinches my love,  the last drops of it and spits on what i called home  hate is the hue and bitter the taste of his blood,  wrath governs his eyes,  this home once built of halcyon is now one built of lies,  hear the crack of my bones,  the demolition of my dreams,  asphyxiated by your fading love for me,  for once who i called my life is now the mirage of a happy family  iâ’m tethered to this world from ties long dead,  crushed in his clutches,  no human but a doll instead,  iâ’m numb,  paralyzed with nothing left of me,  itâ’s defeated,  itâ’s corrupted,  now a torment what i once called family  my blood clothe the shards of broken glass,  his inebriation is all he feels,  whiskey for children,  vodka for friends,  with them his conscience flees,  his eyes bully me,  laser to my skin,  tyranny of my story defeated to the wounds of his sin  i abscond your arrest in my dreams,  my eyes call for emancipation,  they scream but you all hold hands,  born a woman? your husbandâ’s your destiny,   society,  you both kill and cry,  itâ’s your hypocrisy  entwined in the addictions of this wretched world,  he colored his heart wrong,  innocence left,  morals turned,  now i stay put,  second of his abuse,  not treated like a human,  thing left to use  scathed,  caged,  my life has passed,  light had left my hand,  i know i wonâ’t last,  i rise one last time and hug the ropes,  closing my eyes,  embracing the black cloak.

title: Hollow Happiness
author: radhika
text: while away my hours in the lap of indulgence,  surrounded by silk so soft and exotic ornaments,  bed of green paper and i'm plastered in gold,  carpets of gems and riches untold,  inside,  this heart is still the same,  blood,  tissues,  spirit so plain,  no depth,  just false peace and joy,  what's the point of all this wealth? when the soul of us remains destroyed,  ignored,  forgotten,  not given time,  we lose ourselves with every mile,  and every penny that we earn and boast,  ego and pride makes us pay the cost,  family,  ties and love remain,  buried in our greed and our games,  as we go on,  everything we lose,  purity or paper,  you have to choose.

title: Closed Doors
author: radhika
text: old cultures and lost traditions.  all rose from the sowing of the same seeds,  unity,  religion and belief,  behind those red brick walls,  hides a story far stronger than any before,  of epic battles and royalties,  of castles that we talk of today,  we really barely know,  the story behind the luxury of those days,  the story behind lives of gold,  to get a crown of the greatest jewels,  they have sacrificed their lives,  today we realize we have forgotten,  the words of those wise,  they sang their own different melodies,  celebrated with a different folk,  today we have forgotten in our history,  the past that they hold,  today our memories of them corrode,  like bricks of their own forts,  the significance drifts away from the shores of our modern plastic lives,  i know you've heard of the beauty of their past,  but tell me? do you know of the story behind those closed doors?

title: Imagination Is No Convict
author: rahul
text: the day you are called a lunitic,  possibilities are two,  you are a lunitic,  or thinking in a level which is fathomless.   don't feel dejected from estimations,  they are just ordinary,  unchomprensive things, they censure,  don't let it affect your leisure.   convinced by the fool's word? you are throwing your potential,  see the world as you perceive it,  don't see it with another's eyes.   imagination is not convict,  don't put it behind the bars,  let it free from its cage,  let it fly across the boundaries,   let it explore the unexplored,  you may hold the key,  to a different world,  where you will meet your soul.

title: One Song, One Hope..
author: rahul
text: let us write down a song of the merry past on the face of earth,  now a barren land with red from the veins in those million hungry eyes and drops of blood on the dagger's tip,  raised up high as religions fight.   then to highlight the happy songs of past,  let us draw clean lines with shades of grey from the dirty fumes that development breaths out.   let us wipe out the trash,  stacked as peaks from where the green once stood as heavenly guards to frame up a canvas as clean as the past for the song alone is the only hope. . . !!

title: The lucky rat
author: raj
text: the lucky rat!!    the naughty cat runs behind the poor rat   the rat runs with all his life to escape    the lucky rat finds a safe place n sits on the clock   the cats owner comes n pats his cat for chasing the rat   the lucky rat meantime runs n hides under the mat   the cats master gets angry n throws the cat to find the rat   the cat tries to hunt for the rat but in vain    the cat tries to find the rat as for his meal he had to    this goes on n it was rat's day n he escaped   the cat then goes to bed sadly. . . .

title: The Waiting Badam Tree
author: rajesh
text: in the lonely class room sitting on this empty back bench i look through the windows and see a rainbow spread against the vastness of the sky the cloud burst,  memories pour in.  first day,  i walked into the school with a quivering mind.  someone held my hand and led me to the class room-  the first touch of everlasting friendship! from then onwards it was weaved,  the invisible thread of connectedness.  someone opened the door of knowledge,  alphabets were learned,  books were read,  charts were made,  dreams were given wonderful colours.  learning became a never ending process.  atoms were split,  frogs dissected chemical reacted,  sums were added,  subtracted,  divided and multiplied â“ten thousand we saw in a glanceâ” of those daffodils.  through the atlas the whole world became closer through binoculars the moon,  stars and sun became nearer centuries were excavated revolution doused suddenly the whole world looked enchanting and varied.  beyond all this,  another life evolved the friendship thickened,  life brightened.  the homework was to be done together,  lunch to be shared,  i got hurt when you were punished,  films looked better when classes were bunked,  a glass of sherbath,  a bar of ice cream were always meant for both.  those strolls through the bylanes of the adjacent school those quick glances,  eager responses… those books we read,  hiding below the desks the eagerness to enact those titillating stories….   teachers who loved,  teachers who scared,  teachers who stood like beacon for years to come.   the speed in which the ball was bowled,  those special kicks which shook the net.  below the badam tree there was always shade.  on the steps of the church there was always peace.  we quarrelled,  hated and loved each other.  we lived our life without any planning.   on the last day you sang,  â“ life is all about parting and painâ” as the waves came to wash the shore,  we wrote â“ never will we part waysâ”.  we never thought,  still it happened.  somewhere on the way our paths were shortened.   the exams were over,  results declared we can take future steps to future,  we were told.  little did we knew that life had different plans.  like those rain drops which fell on the floor we rolled into different directions.   today sitting on this lonely back bench i look through the window the old badam tree spreads like a  grandfather waiting for his children to return the waves roll on to the shore,  whispering sweet nothings.  the fleet of stairs on the church is ready to accommodate everyone who comes back.  then i saw you walking through the gates!!!! then another,  an other,  and an other all were carrying school bags,  full of memories suddenly the bell rang and we ran to the classes the rooms are no more lonely,  the benches are not empty let us take turns to open and share what we brought and recover those days and decades which we lost.

title: It was you or...
author: ramit
text: it was you or the essence of your presence  it was you or the wind blowing your name  it was you or my breathe including your breathe  it was you or the fragrance of you in my mind  it was you or the felling of love for you residing in my heart  it was you or the movement of your anklets which sounds it was you or hotness of sun warming my life it was you or brightness of moon that shines  it was you or the air which i can't hold in my hand  it was you or my own shadow which never leave me  it was you or happiness that give a smile on my face  it was you or a magic which fill all my wounds with a touch and care  it was you or the beauty of nature that i always admire  it was you or its my soul in my body   it was you or the  heart that give me beats to live  it was you or the time who is changing it was you or my life which i fear i loose

title: Depression
author: randall
text: i am either alive or i am dead; my greatest regrets are repeating in my head; feeling so empty and cold,  like a puddle of my own blood forming a silhouette of a mold; wondering if i'll ever be missed,  trapped in my own darkness,  lost to the lucidity of my own mind; the depression,  a war in time; counting down the days left in my life time; i am in deep hurt and in desperate need to commit my own crime; trying to breath,  but no longer living i have lost all hope; this depression has taken over me and life for me is at a downward slope; i am confused to what is real; i feel i am living in surreal;  i wake up daily to wonder if i'll make this through; never ceases to end,  my depression is always something new!!

title: Life of Three Puppies
author: randy
text: looking at an overstuffed blanket three puppies cuddle happily as their roommate leaves.   yawning and stretching between the blanket as if they own the cloth.  swaddling and holding  each other.   hours past and the roommate returns walking through the door to rest his body under the blanket the puppies no longer want.

title: Seuss Sonnet
author: raven
text: i much prefer the style of dr.  seuss whose rhymes will bring a smile to every face.  without the stress of complicated clues,  he takes you to a charming,  silly place.  where â“whosâ” are found on tiny specks of grass,  and cats in hats can live on different heads as red fish,  blue fish counted as they pass,  bring joy to children laying in their beds.  though some may choose the tangled,  hidden word,  with twists and turns of fancy,  complex themes,  the likes of which my ears have seldom heard,  nor touched my heart and entered in my dreams.  so take your shakespeare as you pass my door,  iâ’ll take my dr.  seuss forevermore.

title: I Believe
author: ravneet
text: i walk,  i talk,  i run,  i see,  i see.  people asian,  african american,   muslim,  and even indian.  no matter how hard one works.  we are discriminated because the color of our skin.  i see it.  i feel it.  all around us including everywhere.  being a punjabi woman in this world.  people question my religion and my ways of life.  the amount of hard work,  i put into school projects,  clubs,  and extra activities.  is something iâ’m proud of although,  the recognition i receive isnâ’t shown or presented highly.  not being the â‘averageâ’ white female makes me a minority makes me feel that whites win it all.  competitions where i am competing against others.  i get judged.  all over discrimination is presented from subways to classrooms.  the path iâ’ve found myself in.  now trying to crawl outside.  i believe people do still discriminate.  discrimination is presented negatively.  together we can change that.  make discrimination the past not the future.  letâ’s stand together.  letâ’s walk,  talk,  run,  and see the future together as equals.

title: Beautiful eyes
author: raysa
text: what are you thinking? i can see behind your glasses your beautiful eyes,  theyâ’re saying something that i can understand.   are you thinking of me? i jus see under those eyebrows your beautiful eyes,  screaming something that i can understand  and you say: i would like… i really would like to be there with you but i â‘m sorry,  i am busy by now even youâ’re important for me i really have to finish this.   and i think: i would like… i really would like to wake up,  and see your strong body by my side with your white skin and say good morning looking at your beautiful eyes.   look at my face and tell me that you donâ’t love me or tell me that you donâ’t need me but i know that behind your glasses those beautiful eyes canâ’t lie  now you are there with your blue jacket waving your hand again saying â“good bye my angelâ” sending me a million kisses  we both know is not a good bye is a see you later but,  anyway hurts because i love you you are my true love

title: ''What are animals saying?''
author: reagan
text: what do animals say when they speak? when birds chirp when a cow moos  when a lion roars  when a snake hisses  my child,  they simply tell the world that itâ’s loved  when a horse neighs  when a cat meows  when a dog barks  when a chicken clucks  theyâ’re reminding you that youâ’re precious  when a mouse squeaks  when a pig oinks  when an eagle screeches  remember that youâ’re adored and nature is beautiful.

title: Gardening
author: rebecca
text: and it grows,  like a flower inside of you.  eating you  alive, and leaving me  with the faintest memory toâ  hold on to.   and it blooms.  it's petals suffocating the final remains of who you were.   thorny like a thistle,  it stings me to see you this way.  beautiful birds of paradise,  growing inside of you.  blooming.   and after the final prognosis,  dr.  feinberg,  our gardener- allows you to let go of the dying roots attaching you and let your garden bloom.

title: Tomorrow, you will be free
author: regether
text: please don't stop me,  my love,  let me lie down and kiss the ground,  let me  taste the taste of freedom on my tongue and remember my past no more.   let my tongue mingle with the sand and the sun comfort my soul,  for the earth has opened up her mouth and swallowed  my past,  no more pain,  no more fear,   only sweet music shall ring in my ear.   look down on her,  o lord,  look down and see your daughter weeping in the sand,  she ripped out her heart and has cast  it into the sea,  she said,  ''tomorrow,  i will be free. ''  but the ground where she laid is now drunken with her past,  affliction and confusion,  the sea has spewed out her heart and the sun has hidden his face.   i tried to comfort her and said,  ''come my love,  come,  for tomorrow is still yet to come, '' but she cannot be comforted,  her  body's covered with wounds i cannot see and her words i cannot understand.   night is fallen and my soul grows weak but i will not leave her i will cuddle her in my arms and whisper in her ears,  ''tomorrow,  you will be free,  tomorrow,    you   will   be   free. ''

title: Coldest Touch
author: regina
text: it was the coldest night of winter the air fell so stiff and dead the stars were dancing,  spilling glitter this formed a path to where they lead   the path was long; a great big journey made up of agony and lust  there came about a jar of honey with crusty spoon and lumps of dust  on the right,  stood marbled mirrors on the left,  a wooden shelf on the top eroded heavens  with their god eating itself  the path went on to further touch there came a demon from afar  i bore not to believe of such  yet he spoke of him as lucifer      this took away the frozen breath  diminished moons for non to shine the gentle pale clump of death oh,  how i wish in it to twine!   the stars now begging for compassion   they are the prisoners of skies  they are the cause of this attrition  promoting light on all the lies   forgive them master  forgive them once it is their luster    it is their dance  the judgment soon begins at once before the spiteful and the vast i now leaf through the made valance  which tops the bed thatâ’s made to last  the pathway severs in an instance the avaricious gods now think  consuming all surrounded pleasance  in the vicinity of brink  the cries are heard within an inch  they are insightful with despair the dancing stars begin to clinch the waltz now put into a lair   i close my lids so none i see of this vile carnage soon to halt  i only beg for gods to plea  the sinful deeds to be exalt   oh dear master! lucifer! how can you grant this imperfection upon the good that you infer

title: Blind
author: regina
text: +blind the lights flashing,  the screaming,  siren sounds  the sounds of chaos all around burning building,  running feet blood flowing in the streets why do we do this to each other its because of faiths,  race,  or color we are so blind we cannot see the way that jesus sees you and me he doesnâ’t see us as brown,  red,  yellow,  black and white.  but a kaleidoscope of color ,  all of us precious in his sight .  a spectrum of beautiful colors all sisters and brothers a bouquet of people around his throne surround every race,  creed,  culture there is found.  all different,  unique ; his daughters and sons different but when we worship him we are one one people all of the human race gazing in christâ’s  loving face.  those of as that call upon his name should realize in christ we are all the same we need to forgive what has happened in the past and embrace each other and then at last our eyes can be open and then we will see that we will be set free we will take off our blinders of prejuice and hate and see ourselves the way christ  sees us.

title: Void
author: renato
text: dancing stars in the eternal night,  blazing days in the illusional sunshine,  restless days in the infinite night.  we all dream about our own life,  but no hope,  no cry,  there is nothing  to wait for in this illusional sunshine.  what is beauty is far gone,  all desires are illussionals flows.  don't rest,  don't spend your life waiting for the sun light.  the only blessing in this life is to look at the eternal night,  and if you are lucky enough maybe one day,  you will see,  a falling star.

title: Archipelago
author: renee
text: i trace my finger along the arch the bottom of your foot forms an archipelago sea of wrinkled flesh,  etched deep within are islands anguilla,  barbuda,  antigua i see your lips move to form the sounds,  your tongue moving in your mouth over crooked teeth enunciate  five points connect to distant stars the dust from where we emerged i imagine we are nestled under a brilliant night sky all sea and sand radiating out from us for miles we form irregular patterns,  our damp bodies hinge and move,  connecting bone and muscle we draw close and press for comfort; our feet disappear this nest,  this damp shelter,  under the waves this is all i have of you vague images of what could have been a tropical paradise,  limitless sky my thoughts are chained together like a string of islands connected,  deep,  and anchored your feet move,  cushion,  and propel you away to distant shores,  where you are settled under our shared sky this is all i have of you the shape of your foot,  the memory of your mouth disappear like impressions in sand my finger traces the shape of an island,  a long chain in the sea,  stretching endlessly away

title: I can't make you love me
author: revealcy
text: how i wish you could see my heart,  it's been shatered and torn apart; i wish i can convinced you,  that my love for you is true.   is something wrong that i have done? oh darling,  please tell me this one; without you it's meaningless,  like a boat that's anchor-less.   my heart aches at the thought of you,  how to make you understand too? but i can't make you love me; even if i cry out in agony.

text: its wonderful to watch the flowers,  created by our god,  the maker; orange,  white,  pink,  red,  yellow and blue,  welcoming bees just like instant glue.  blooming away season by season,  summer,  winter with special reason; but the prettiest among them all- its the flower

title: My life line
author: rheema
text: sitting here pondering thinking in the dark my life without you will be is so stark,   my feelings for you  will always be true i struggle to find it within myself to tell you without you in my life i will suffer ill health you constantly tell me to tell you what i feel without your encouragement i will keel  youâ’re my friend my confidante my saviour someone whoâ’s light will change my behaviour i want you know  no matter where go  or what you need  you know iâ’m here as you friend indeed you have managed to find a key that will hopefully allow me to be free,   i need to tell from afar   that you guide like a star youâ’re the angel who has touched my heart my friend from the start it took a while to let you in  now that you here for me,  my life can begin youâ’re always by my side even when i try to hide  before you came,  i lived through my dark existences but now youâ’re smile brightens my sad existence you are here for me to holdyour hand always listening and trying to understand you pick me up when i fall always around to answer my call you show that you care  when one else was there  you always try to bring me close  when i need you most  ii know you assume i am being used but you here for me when iâ’m confused  i try to be honest with you and try not hiding my feelings with lies but i know if i do you see through my disguise your one of few who never made me cry,   being with you is a constant high  even after all these years.  making me safe to tell you my fears  i tell now that i write this to my friend  with all my heart from beginning to end your friendship to me is like gift something that always allows my spirit to lift  with you in my life i will get in no strife for you and your grace makes my life a happier place we may not have been good friends from the start but i can honestly say youâ’ve left your have left your mark on my heart

title: Sea
author: rhian
text: the sea is colourful,  the sea is bright,  i want to see you again sometime,  i like the waves,  i like the glaze,  please dont fade away today.

title: Mankind
author: rhiannon
text: pay attention to the humanism,   the humanism is the most enlightening cultural movement of all.   never forget the unedifying and unenlightening humanism.   i saw the wonderful anatomy of my generation destroyed,   how i mourned the person.   are you upset by how extraordinary it is?  does it tear you apart to see the person so wondrous?  just like modern times,  is the civilisation?  does the civilisation make you shiver?  does it?  when i think of the humanity,  i see a sinful world.   never forget the sensationalistic and unhealthy humanity.   one afternoon i said to myself,   ''why aren't people more versed?''  do people make you shiver?  do they?  i saw the responsible group of my generation destroyed,   how i mourned the humankind.   does the humankind make you shiver?  does it?

title: Honesty
author: rhiannon
text: i see you there in front of me- your face, your hands, your eyes,  i hear you talk, i hear you tell your hopes your dreams your lies.  i walked with you a sunlit trail together hand in hand then twilight came and you were gone and now alone i stand the woods are cold the trees are black the dark is closing in and you have gone away from me your faultless light has dimmed betrayal is a empty space raw night cold room alone and no one can redeem your face sweet knight safe light your gone

title: You and me
author: rhiannon
text: you lift your voice and i lift mine,  too bright ribbon intertwine.  i hear the pulse,  i feel the beat,  we sing as one,  we are complete.  duets are not for one,  but too,  and no one else for me but you.

title: World of dreams
author: rhiannon
text: they shout and cry,  i wonder why they mean and scream while i dream.  i dream of peace where no one shouts,  no one tells lies and no one cries iâ’m all alone where no one can moan no one can scream in my land of dream.

title: NAP TIME FOR BABY
author: rhonda
text: once upon a time i sang a nursery rhyme i rocked him as i sang but then the phone rang i answered the phone but there was no tone the line then went dead and i hung my head you interupted my nursery rhyme it happens all the time to put him to sleep i will repeat the nursery rhyme once more there was a tap at the door i said please,  please no more my baby needs his nap so please,  please dont tap let my baby rest when he awakes he'll be his best he'll for a while and wiggle around in style he'll need his diaper changed this i can arrange nice fresh and clean he'll be and my smiling face he'll see

title: Spaghetti On Her Head
author: rhonda
text: what a site she turned out to be,  went a walking with spaghetti on her head.  out the door she went fast as a bear trap attached to a tree,  up and down the street she went calling out and saying come everyone follow me.  she  walked for a hour or more,  than out of the blue she tore off the spaghetti and said,  okay i'm done.

title: The Monster Under My Bed
author: rhonda
text: when i awoke one morning,  a little girl was clutching the crown of my head i asked,  ''what are you doing,   so early out of your bed. ''  she glanced shook her finger and said,   ''shssh mommy,  there is a monster hiding under my bed''.  i explained that she had to be truly mistaken because monsters exist only in our imagination.   the little girl's eyes were extra wide open white as golf balls with one big black button her face was flushing her hands were quite shaky  i could plainly see,  the little girl was not faking.  so i sprang out of bed and searched high and low,  i was determined that the mean old monster just had to go.   but to our surprise and with great delight the something that had given the little girl such a fright,  really was not a monster at all,   it was just her wide-eyed wiggly windup doll.

title: Bravery leading to its own Destruction
author: roger
text: battle arises in the frontline  by which swords,  shields and blades crash together devolving around human ambition   and desperation to remain alive.   the general received the order of protecting the kingsâ’ most valuable treasure,  his son.  desperately looking for him,  he voluntarily  penetrates the enemy frontline madly looking for him.   swords crash and the general keeps advancing forward,   killing every enemy that stands in his way.   blood in seen on his hands,  his ambition for accomplishing the order maintains his anxiety to continue killing by advancing forward.   the general descry the kingsâ’ son surrounded by enemy forces  and commands the cavalry to follow him.  the huge innumerous army cavalry follows his command,  a battle line of horses approached in an unbelievable speed.   the kingsâ’ son fights to remain alive,   his valor maintains him standing packed.  suddenly,  he slips into the ground  and his body his body is being slide with a rope by the enemyâ’s horse.    the enemy observes the fury of the cavalry approaching.  cowardly,  along with the son,  they retreat to their base with the son being slide by the horse but… the rope is cut and he is left into the middle of the open battlefield.   the enormous cavalry arrives and surrounds the kingsâ’ treasure.  the captain orders to untie the rope that had slide the son.  suddenly they hear a trumpet sounding,  like an ambush was imminent.  second after,  sunlight is cover with arrows and darts,  leaving the cavalry vulnerable in open space.   the captain,  along with the son and his mounted troops are hit.  slowly they fall into the ground,  looking at each other,  as they never met.   death touch the door of each of them,  leaving all of them death.  like an old man that is vulnerable when death arrives to their lives.  truth reveals the controversy of outcomes by which people take paths that leads them to the abstract ending  of their valuable life

title: Nights of cold Days

title: Mike

title: MY HEART BLEEDS

text: i saw a child , eight summers old his face was  ruddy, his hair gold one glance i threw , upon the child whose eyes were blue, whose lips were red his beauty caste a spell on me,  i praised god ,  bending on my knee  i saw a land whose men freed themselves from the servile bond,  love , valour, friendship were their features,  a land where people saw full moon and enjoyed flowers in full bloom fields so freshâ’n green that is appeared as a land in dream  at once  i heard a blast here now,  i stand gazing all around the spell is broken the land of dream shaken,  on glancing fresh blood on the ground of those ,  whose features were love, friendship and valour.  my heart bleeds ,  on what my eyes see now  i seethe childâ’s body,  whose body lifeless lay,  whose dreams , snatched away his blue  eyes,  wide open ,  as if ,  asking god : why did it happen? why my lord,  my heart bleeds  and asks why? there come within no reply! then,  there comes a soldier and says,  terrorists are dead! nobody could have fled the child is dead! the blood , so red ,  many tears my eyes have shed,  my heart bleeds ! and pleads! peace ! peace !peace

title: Recovery begins...
author: samantha
text: in the darkness the devil hides emotionless,  senseless and under disguise.  he drawls you in closer and closer until your completely terrified.  the shadows taunt your every move.  your clueless with what to do.  the voices are nothing more then the thoughts of wanting to die.  your sick of the high.  the devil is still standing,  this time laughing and trying to reel you into your bed.  your crying i'm silence and holding your head.  shouting to god ''when will this end?'' suddenly you see a light arise before your very eyes. . .  a mans voice says ''child i've heard your cries now trust in me i carry no lies. '' you take the hand and stand strong again.  you fight for your life and misery ends.  in the midst of at this the devil leaves and recovery begins. . .

author: samantha

title: TWO MINDS, ONE BEING.
author: samvrith
text: two minds,  one being.    once was a mortal,  reading a war.   not against anyone,  but deep within.    split,  against oneself,  light and dark raging inside.   a fierce battle commenced,  helpless,  for which was the right side?  the light trying to maintain happiness,  while darkness replying with fear.   when connected,  created a ripple,  shattering the mortal,  thought.    one side trying to keep him alive,  while the other foods him with fear,  darkness.   the light desperate to shine,  only to be extinguished,  a win for fear.    in the end,  with no other choice.   the mortal departs,  from the world.    the mortal now free.   the darkness prevailed,  it's point proven.  no one left to conquer it,  no one left to fight it.       i write this to let the people who are affected due to anxiety and depression it anything,  to let them know,  that you can speak up,  reach out to us because,  we will always be there for you. .

title: Charming Sorrow

text: world has lost its shine and people are lossing their mind,  catch your feeling inside,  dont let it fade away.  life has many turns but you turn in your way.  never forget that this is your last one,  try and get the fun,   many of us loose the shine,  and never try to get it back again.  never think to run away,  it stays all the way.   your struggles can be the ladder to your goals,  failures cant define who you are,  rest in your hand.   never blame anyone for your sutiation.  it was yours when it turned.  getting back the charm is also in your hand.  never turn back to your mournful.  move forward as you go and it takes.
