title: Don't be down.
author: sara
text: donâ’t think in a negative way just leave everything to its day donâ’t think too much or you may may stay under pressure for many days  leave everything to come on its own  donâ’t prepare for everything to be born may time pass and you can learn learn to be strong and do everything on your own smile to the world and face its ups and downs donâ’t blame yourself and donâ’t be down everything will be easily found either up or on the ground just hold on hope and make it sound a day will come and will change from being lost to being found donâ’t think about people to much some donâ’t even deserve to be in touch just think about ones that you trust this is because they are a must so think but not too much before taking a step that may cost you so much.   written by:sara h

title: These Days
author: sara
text: the days go so fast,  as the sun beats hot.   outside,  his car is pulling down my street.   i slowly walk closer,  hop in his seat.   he holds me,  shows me,  and i make the shot!  his mom is home,  and look at what she brought!   our song comes on,  we sing every beat.    cannonball in the pool,  to beat the heat.   he holds me so tight,  as the sun beats hot.    the snow on the ground makes the days so long.   thinking about that cute boy i once met.   my head,  it won't ever let me forget.    a familiar beat,  of course our song,   singing along with my cheeks soaking wet.    being alone makes these days so long.

title: Distance
author: sara
text: im glad that things are this way now that we are apart for just a while i know that i will never take you for granted  because i know now what its like to be without you  i know in my heart that this is right  you were meant for me as i am for you a missing puzzle piece in my heart you complete my life and make me whole when we are apart im not the same incomplete and wrong to be without you is to be without air a pen without ink  a turtle without its shell you,  the reason for my laughter the inspiration to smile  to continue on this crazy ride called life that without you is meaningless  i guess what im trying to say is. .  baby will you marry me

title: Disneyland with My Friend
author: sara
text: dancing around in a world of our own,  wearing our glowing ears as the crowd grumbles by.  no one does matter to me more than you,  glistening with your vibrant ears.

title: People
author: sara
text: questioning everybodyâ’s motive,  wondering what everyone has in store,  thinking no one will ever truly succeed,  because everyone is a bore.   no one will ever be really happy,  it doesnâ’t seem to ever matter to anyone,  all people seem to want is money,  we should all learn to just soak up the sun.   why is money so important?,  friends and family make me smile.  why is social standing so significant?,  people just seem so hostile.

title: Little Princess Alana
author: sara
text: little princess alana,  today your turning one.  presents,  cakes and candles are oh so much fun.   smiles,  laughs and giggles all throughout the day.   watching you grow up is something you just can't explain!  you went from lying on the couch to crawling super fast.   no teeth to eight teeth,  oh it's been a blast!  pulling mommys hair,  smacking daddys face.  what will you do next? oh we can't wait!  your mom and dad are proud of you,  your such a great big girl.   little princess alana,  your our entire world!!!  happy birthday!

title: Courtney [The Bestie!]
author: sarah
text: courtney and me grew up together.  we played in all kinds of weather.  she makes me laugh.  especially with her hatred of photographs.  i will miss her in college.  thank goodness we will get all kinds of knowledge.  then i can go visit her.  cause with all that knowledge the directions will be so much simpler.

title: Have You Ever
author: sarah
text: have you ever? have you ever felt so empty inside? like there's this big hole that you can never hide.  a place in your heart you just want to fill,  knowing that nothing or anyone ever will.  a tear in your eye,  a question in your heart,  yearning for the answers and trying not to fall apart.  wanting to be strong,  but knowing that you can't last that long.  you pray to god to take it all away,  but it always seems to stay.  you cry for help you scream in pain,  but helps not enough your going insaine.  have you ever felt this way,  or am i the only one that has all this to say?

title: To Stand Alone
author: sarah
text: the cloudy sky of the eerie night,   bringing its victims terror and fright;  the soul of the moon eaten and dead,   the heart of a girl swollen with dread.   pitch black is the night,  enclosed by the dark,   she picks up her feet and wanders the park.   the trees seem alive and ready to kill,   the sights of their eyes have made her so ill.   she holds to her stomach and begins to cry.   the rain on her head,  not an inch of her dry.   she looks to the sky and starts to glare,   and raises her arm high above her wet hair.   with a swipe of her hand,  she moves the great cloud.   the sunshine lets in,  the birds chirping so loud.   her illness,  her dread,  her sadness,  her fright,   she pushed them away,  and let in the light.

title: The Battle
author: sarah
text: we stand to authority very hostile.  on our faces,  a bleeding smile.  they ask us to go hit and fight in the scary depths of night.  hearts pound at the name of our foes whoâ’ve gone insane.  but in their eyes,  weâ’re no better and they fight us in the raining weather,  hoping to make a better place as they kill those in our race.  but donâ’t forget we are the same as they also fear our name.  and we continue with our war and feel the blood leave our core.  death and despair inside the night that we all faked a happy fight.  so remember where i stand hoping one day hand-in-hand and the word,  â“foeâ” left our mind something to be left behind.  but till that day,  weâ’ll have a fight trying to find our thought on right to be inside our enemyâ’sâ’ brain during this,  the pouring rain.  one day,  we must all realize that our enemies have different eyes,  but the same thought,  they all think like a boat,  the bad must sink.  so remembering what our pasts have shown in our hearts that we have grown,  see the day through another heart,  and never will we grow apart.  and we will soon become one under the rays of the sun,  or be doomed forever till the end for we will never make a friend to help us through that night of hell,  to help the wound that shouldnâ’t swell,  to always stand with us,  side-by-side,  for on that night,  we all will cry.

title: A Cool Winter's Night
author: sarah
text: i came to my home a cool winterâ’s night,  the snow to my feet; a blizzard in sight.  my eyes became dry from the shivering cold,  but then i saw a sight to behold.  the snow spun in place and an angel appeared,  grass beneath her,  for the snow had all cleared.  in her hands,  she held a small toy; a dancer with a song of innocent joy.  she gave it to me; my eyes had turned wide,  and she whispered,  â“a child is not something to hide. â” at first i did not know what she meant but i played with the gift that the angel had sent.  the dancer spun with spirit and heart and nothing could tear that spirit apart.  i smiled and looked,  but the saint was not there and i learned her message sitting in the cold air.  my inner child had wanted to play.  for years they had waited for that faithful day.  the angel came,  and made me become whole for the gift i received was a part of my soul.

title: The Struggle
author: sarah
text: the alarm clock sheathes her in an orange hue unblinking,  the numbers stand fierce centuries on watch for any deviation from reality  yet she dares to steal a peek just one glance,  a small taste of reality she twists quickly to the window lets her imagination flow for one pure moment  she has broken free.

title: Trance
author: sarah
text: its sound enters my bloodstream,  the bass pumping with my heart.  it drives my body to move,  i love to dance,  i love the music.   i feel my body get more tense,  i start to sweat as the heat gets more intense.  people all around me,  jumping and dancing,  i'm surrounded and so entranced,  i'm so joyous.   dancing the night away,  lights manipulated by my movement,  the blacklight making the bracelets lining my arm glow.  i just love dancing to this music.

title: Ode To A Rose
author: sarah
text: ode to a rose the symbolization of love oh,  what a beauty it truly is.  the rose demands to be recognized,  for its beauty in all colors.  we are all the same rose and come in different colors,  yet we make people so happy.  why is that so? how do we make people so happy? maybe it's just the idea of being used as a gift,  or can it be that people really do see our outer and inner beauty? red,  pink,  yellow,  white,  and orange,  lavender,  novelty,  salmon,  peach,  cream,  and green.   we range in different colors,  and seem to bring smiles to peopleâ’s faces.  yet again,  why is it so? is it that weâ’re all the same flower,  but not the same in color so thereâ’s a variety of us to choose from?  itâ’s possible that regardless of our colors,  people love us for who we are and the fact of bringing such joy to people makes us happy in different ways no one understands.  reason being that when we die,  our next rose will become more beautiful than we ever were.

title: Heartstrings (I wanna be your violin)
author: sarah
text: back in time,  we were pure strangers,  but we're just the same as a violin players.  we were just passing each other,  not knowing,  we will play it together.   you we're so excellent in playing violin,  and i'v always stare at you playin'.  did you know you gives me much inspiration,  that put me to play violin with passion.   just like our violin,  we do take care of it,  and i hope you'll take care of me too.  just like our violin,  we do love it so much,  and i hope you'll love me that much.

title: I am a Tossed Salad
author: sarah
text: i am a tossed salad  i am a tossed salad in many,  many ways.  my personality seems to change each and every day.  some days i am a radish,  crunchy,  ornery,  and hotter than hell,  while other days a peppercorn,  spicy and sassy,  but youâ’d never tell.  some days i am a tomato,  sweet and full of flavor,  and some days a cucumber,  as one would like to savor.  there are days i am the lettuce,  feeling so menial and forgotten,  while other days i am the dressing,  on top of the world and talking.  and all this is tossed deep,  deep inside.  which ones come first and which do i hide?

title: Twenty-Ten
author: sarah
text: in the end high school goes by like a dream grades,  friends,  enemies,  drama,  sports,  and teams all seem like one big blurr while i'm sitting on this graduation stage scared for what is ahead and scared for my future  i look around me at all the students of my twenty-ten class in a couple years they will all just be a distant memory as we disperse into the world and try our own things some will fail others will live their own dreams

title: Holy land for my mother
author: saskia
text: i can hear lup tup sound from my heart .  a sound of thirsty a sound of need.  i am having a huge aim in my life it is a thing may what i need only for that to my life which give meaning it is that i need to make my mother happy.  i don't need a huge salary i don't need a good living hood styles or a living world fantasy but i need my mothers laugh with a mind full of joy as well iam not a person who iam with lot of worth in my palm not a wealthy gene but thing i need only is my mothers patting with wonder full smile .  yes she is my angel she is my love my mother my queen i want you to be happy always as much i have life

title: WATER - THE LIFE DRINK
author: satyadeep
text: known of divine origin,  is the water we take in.   is a part of the basics,  five that we take in to sustain our life.   water is the origin,  water is the taker,  the most abundant element on the planet is water.   formed of two elements is this life sustaining element,  without water,  what to do,  but lose our present.   water is beautiful as much as essential,  firm to ears is its sound so much musical.   colourless yet so colourful,  water is what supports a life bountiful.   known is water for its purity,  clean in its content,  absolute of serenity.   this abundant availability of the globe faces a threat today,  thus itâ’s time we should make a hay.   troubled of the burgeoning pollution and industrialization,  clean water available is at its minimum.   hundreds of thousands desert of this utmost necessity,  itâ’s we who,  squander it unaware of its availability.   my beloved friends,  neither me nor you can end this scarcity,  one in one and so on,  must we make up to unity.   save water! save water! save water! is what we need say,  if not get set to face the dooms day.   water is life,  water is health,  no doubt,  itâ’s even wealthier than all the worldâ’s wealth.  save water,  save life.

title: White Moon
author: saynab
text: white moon   the moon is but a shivering queen.    her long white hair will make all men glare   at it's delicate chastity.    her feet are like fragile lilies,    demure,  sweet and pure,   and grown with the utmost care.   her shinning nails are like the skin of a whale,   bristle,  but still shinning and twining during the coldest months.   and the glory of her face cannot be explained,   for if men were to stare at it for the slightest minute,    its numbing light will unwittingly blind every human.

title: Mooses
author: scott
text: mooses are cool.  mooses are fun.  mooses taste good,  on a bun.  mooses are nice.   mooses eat rice.  mooses don't taste good if they have lice.  achh moo weeooweeoo meow peace out.

title: Trees
author: sean
text: the sun arises from its sleep in the big blue deep as birds tweet tweet on my arms   and the squrils run up me with there cheks full of bounty for my leaves begin to fade and my arms begin to crack for i am dieing as the sun begins to set

title: Fired Up
author: sean
text: second gear,  third gear,  and fourth gear iâ’m gone,  iâ’ma let the rubber burn as iâ’m riding along.  signing autographs later right now iâ’m in my zone,  the gate just dropped got my hole shot on!  curve coming quick kick it down gear two,  snatched out the corner clutching three so smooth.  thereâ’s a honda behind me suzuki on the right,  kentucky blue yamaha creeping left side.  i aint letting none of yall beat me to the line,   lime green kawasaki trying to steal my shine! as i come across the line and see that white flag,  got no one in front of me,  i got it in the bag! two turns to go and im beating chad reed,  out front 5 seconds,  sweet i got the lead.  crowd going nuts as they see me coming fast,  never thought id be here lookin at my past.  to the top of the podium is where iâ’m gonna go,  making that paper and that cash flow!

author: sean
text: many things are revisited many things need to be revised but one thing i know for sure is that nothin will ever be reconsidered

title: Half and half
author: seemore bu
text: half and half are alright,  less than half is bad;when i come along less than half it really makes me mad.  more than half is great, when their more than great i don't got to rate.

title: From the moment i saw you
author: seepika
text: from the moment i saw u, i completely fell for u.   you are the love within my heart, that i can't live without.   every time you are just beside me, but i feel as though you are so far away i really miss u.   until there was you, my life had no direction, a road of uncertainty.   not even a minute has passed by, and my thoughts are only for you.   i can't get you out of my mind,  i am not sure what is in your mind, in your heart.   i want to hear you say that you love me and miss me.   you are my breath, you are my world.  my heart beats with thoughts of you.   you are the one i dream of, and you are the one i truly adore.   finally things are how they are supposed to be, me with you and you with me. . . . . . . . . . love you!!

title: The night sky
author: selena
text: i dream of the night sky in the dark of my room i always see the night sky bloom with the light in the sky

title: Love me for who I am.
author: senzo
text: love me for who i am,  not for what i am.  not for what i put on.  as my heart is still on.  not for how i look,  for how i do things.  for how i make you feel.  not for my money.  not for my car.  not for my big crib.  just for who i am.  love me for who i am.

title: Even now you don't
author: senzo
text: i've set myself to do everything for you,  but you never seem to understand.  i've said everything i can to you,  but you never seem to take a stand.  even when i weep for you,  you never seem to care.  i don't know what's going on,  on you mind,  but to me its not fair.  words are strong they say,  but actions does all the emphasis.  i wrote this for you,  but you don't,  seem to know that i did that for you.  i tried to prove a point but,  you don't seem to know.  even now you don't.

title: Through Everything
author: sergio
text: i'll be your guiding light i'll be your day,  i'll be your night i'll stick with you through thick and thin.  through ups and down,  losses or wins.  i'll help you start over and forget the past just stick with me and and be happy at last.

title: Why?
author: sergio
text: all the stars that you see at night are how much love i have for you.  even though we're not together the love is still there.  i love you so much that i would do anything to turn the hands of time,  and go back how it was when the passion and love was once there.  when we would tell each other that we love one another.  when we thought that we would stay together and plant the seeds that we would and nothing would separate not even death.  can you see,  baby i love you so much that i would even die for you.  i miss you a lot; please come back to my arms where once you felt secure and loved; and let's finish what we said with love what we would do.

title: One, Two, Three
author: sergio
text: one,  two,  three on an autumn leaf they live and laugh,  they love and leave every saturday morning always happy and free.   one,  two and three,  leave the house made of leaves.  one says: to freedom! two says: to conquer! three says: no matter what happens we have to return before than the shadows had covered the sun.   one wants some tea,  but there is none.  two wants a ball,  to play with her bro's three's very sleepy she is trying to think what thought her two brothers to start all this trip.   one,  two and three,  in the very sunbeam,  had reached the seashore,  an adventure begins. . .   an autumn leave on the years to come will become their little house and they will call it home.   but now in the sunset the open arms of the world embrace all their spirits and lead them to go  once again all in new,  twice the story's been told,  thrice the poem's been sung. . .  one,  two,  three. . .  they are gone!

title: Who knew
author: shachar
text: who knew  who knew that i have lots of money (im rich)    who knew  who knew that i live in a small house with 999  other brothers and sisters    who knew  who knew  that im telling things im not supposed to tell

text: what is book ? do you think it's a piece of paper   no its not,  do you know what is book? the book is the image of knowledge  the book is the life   the book is the vehicle ! which leads you to your destiny  the book is a thing  which is loved by all   it gives pleasure  it gives knowledge  it gives meaning  it gives address  for wise it is a gift for fool it is a paper  those who love books they are in the right track those who have books ! they are in the end   if you think it is valuable  it shows its value   do you know what is book ?  the book is everything, everything  they are the source of learning  they are source of interest  they are everything

title: Life is the key
author: shameel
text: life is the power to live every hour,  the sea is solitude because everyone entered another location.  a vacation is the answer to observe a new creation will bring you appreciation.  my heart and soul is the key to your knowledge and my emotion is the steam to your infatuating smile.  life is a horror because every one erases the happiness and without compassion,  dreams will be worthless because their is no passion.  you stole my gold and drifted beyond the mountain,  by repairing a new gold fountain.  i observe into your eyes and i see a special connection,  by watching both of our reflections.  you will never loose my protection because i am one of your best selection.  the wind will whisper your thoughts and send me the message through heaven,  when reached the last moment of my life being the number lucky seven.

title: Bones
author: shane
text: i hope you feel the pain inflicted by a thousand demented minds i hope you hold the guilt of death and live a thousand lives i hope you live long enough to see your loved ones die till evey painful memory within you simply thrives  i will search the darkest dreams of mine to make them even stronger till the seven angels weap for you and make the pain last longer  sutured wounds that bleed and sting the profile of a dieing thing and as your eyes fade to grey i can find relief in seeing you pay  we can hide somewhere no one knows and i will stay with you,  until your. . .  bones

title: Golden Perfection
author: shanice
text: a ray of golden brown light with peanut butter tints. the glow is far to strong,  but happens to be just right.  moves with the sunlights uv straights rays leaving trails of astonishment to follow.  unique,  talent,  and fun follow side by side in the light. wonder who can this be? surpize me!!!

title: Dreams
author: shanique
text: what are dreams  i can tell that they are not what they always seem when you think your dream has finally come true you are right back to step one and two i have some how gave up on dreams because when they don't come true i want to scream i have been waiting for the day to come.   when my dream to come come come.

title: Waiting
author: shannan
text: waiting and waiting for my ride to arrive how long could it take how long can i survive how long must i wait now you wait my ride has arrived oh what a wait.

title: The fish
author: shannon
text: when i awoke one morning a fish was on my head.  i asked,  ''what are you doing there?'' it looked at me and said i like it here.  your hair is soft.  i think i'll stay.  it's like a loft.  ''there is one thing you must do, '' the fish inquired of me.  ''i'll need water so i can swim,  and stay alive you see. '' so as he spoke,  he made a list.  of things he'd need and how to mist.  it wasn't hard to do at all.  but did cause lots to stare.  not many people have a fish that lives within their hair.  so now my hair  is always wet.  but it's o. k.  cause he's my pet.

title: She is unstoppable
author: shanza
text: ,  she is fierce,  she is strong,  she isn't simple.  she is crazy and sometimes she will stay quiet but she always has something to say.  she wanna fly but she will never forget her limits.  she is not like any other girl.  she is different.  she dreams in color,  she dreams in red.  she is the girl that rules her life like a bird in flight.  she is the girl that laughs the hardest at her own jokes.  she is the girl that will never care what anyone thinks.  she is the girl that will always stand by your side when u need her.  she has flaws but she is clothed with strength.  she has her faults but she is clothed with dignity.  she is made up of words that no one can understand.  she is made up of depths that no one can see.  she is perfect in her own way,  but one idea describes her the best,  ''she is unstoppable'',  not because she did not have gone through failures or doubts but because she continued on despite them,  she moved on with a confidence that allah loves her so much that she will never be alone and she took anything she wanted with a smile on her face.

title: Not my take.
author: sharon
text: i am frustrated.  poems are not my take i tried to fake  words are hard to find my mind is a blank i do not know where to begin and wish i was in the end.   to comprehend it is not my take  i feel penned  like a sad sheep  i just want to weep.

title: Gray Lullaby
author: shaunna
text: i sit here in this gray and somber room wondering if maybe there is more to life.  i question myself blindly for i see no other option.  i catch myself looking towards the north.  outside breathes down the necks of children.  fog and smoke merge into one.  becoming a shield  for many to lie behind.   my days become more bleak in this room.  a lullaby plays on repeat inside my head.  many more days will pass with this same routine.  then again,  sometimes i think of breaking free.  joining the world outside these  boundaries that keep me grounded.   one day i answered my question.  a fair voice,  rich with sweets.   ''no. ''  there was no more to life outside these walls.  i blink back the tears of happiness; a break from my weakness.  i laugh softly as i consider my own sanity.  then again,  many years ago my dear family and friends considered my sanity as well.  then they locked me up within this cage.  caged away from society.  like a monster.

title: Why?
author: shawntae
text: why is everything,  just not going right? how come our sunshine,  has now turned to night? is there another way,  to find our love again? since we're not lovers,   can we be best friends? now that i dont have you my mind is so insane.  even when the sun's out,  my life is full of rain; since we aren't dating,  i'm telling you right now; i will find away,   to get you back some how.

title: Can you tell me why?
author: shayan
text:
i did not call you in the winter night
but you have come
and standing there.
the cold wind is cutting me.
if you have come, don't at a
distance. .
come toward me.
the cold will kill me, sometime
i have to die.
sometime you had to. . .

still i believe that you are.
the hot breath i can feel in my
chin. . .
i can feel your smelll, tantalizing
tell me, why did you do that?
why?tell me. . why??
is it a dream?no one else there. .

i can't still stay.
laughing is too far to me.
but i hear the sound,
it laught at me.
my arm has lost you forever, ear
forgotten the sweet voice. .

but my cruel heart is going on
on . . and on. . .
going on to find another.
though the eyes can't, but my
eyes have learnt something new,
something like the tearfall. .

can you tell me why?

title: My love
author: sheena
text: love do u see me. . love do u know me. . . love are u for me. . . love are u summer. . . love are you golden. . . love do u feel me. . i have this holy touch. . you will love it so much. . . love oh love. . my love

title: My Sweet Mother
author: shefali
text: for me, forever a smile she bears,  she is always there to wipe my tears.  in her lap,  i forget all fears.  oh god! such a lovey creation you made,  in her heart,  all the love you laid,  even on my mistakes,  it does not fade.  in her encouragement,  does my success lie with her support,  i can touch the sky ,  in my difficulties,  she always stands by.  to good virtues,  does she me lead.  she fulfills my every wish and need.  her freshness is like the rose flower,  her love bears enormous power.  she wants me to always rise in life,  and be the winner of its every strife.  her brain is sharp,  her love is pure.  her soft touch for me,  acts as a cure.  like her,  i have seen no other,  i thank god for such a sweet mother!

title: What About You
author: sheila

title: I'm falling behind

title: You and i
author: shreyas
text: it is been months and an year,  times have been easy and times have been tough,  but the love we share has always been the same sometimes we argue a lot but we never give up,  we continue to keep each other alive  there is a light in our love,  our hearts may get dark at times,  but we know there is a brightness we both have situations that is difficult but deep inside we get through it because we share a special bond  the heartbeats make you aware of the way we feel,  a love that is very true i know at times that it seems it is difficult but we must love again until we are healed  things may get tough,  and someday you feel there is no hope.  but deep down into your heartbeats you know you would still love.  so let go of hard times. . they wont be much.   this love for us is a gift some never get,  so when the hard time comes,  please do not ever forget that there is this love we share that had to come in our hearts and veins and the tough times will always end but this love will stay for every second until the life ends. .

title: Schizophrenia
author: shuchita
text: i can see them,   right there,   above,  in the corner,   the devils  i sit scaredly back in the other corner  with my head tucked in my arms  that is wrapped around my knees.   they are so scary,   they always threaten me.   iâ’ll die,   theyâ’ll kill me,   please help,   somebody save me.   i was always kept locked in my room due to this behavior  the devils always showed up and i had no savior.   i shouted but nobody ever listened,   i scratched the walls,   my nails were broken.   my tears filled the buckets,   but no one ever listened.   and then one fine day,   someone came in my room,   he was amused,   because my room had my blood stains too.   he asked me some questions  and finally concluded that iâ’m mad  i thought he was amnesiac  because i knew i was schizophrenic.

text: a broken thing  can be here,   a broken thing  can be there.    a broken thing  can be of a trodden stone,   a broken thing  can be of a majestic throne.    a broken thing  can be of a mighty king,   a broken thing  can be of a sparrow's wing.    a broken thing  can be of a lover's heart,   a broken thing  can be of a life's part.    a broken thing  can be of a limitless beauty,   a broken thing  can be of a nations' treaty.    a broken thing  can be of a dreamy boy,   a broken thing  can be of a golden troy.    hence everything  can just be a broken thing.

title: The Lady That Came In His Dream
author: shyam
text: 'o! what can your woe be,   bless'd lad,  so sad is you?  your looks is the mighty  and no tear suits you too.    'o! what can your woe be,   bless'd lad,  no spree in you?  no bliss you have we see  that we think is not true. '   'i met a lass in my dream  endow'd with a fairy's shine  she'd cheeks tender like a cream  and blowing hair and face fine.    'she was in her garments white  and had a rose in her hand  and looked frail with eyes bright  like one from a fairyland.    'all the bourse seem'd insipid  all the eyes stared at her  and for her love turn'd limpid  as i still do remember.    'she look'd at me as in love  and smiled in a loving way  as though she was trying to proveâ¡âª-  she had a hid word to say.    'she call'd me with her light nod  and led me to a meadow,   and there in queer pose she stood  where the sound of crowds was low.    'and then in sweet voice she said,   ''it's true that i love you true,   on my eyes is you,  you laid  the sky knows my love is due. ''   'she sang a queer song for me  and her true feelings were shown  hours pass'd and i woke to see  myself on the field alone.    'that's why i'm sad and no spree  nor bliss i've with me to  keep  albeit you see me mighty  i break and do weep,  weep,  weep. '

title: Musings at Midnight
author: sid
text: glistening and glimmering,  the stars do shine scattering forth their beams divine their light,  not bright,  yet a mystical sight blessing the earth on this cool breezy night a prelude to a bright new day  slowly and silently comes a sailing cloud stealing the starlight in its silvery shroud their twinkling lights play hide and seek atop the dark sky mountain peak with nary a word to say  as i sit underneath the jewel studded roof away from the world,  yet not aloof enthralled by rafi saab's classical tune to the passage of time it had stayed immune with a timeless message to convey  the gentle breeze caresses my face it's tender touch as smooth as lace evoking memories of a grayish tint with hints of jasmine,  basil and mint it holds me in its sway  as the sandman beckons me to his keep pulling me into a slumber deep renouncing the cricket's soulful lyre away to my bed i must now retire into the realm of dreams to stray

title: Mirrored Worth

text: we live in a world where men will try anything to show women they are worth it they will buy us diamonds and pearls and if they could they would buy us the world but its so sad we dont even know our own  worth and if its anything to blame i'd blame it on the mirror mirror mirror on the wall i really thought you had it all what i see in the mirror is not me you made me believe this is what beauty should be you had me thinking maybe if i if i was a little bit lighter he would notice me if i stuffed them a little bit he would notice me if i sent him just one picture he promises he wont show it to anyone and im sure he will notice me maybe if i was smaller ill just loose a couple pounds and i bet he would notice me mirror oh mirror okay so i'll put a little blush here hopefully it'll cover my uneven skin then i'd be satisfied ? theres no time for me to go to a gym and i have to loose this quick so i'll stick my finger deep in my throat that soon enough ill fit in? starving myself believing hunger is a burden too big for me too carry im tired of this world and i need to get rid of my hurt thinking its okay to expose my blood to get rid of my pain not understanding my own worth they say the eyes are the windows of the beholder well then mirror how is the outside view dont let these mirrors fool you beauty does not come from the outside in it comes from the inside out maybe you dont understand me these mirrors are confusing you its not a remy weave or poetic justice braids only feeling beautiful when your hair is done its not when you put on extra eye shadow or wear that extra low v neck shirt thinking your not worth much if you don't look like the girl on the magazine the girl on the magazine doesn't even look like  the girl on the magazine its not when you wear those not so skinny jeans or those bottoms you colored red those red bottoms will never add up to your priceless natural beauty beauty is from within its your heart your soul its your smile beauty is you just be-you-tiful just be-you-tiful

text: i am not hurt but wounded.  your goin' spoke a tongue i do not know nor my beloved sister will ever know.  you grossly wounded my heart 'n my pen speak vitriolic from the heart.  beat by beat ma heart's pumping pain  like an abundant image i'm in pain lickin' my wounds unsweetened.  my pen speak no malicious words.  it desires to make us meet again.  come 'n cuddle me with soulful passion 'n passionatly pat my wounds with tasteful words.  knowin' he pardons man, again 'n again.  knowin' broken walls are fixed well with passion.

title: Flying Stars
author: simon
text: they're like mini suns,  illuminating the night.   a dazzling display of colors,  like stars falling from the canvas of the sky.   there's something a little sad about fireworks though.  they shine with such brilliance,   and for a moment,  their light fills you with warmth.   to fade only moments later,  filling you with loneliness.   to be reduced to a mere illusion,  lost in the breeze.   to vanish before your eyes,  with only your warm memories remaining.   when you think about it… there's really something lonely about fireworks

title: Panaromic Ideogram
author: sindhu
text: ashes substitute grey frames of concrete,  lifeless beings are in place of those breathing,  treasured possessions lay in pieces,  what was once a place for protection has now undergone destruction,  forming a thick covering of white and grey,  engulfing those once black tarred paths.   this is the view that reflects in my pupils,  everytime we have shots of red spurting from the ground,  or plates of earth deciding to shift,  taking a new position,  and with it rising deaths in unimaginable amounts.   to those who survived being sacrificed,  come severe hurt,  pain and suffering that will bruise their thoughts forever,  constantly reminiscing about those they lost,  forbidding them from forgetting that fateful moment,  till the very day they finally pass.   this is the result,  proving his greatness and power altogether,  bringing man to the peak of realization,  that worldly pleasured arenâ’t all to live for,  and that he ultimately controls anything and everything.   test not his patience,  for the destroying shall then never end,  thouâ’ shall not chop those who prolong your life,  and i shall not impose such suffering on man.

title: I am still standing
author: sneha
text: there are two paths in front of me i ask myself ,  ''can't you see?'' the pieces of my broken heart continue to break and fall apart   one path will make my parents proud the other ,  my country proud one path asks for the mind of a thinker the other,  the heart of a selfless leader  but when i start walking down the path of a thinker my heart starts singing that different song more louder the song of guilt and dejection  protesting that the other suited me with perfection  i am going to choose the other path the path of a soldier,  ornated with strength  i am going to choose sacrifice and selflessness not the path endowed with selfishness  but how selfless can this heart be i'll just have to wait and see do these hands have a shield to bear the crowd of enemies coming near?  does this heart have a vest to fight the passion of sadness with all its might  do these eyes have helmets to avoid the sight of a thousand swords coming to pierce me through?  some people will tell me to run away  from no man's land when death comes my way but i will stand still with all my might as bright and strong as a ray of sunlight   they will either find me in no man's land or smiling at them from god's golden land but never in the land of cowards,  never  for i will protect the ones behind me forever  my mind will be my sword always going by my word my heart will be my shield always giving me back some yield  my eyes would be my helmet always checking on the enemies i meet and who all will be my tanks? me,  myself and i,  working still without a word of thanks

title: LIFE
author: stephanie
text: the life we see with our eyes can fly many years go away  the birthdays,  parties,  homes,  puppy  plus your partner life.    !0 years pass and you still flying  and itâ’s hard to say goodbye to something in life.   what is life?  life is flying through the years.     15 years pass and you still living  and itâ’s hard to say goodbye to something in life.   what is life?  life is flying through the years of the youth.   20 years pass and you still hear  and itâ’s hard to say goodbye to something in life.   what is life?  life is flying through the world hearing the water waves moves and birds sing now you in heaven life.

title: Time Stands Still
author: stephanie
text: god made man and god made woman we are all human.  made of tissue,  bone and flesh,  our bodies at birth are fresh.  made in our mother's womb,  life becomes a bloom.  our bodies become immune to a world sometimes out of tune.  in sickness and in health,  our bodies are our biggest wealth.    the gift of time as we grow,  so many things we do not know.   our bodies can become ill and time stands still.  caner is well known by all,  and if diagnosed is a wake up call.  there are many kinds of cancer,  but still no answer.  still looking for a cure,  no one is ever sure.    please god, hearour prayer for all those in need of care.    we pray for all who suffer in pain,  through god's love we have alot to gain.  cancer spreads like a fire and our bodies become so tired.  all over the world people are sick and dying of caner,  please god send a sign and find an answer.  thank you god for watching over each of us.   those who have gone to rest,  they passed the true test.  now in heaven at your side,  theya re free and will no longer cry.  we believe in you,  your love is true.  you are the cure that keeps our faith secure.   in memory of my mother who passed away with pancreatic cancer.   god bless her.

title: Judge Me

text: people who judge me  are people i despise.  i guess you'll never know til you see through my eyes why should i lie grown men even cry we are human my whole life i barely had a thing but the small things in life will always bring happiness like a man with wings free to fly away from everything.  not too happy of this life of sin so i get it out through this pad and pen when i reach the gates will they let me in? i've been through it once and never again i'm stuck in the middle of day and night.  i do know what's right and wrong i do what i must to carry on.  it will be this way until i'm gone just remember me when you read this poem life goes on.

title: Life is going on...
author: sudarshon
text: life is going on. . . .  i want to stop it.  but it may not be stop it like a river.  just flow and ever flowing. . .  hope of sediment has deposited when it arrived at flat area,  and it may erode when flow at gentle slop.  like as river,  boulder of problem may change into fine sand on the way .  so,  as of strong hope of river to reach the ocean.  ok,  let's hope! every experience of difficulty should lead towards victory!

title: Mother
author: summer
text: when i see your eyes shining in the night,  i feel a world of pain making me cry,  why are my feelings filled with so much fright,  it seems to me you never even try:  my love for you will never ever fade,  i have found many reasons not to stay,  and for all of the times you have portrayed,  it seems my life has stopped in all wrong ways:  so when i think of every kind of hate,  my mind races all around this whole world,  but now my mind is focused on my fate,  now my mind is slow and the past is hurled:  iâ’m sorry mom but you know i have tried,  our time is over they know you have lied.

text: you came into my life like a flying mayer you saved me from my past bitter affair with you i decided to spend my whole life to share but you proved to be just a player  you gave me sorrows that i canâ’t compare about your misdeeds i was never aware i thought you would do lots of care   but suddenly your wicked plans made me aware your love was like castle in the air your look was like a millionaire you were my evening prayer but you were not good that was declared   i thought you would be my life thought you would be my pride but  every day you killed me inside for so many nights you made me cry but see i am alive my good time has arrived see i am alive  and my soul is   divine

title: Wake Up Call
author: susan
text: when i awoke one morning,   a stork was on my head i asked it  ''what are you doing here?'' and this is what it said: ''madam,  you snore so loudly! do you really have no clue? while you're here snoozing soundly- we're wide awake in timbaktoo!''

title: That Kind of Friend
author: susan
text: let me be the kind of friend that you have been to me; one who's full of kindness and rich in loyalty.   let me be the kind of friend who will be the sort you need.  to fill those empty spaces with the planting of a seed.   let me be the kind of friend who will nurture the seed to grow,  and blossom beautiful flowers in times you're feeling low.   let me be the kind of friend whom you can understand,  for i know when i can't smile you'll be there to take my hand.

title: The Gift
author: susan
text: god made us men and women,  to love and share and give,  to learn of his great plan for us,  to teach people how to live.   but for now we only wonder,  about this thing called love,  is it as crashing thunder,  or as soft as a gentle dove?  things that we don't know,  that we don't quite understand. . .  why do they always seem to glow when they hold each other's hand?  love is many myriad things that is partial to only a few found even the conquering king that better than one is two.   love holds no fear; keeps no guile,  but is always honest and true.  it's a gift to make us smile,  when we finally say,  ''i do!''

title: Lake Side Feelings
author: suzanne
text: as i look out on too the world the moring dew is still fresh the sun is  rising in the mountians and the birds fly freely  i look out on the lake and watch the sun sparkle off the cool glassly water  i see a loon off in the distance glinging through the water he calls out,  yet there is no answer to his cries he seems so lost and lonley and yet at the same time he seems at peace as i sit alone on the dock with my toes in the water,  looking out at the world i to feel at peace

title: With
author: suzette
text: with   with the unique ability to control oneself,   i shall try to understand  how you put life so simply i donâ’t think i can comprehend.    with your calmness under pressure and your selflessness under strain i shall try to rise up to you to live beside you once again.   with the refreshing appeal of your soul it has driven me to my knees how could you have it all,  while i have been released?  with your tendency to smooth the edges,  i shall remorse and reprimand  and i canâ’t compare to this perfection i canâ’t seem to reach its highland.    with the strength you have sacrificed,  to display your vision on life i will never be able to achieve that gift so i will continue to strive.   with this pain i hold in front of me,  in one touch,  you can take it away your purity has left me baffled  and for my impurity i shall pay.

title: Solitude
author: swagatika
text: they say,  hope never dies,  same as the stubborn memories.  sometimes these memories carry you with them for haunted night walks,  and sometimes they stand by you when you call them.   a silent mind reminds me,  to walk with them.  a simple smile lets them go away,  when they cross my mind.  sometimes they fight with me to find them,  and i act not to see them. . .  yet all of them wake up with me each day.   they do not change per seasons,  but they come up each time,  rainy being their favorite.  for now. . memories is only what i have to stand there and watch me.  but will they walk with me forever ?  knowingly or unknowingly i carry them with me always and sometimes they follow me,  they donâ’t burden me !! they fight when you fight,  they fall when you fall  when i am a single person,  they are plenty in number,  plenty enough to snow in summer only for me.  plenty enough to rain in spring so that i would know it rained only for me. .   if i let them win,  they will rule over me.  if i let them loose,  i donâ’t get to see them again.  because sometimes a memory is what completes that missing leak bubble wraps you and sends you in a solitude parachute untouched. . .   and i wish i could have them on my side. . i wish. . .

title: Golden Days

text: cookie was born one chilly day in may i got her as a puppy she licks her ancient joints day after day she is more fun than having a guppy she basks in the sun warming her old bones  her bed acts like her own personal throne in her youth she brought home part of a deer her world has gone silent and world cloudy it scares her when someone appears she didnâ’t hear  in our good days together we`d jog when she is excited she whines loudly i so relish in my trusty old dog more than a person could another person she has a spirit that can`t be tamed she still play nips after all these years my love for her will forever remain

title: Angels Die
author: sydney
text: knowing youâ’re gone  brings me down at times more than just a mother you were a best friend  i still think about you every day  wishing you were still here to hear all i have to say  but when i sit here and talk to you  i know you hear what iâ’m saying  because the other night i could have sworn i heard you whisper my name letting me know youâ’re doing just fine  that was the best feeling iâ’ve felt in a long time  i wish it never happened at all  sometimes i stare at my phone wishing for a goodnight call.  knowing youâ’re my guardian angel sets my heart at ease and knowing youâ’re beside me all the time is what brings comfort and peace  i love to sit here and relive our memories of the things we used to do  i still remember how much fun we had  tying my first pair of shoes  those memories still keep a smile on my face and you should know mom,  that no other woman could take your place  it may only have been two years  that you have been gone but the years just seem to drag on  i know my brother is still little and wonders why you had to go  but iâ’m not sure what to tell him because i donâ’t even know.  but one thing i can say for sure is you are in my heart twenty-four-seven  and i dream of the day when i can hug you once again in heaven i love you mom.

title: I'm tired of this
author: tabetha
text: jessi,      you were so right about mike! remember how you said he would break my heart? well he did.   not all at once,  a lil at a time! lyin about where he was going,  who he was working with,  not coming home on time or just not coming home at all.    girl i can't take this anymore.  i love him but i can't take being hurt anymore.     in my homegurl charlee said that mike was cheating on me with this nasty girl.  i didn't beilieve her but i'm kinda starting to now.     all he had to do was sit me now in promise me he was cheating but he just said that on the phone.  he wouldn't talk about it when we were together.    anyways girl.  i think well i know i'm gonna end up doing something,  i'm gonna wish i hadn't.    i don't know what to do! in on top of that it seems like he spends more time with tori and ricky then me.    then he said earlier today when he gets back from the office we were gonna spend some time together.  we had maybe 10 minutes together before he left again.    said he was going to go eat with his dad/stepmom in he had to meet a friend at the bp but he would be back by 11:30pm.  well i woke up at 11:45 cause my belly started hurting.  in usually he can make it feel better,  but he wasn't here.  he didn't get back till like 12:45am.  an hour in 15 mintues after he said he would be home.    he said he went to his friends house for a lil bit.  but he never told me he was gonna do that.    i just can't take the lies anymore its killing me inside.  my heart is brokin,  in i don't think that can be fixed.

title: Fear
author: tahirah
text: fear is not about being afraid.  fear is about not taking the easy road or following where all the others have gone before.  fear is about being fearless and doing the unthinkable.

title: The Berry
author: talha
text: what remains from my weary soul ,  is weary .  what remains from this bulky banquet ,  is a tiny berry.   we are moving around ,  hearing the same sound  steady as we move ………. .   what a query ???? a long journey ,  black and white ,  ease and fright ,  armistice and fight ,  day and night  ,  blindness and sight .  god ,  we are sorry  it is a bridge ,  it is a ferry .   time is poaching ,  killing haunting ,   breaking our minds .  yet breeding and breeding but burning and burning  we are a quarry .    quickly ,  it does  go ,  a rainbow ,  briskly ,  it does bow.   an avaricious foe ,  we have to atone for it .  a divine bequest ,  we must carry .   donâ’t behead it !  donâ’t balk it ,  donâ’t barter it ! donâ’t backbite it ,  it is no balderdash ! behold it ,  embrace it ,   it may rescue your soul,   though it is weary   perhaps ,  it keeps the berry ,  replies the query ,   breaches  the ferry ,  and revive the quarry  her yellow face comes every morning ,  to say farewell ,  mourning ,  to bridle our buoyance ,  to settle us down ,  to re adorn florence.    her green eyes ,  adhesive eyes ,   shines from the depth of our depths.  for it alters the colours ,   for it amends the pages .   and displaces the comm. .   her green eyes a well of affection ,  bashful ,  bewailing our ages .   her green eyes ,  a beacon ,  a belfry ,   a mecca ,  a bier ,  a buttonhole ,  an antidote beverage .    there ,  her ascetic tongue ,  yearning for a song ,   that arouses us and shows what is there,  and what is among .   her abstinent ,  mean  tongue,   accosts us and says; â“ be the same ! keep your name  ! try always . !  but go back whenever you are weary,  or worried about the berry .  â”

title: In the blink of an eye
author: tamara
text: in the blink of an eye your life could change,  in the blink of an eye your best friends will be strange,  because in the blink of an eye nothing could remain,  or in the blink of an eye it could all stay the same.  in the blink of an eye you could find love,  in the blink of an eye someone's giving up,  in the blink of an eye you could lose everything,  or in the blink of an eye you could gain,  and if ever you feel restrained,  remember in the blink of an eye you ain't,  so when you blink make sure you aim,  because naturally in the blink of an eye nothing ,  but everything could change,  because nothing will ever be the same.

title: Ted's Morning
author: tamaria
text: when i awoke one morning,  a bird was on my head.  i asked ''what are you doing there?'' it looked at me and said. . .  ''hurry,  today's your day!'' so get up and out of bed.  ted got dressed and ran out the door.  the bird screamed out ''don't forget the book we read. '' ted ran back,  grabbed the book and off to the meeting.  all smiles with the presentation ted lead.  the bird was very happy to see that the book went well,  ted had really knocked them dead.

title: Living in the Now
author: tamir
text: living in now… \t\twhite sand cooling my back \tlooking up at the sky,  a gull diving through the air trying to catch its afternoon meal.  \tthe suns rays dance across the rippling water like fireworks on the fourth of july.  \t\t\tmy head and eyes roll backwards \tthe earth around me seems to change completely…  \tthe forest behind me,  itâ’s a door that leads to the rest \tof the world.   beyond that door… \t\tpeople only care… about occupations about money \t but here i can dream whatever i want,  do whatever i want.   \t\there,  rules of the industrial world do not apply but rules of the natural world do… \t\t\tall i can do is be here at this very point in time.  there is nothing more i can do.  \t\t\t\t\tbecause after all… \t\t\t\ti  am \t\tjust \t\t\t\t\thuman… \t\t\t\t \t\t\t\t\t\t\t  \t\t \t

title: Bird of Nest
author: tammy
text: when i awoke one morning,  a bird was on my head.  i asked,  ''what are you doing there?'' it looked at me and said,  ''your hair was so full that it looked like a nest. '' i told the bird that my hair is a mess,   so get off my head.  the bird flew away to find another head to make a nest  so i went back to get some rest.

title: La Rose de L'amour
author: tan
text: la rose de lâ’amour  how itâ’s beauty and splendor distracts me.  how itâ’s just so strong and free.  its petals of velvet,  so lush and divine; in and of itself so complete,  so sublime.  i cannot help but be awed by such elegance.  i cannot help but be speechless by such radiance.  its scent,  so intoxicating,  so delicious; surely something so glorious cannot be malicious.   intoxicated by such beauty,  at first i didnâ’t see.  i run my hands up and down its stem,  and let my fingers bleed.  i thought,  â“what is love without pain? they say,  â‘no pain no gainâ’. â” its beauty so hard to resist.  such beauty,  i must kiss! soft velvet brushed my lips; my heart reacts with flips.  i pull it closer,  my grip on it tightening.  my mind tries to warn me that this is very frightening.  i ignore my conscience and give into my will and desire.  it burned with what i thought was an everlasting fire.  i pull it closer to my heart; i do not want to feel apart.  the rose,  itâ’s thorns so beautiful and fierce! my arms,  my hands,  my fingers,  my heart! it began to pierce! not only pierce; it scratched and cut and gouged it.  realization hit me hard but to me the rose was already knit.  excruciating pain,  so unbearable,  so intense; so much pain! i looked at the sky; it had started to rain.  and finally,  the damned rose,  i let it go.  back to the bush it went,  i watched in woe.   my body: pained,  and drenched with blood,  i could not overcome the overwhelming flood.  a wave of sadness,  a tale of woe.  i was lost with no way to go.  i looked back at that rose,  that bloody damned rose! there was nothing greater i ever did loathe.  stained with my blood,  and cursed it would be! but then i cried as i started to see.  scarlet on scarlet,  you could hardly see,  the rain washed it away; once again it was free.  the pain,  the agony,  the hurt â— to an excruciating degree! i knew i could never be how i was once free.  the rain washed my scarlet to show the scars of pain,  hurt and tears.  it had come true,  the worst of my fears.   they asked why i was scared.   why? what for? i had no answer then,  but now i do: la rose de lâ’amour.  (the rose of love)

title: Billy Dean
author: tana
text: this is a tale of billy dean big and buff and very mean this tale is told far and wide to all who know him run and hide billy dean was an abused child daddy always drunk and mommy gone wild daddy'd always beat him in a rage beat him bloddy then locked him in a cage mommy'd always yell and fight with his dad yelled because it was waleays his fault when dad got mad billy dean grew older and his heart only grew colder he turned into an alcoholic just like his dad and beat his wife when he got mad everyone scared of what he might do hid their children when he came through in a rage one night billy dean got into a fight killed a man in cold blood took of and only left his footprints in the mud billy dean was never found not a trace not even a sound to this day people can't yearn for the day when billy dean shall return

title: A Love Sonnet
author: tara
text: scratch and scribble and jot and scrawl/ only for you,  my heart does throb/ on the paper,  my heart tells all/ until i cry and weep and sob///  everything i am,  i am for you/ i feel for you with all my heart/ do you see it? and feel it too?/ me and you - never apart///  within a sonnet,  i cannot express/ what i truly feel inside/ i feel as if we are put throught many a test/ forever,  by your side///  i love you forever/ leave me never

title: Wonders
author: tara
text: as it all comes to an end you finally realize that sometimes being alone is the best.  even if you hurt and cry every night.  it still is better then having your heart broken forever.  love will never be found for me for the love i search for will never exist no matter how hard i try.  so now i sit there at my window seal waiting for the leafs to fall once again just like my tears. . .

text: mummy please give me food give me food to work and play  give me apple orange grape give me puri paratha sabji and make me healthy and wealthy

title: Tricks in the Sand
author: taryn
text: walk along the sand lines of the doom they say its by chance we come to find but i believe it is by clouds  that we find the silver lining the seeds are planted way too far far into the unknown of reality my reality may be different than yours does that make me crazy,  insane?  or insane crazy? you say i play tricks on your mind but don't you play tricks on mine?  are we not a product of our creation?  are we not a product of the past?  of every pebble,  every speck of dust,  and every grain of sand but,  remember analyzation is not key what is key?  perspective undone perfection handgun bullet of perfection smattered to pieces that is the key smash your perception of life as known dive into the unknown with your pretty little mind meant to implode past is key  past is a tool to teach,  to stumble,  to create a slate of progression  into a state of everything hear say!  please,  my dearest soul never embark alone its a scary haunted stone but can unlock the key to art at its finest sculpt your life with these words for they will become you  take you break you defy you try you cry out to you but yet define you  into the most beautiful of all of you`s

title: Pretty Wings
author: tasmine
text: pretty wings seem like the sweetest things  only when you're not afraid to fly from  what you've seen  one wing is the prettiest because it support loves& cares  then the wing who made you cry, pretended to love you & lied about being there  its impossible to fly with one wing  just like it's impossible for a queen to be a king  somethings are impossible  somethings we don't understand   like why we do things over& over again  we start off with the prettiest wings  slowly we damage them by doing unexplainable things  then it's impossible to find the wings deep inside  all because we feel like we've already tried

title: Passed and Gone
author: tatenda
text: i feel the pain as i light the candle,  for a lot of people passed and gone.  some passed because of age others knife cut,  gunshot or disease.  i cannot believe that soon it will be me.  so i keep asking god,  when is my day? to all my friends who have passed memories still live on,  memories live on.  so i have to be strong enough to accommodate them angel in black approaching the cemetery wearing  black glasses at the funeral hiding the thick red tears i shed for you instead of the material items  you have been buried with,  i wish it was me.  pastor gave you a farewell rhyme that stained my heart you are nailed for eternity in my heart i wish rip means

title: 20/20 (A sonnet)
author: tatiana
text: 20/20 young lady of a decade and a half a spirit clouded by a darkened past consumed by pain that lived on her behalf upon her once wide smile,  storm clouds cast the darkness gave her thoughts she didn't want and eyes that spoke of more than words could say its burdens caused her small frame to grow gaunt her truth would never see the light of day the demons crept into her fractured mind infecting every aspect of her life her happiness grew difficult to find as they became more powerful and rife and yet,  she found the willingness to fight,  the day her weary hands found strength to write.

title: Glory Year
author: tau
text: u p on top of imagination,  i  was with the dream of seeing the years passing,  t o the place we have no sense of,  b ut when january of 2008 concur our world,  t here was a fragrance of beautiful flowers,  a nd butterflies flew above our heads,  i n consequence we sense the prosperity.  t hen saw the snow of luck reaching for our hearts.     according to me,  that year was the year,  that i was waiting for my name to be called in the degree learning,  but when i reach the mountain top,  i only saw the soldiers marching,  with the drums beaten and trumpets high to reach the sky.  i used to dream of them for the long distance of life,  and of my boyhood because on films we watch,  we see soldiers as the moving stars that shine around,  to keep us in protection and i had a dream of blowing,  the horns and beating trumpets with the soldiers.   according to me that year was the year,  that my beloved was to wait too,  for her name,  to be called in my hope of marching with soldiers,  but with no deliberate,  i blew a whistle to her ears,  i called her home of mine before time.  indeed we had promised us in secret to ourselves,  but not at that time because our parents had see each other not,  and told themselves their identities not.   i have the story,  the story that iâ’ll tell my beloved when it's winter.  the story of 2008 winter before the month,  of my birthday,  the birthday i used to celebrate in my sleep,  because i used no mouth watering food or even the cake.  i was broke,  under the dry trees of winter.  only on that sleep i 'll tell her my story,   the rain of money rained in my world,  it was the air i was breathing.  it was chased from the east to the west,  north and south,  to me,  my listener.  i saw it like the river i was once swarm in,  and water cloaked me all around,  leaving only my face so that i was,  to see the cattle i herd went away.  money was my spectacles or telescope.  no way i was to see if not on my eyes.  it was my compass and lover,  who wash my eyes with her tears of happiness,  so that was to see my way through the deserts,  and oceans.      oh! the year 2008, why have you,  came to my life that way i wonder? you made my daughter to walk half a year,  and six months and one week i wonder,  she has teeth like mine i wonder,  but too much of her mother,  2008 i ask.  oh! the year 2008,  why have you,  come to my life that way.  you made me the father i wonder.  my beads emerged like that of the goats,  daughter of mine is delighted,  to brush them,  with laughter.   my year 2008,  you are the year of all my glories,  you held me close like a woman,  like a mother to the child,  you comforted me and wept my tears,  after the disaster that fell upon me,  when mum pop her clogs,  leaving us young but  me grown up,  and i pop a question to a virgin i adore.  always i look at the sky ready to see,  to hear her calling one word to me,  but only to have her in my sleep.   year 2008 you have lain your hand,  i say on my chest to heal all my sickness,  that i hoped to not escape,  but you made me clean,  and put my beloved on my side,  side to hold me any time she likes.

title: Spring is here!
author: taylor
text: spring is here  i here birds songs in my ear  the birds are chirping  in the sun i run    the pool cools me off in the hot sun  i like to swim with tim  the fish in the ocean winked at me  the fish flips frantically    then the fish dove beneath the waves  the boy started to brag about his bat  so we played baseball  we had so much fun in the hot hot sun

title: My World
author: taylor
text: taylor tall, funny, dazed, confused brother of jordan,  brother of rachel lover of turbos, waves and life feels pain,  love,  happiness who needs power, cars and family who gives respect and authority who fears loss and failure who would like to see peace,  and the 7 wonders of the world lives in miami,  home of the heat

title: Insignificance
author: tenzin
text: yesterday,  as moonlight glitters upon the valley  i climbed to the roof to gaze the luminous landscape of western mountain i stare at a starry sky to look out at the infinite expanse of sky  surprisingly,   instead i was looking inward of my own presences wandering inside the garden of  past,   up the hills and down the hills listening to my own footstep from far away to each corner hearing my own voice that was stammering and struggling to reach the ears  as  each minute i try to recall i try to comprehend my failures yes,  though it was hard,  really hard yet at last,   i made peace with circular moving arrows  but then i realize the insignificance of my own being.  in my own won past.

title: Vacation Dreaming
author: teresa
text: to bed,  i say,   to dream,  i pray,   of some fair and distant land.    with trees that sway,   over waters and bay,   with walks of warm,  soft sand.    to curl my toes,   burn up my nose,   and sleep â‘til almost noon.    to swim and play,   in the warmth of the bay,   then dance the locals tune.    bright flowers greet,   delicious things to eat,   just hope i donâ’t wake too soon.    if so,  i pray,   to wake,  i may,   in this fair and distant land.    where the palm trees sway,   taking my cares away,   as i waltz thru the waters and sand,   of this wonderful carefree land.   teresa d

title: TERRI
author: terri
text: calm but anxious loving gone with the wind with a lovely smile inspired and uplifted by scripture yet afraid for my children's future proud to graduate-many times and sing along with kenny chesney's songs with no regrets and nothing to change i will look forward to traveling someday reaching my final destination leaving behind a legacy of love for others.

title: Dont be that Girl
author: tevin
text: don't be that girl that says she loves him,  don't be that girl that says she cares,  don't be that girl that doesn't mean it,  don't be that girl that's never there.   don't be that girl that's afraid to be you,  don't be that girl that no one wants to see,  don't be that girl that's afraid of trust,  don't be that girl that's afraid to talk to me.   don't be that girl that's afraid of change,  don't be that girl that's afraid to shove,  don't be that girl that's afraid to call,  don't be that girl that's afraid of love.

title: The life
author: thakgalang
text: the life what is life when you have money but you ain't happy, what is life people when you have to work but finding you ain't happy with your work.  yet we live on pleasing people but you struggle on pleasing yourself.  yes i know that it is complicated and unpredictable but you have stand and fight.  yes love has second chances but life has only one chance you mess this opportunity your done.  watch on how you live it, watch how u manage it.  yes its nice to dream but make sure it doesn't turn to be a steam.  you are special to everyone around and that doesn't mean you have to be on the ground whenever they hurt you.  life its challenging but manageable if u are intending to do so.  watch those whom you call your friend.  thy said positive minds brings positive thinking.  nothing is impossible if are serious.

title: Love of a color

text: god you the father of my life you send your only begotten son jesus to die on the cross to forgive me for the sins in my life you the father just for me if it was'nt for true love i could not see my feelings for you will always be the same my feelings for you will never change theres alot of people in this world you want me to bring to you be for i end this poem i must tell you i love you amen

title: Love of a color

text: god created every male and female with different kind of color god dont want any of his children to hate one another but love one another by the color of their skin how do you expect to get by jesus with a hatred heart and expect him to let you in god put the thoughts in my head to lead you the way to love one another and respect all your brother and sisters by the love of a color amen

title: ''Life ''
author: theresa
text: there is a reason for everything,   we just don't know what it is.  if we did,  then we would change it.  he has a plan for us. ,  what is meant to ,  will be.  he works in mysterious ways.  but be careful what you ask him for,  you will receive in a different way.  i know that  he has been good to me.  thank you god foreverything that you have done for me and my family.  you have given us a miracle.  i thank you god in every day and in every  way,  for the blessings that you have given me.  from you i get to wake up everyday and see the light of day.  the sunsets,  the stars and the moon.  thank you god for creating life.

title: Africa
author: thobeka
text: sometimes i wonder why those perspire pain keep perspiring desire those who live by rules of guns,  throw words like stones,  feel the excitement of human blood on their hands,  live the longer life with luxury.  those who struggle everyday,  begging for that slice with water,  end up in the shore……  my mothers and sisters are abused yet donâ’t wake up tomorrow and say â‘i dream but i have that fidelity to make what i desire my priorityâ” they live by the life reality is the life with punishment,  yet when they see us the â“commandersâ” of our glory.  they say we as the nation of this rainbow land  live by the rules of other races.   i am what i am because i work for what i want to be,  i do not live my life by pity nor shall i live my fertile life by my instincts but by learning to seduce the luxury i have.   wake up africa stop dreaming about your priorities yet donâ’t make reality feel the luxury in your hands and be in that dimension and when you reach there……  i shall be your dimension for your personality wake up africa  for tomorrow is yet to come with your fulfilled journey wake up africa!!!  for i shall be there to wake up with you and sing the praises of the rain,   i shall be there to smell the scent of the splendid flowers and roses,  i shall be there to smile to the â‘smellyâ” old man and his family with nothing in his pocket i shall be there to hold the little girl daddy continues to turn i shall be there to grace and brace my smile as i give the little that i have to my brother i shall be there…. .  i will be there….  can you be there?  the splendourness of the sea the swiftness of the wind  the smell of the flowers and trees  they await…. .  await the humbleness and mercy that lives within us do not turn a blind eye.   close your eyes  feel that… only happens when we are awake……wake up africa.

title: Like Tree

text: potry is like a tree it makes me feel free i always have my leaves protecting me. even when the sun goes through me or the wind passes through me,  i still stand tall and strong,  like a tree.  thats why i feel free because nobody can get past me.  that is why i have so many people hate on me ,  cause i remain strong on  those that envy me          peotry

title: Dreams
author: tiffani
text: dreams are like fairy tails.   hoping they become reality,   till' we discover the brutality.   yet we dream.    dreams are like magic,   when they donâ’t come true  they are tragic.   reality is harsh.   it knocks you down,   and can make you frown.   but dreams lift you up and make you inspire,   for what you desire.    dreams make you work threw the fears,  tears,  and years.   once you leave behind your fears  you achieve your dreams.

text: dreaming in the day this world of mine is beautiful all is well,   mine to control while here i am happy this world is my sanctuary,  but also my prison i have been trapped here and safe here since i was a child i want to escape i need to escape because although this world gives me joy it is destroying me i love it i hate it it is saving me  it is crippling me i want to escape i want to stay  i want to escape i want to stay. . .

title: A Sad Summer
author: tiffany
text: a sad summer it was almost as if i was completely numb the day that the tears couldnâ’t come i was told to stay out of the room because she was resting to go outside and play and just stay out of the way little did i know the sirens were for her until the men were all around and she wasnâ’t making any sound i never got to say goodbye i just didnâ’t think she was going to die the funeral was worse all these sad unfamiliar faces and a hearse for the longest time i beat myself up because when they asked me to say goodbye i was too scared to get close-up i was only seven and i thought she was already in heaven to make matters sadder i didnâ’t even cry,  so they probably thought she didnâ’t even matter for the longest time i hated myself for that â‘til this day they probably think iâ’m a brat during the nights after her death i would constantly dream  and would wake gasping for breath almost ten years since that summer but i still miss my grandmother

title: Live on Live Long
author: tijuanna
text: things will change as so will time,  people will die as those will live.  life goes on and so should you,  we all loved them so don't be blue.  they have lived theirs lives and now they're gone.  we all miss them and that is true,  but one day we will be gone too! the lord does things to make us change,  and he also sees things within a range.  we try to hide our wrong and stick out our right,  if you don't believe in god you won't see the light.  we will fight with all of our might,  but still we won't do what's right.  we have learned to give and be given,  let the lord do his thing and we shall be rewarded.  he has given us life and he's taken it away.  as long as you believe,  he will let you stay.  stay strong and pray and you might live to see another day.  we are all loved in every possible way,  just keep believing and things will change; just hold on to god's unchanging hand.  we all love and we all believe,  do what's right and you will achieve.  so live on and live strong an nothing will go wrong.

title: The First Time
author: timothy
text: bounce, bounce, bounce the ball is in my hand  playing against our rivalry fighting for that number one spot  my team down by two with 6sec.  left ball still in my hands  no need to panic but i never been in this situation before  dribbling up the court  with the time winding down  all of a sudden i cant here the crowd i can only hear the beat of my heart  two secs left i elevate  shooting over my defender behind the three   all of a sudden the crowd is silent so silent that you can hear the sweat dripping on the court  the buzzer goes off  it goes in  the crowd goes nuts with no regrets  i can proudly say  that was my first time.

title: LOVE, PEACE and JOY
author: timothy
text: love,  peace and joy by timothy c.  h  some day youâ’d see me walking pass by you my face donâ’t hide something youâ’d remember a smile with open arms my heart never lies in your eyes youâ’d see me walking pass by you youâ’d call my name i might not have my hearing aids youâ’d call my name again i might not even turn donâ’t just stand there come on and run run up to me you can tap on my shoulder thatâ’s the way itâ’s gonna be it is me,  naturally i am born deaf rooted with hands,  those talks you can communicate,  yes you can tell me those words i wanna read say them into my eyes,  i wanna hear in the broadest of day,  i wanna dance who am i for you now? canâ’t you see? i am a musician you can cheer silent music by those hands,  they sing my melodies,  yes can you feel me now? donâ’t just stand there come on and run run up to me every one in the world can  run up to me.  i donâ’t mind no,  i donâ’t mind having you back i am full of love and itâ’s in my every song canâ’t you see? i am a musician you can cheer sweet music by those hands,  they sing donâ’t just stand there come on and run run up to me tell me how much youâ’d care? iâ’d give it all back for the world donâ’t,  donâ’t you want me? donâ’t,  donâ’t you need me? i wonder why iâ’m feeling lost without you i donâ’t understand after iâ’ve give it all my best i got nothing much of anything back donâ’t,  donâ’t you want me? donâ’t,  donâ’t you need me? i need you and need your faithfulness itâ’ getting hopeless and i am walking alone and confused,  i donâ’t know for sure why donâ’t you let me know? and treat me like i am somebody for you? donâ’t you want more of me? donâ’t you need me up on that stage again? i donâ’t know cosâ’ i didnâ’t get your message clearly why donâ’t you tell me so? why donâ’t you show me so? why donâ’t you give me so? i need to know if youâ’re there for me iâ’m not so sure if i can be somebody true   some day youâ’d see me walking pass by you my face donâ’t hide something youâ’d remember a smile with open arms my heart never lies in your eyes youâ’d see me walking pass by you  run all youâ’d need run all youâ’d want run all youâ’d read run all youâ’d please run all youâ’d sing run all youâ’d feel love,  peace and joy my world is your world your world is my world come on and run up to me my world is your world your world is my world come on and run up to me my world is your world your world is my world love,  peace and joy  my world is your world your world is my world come on and run up to me my world is your world your world is my world come on and run up to me my world is your world your world is my world love,  peace and joy   copyright â© 2009
