author: tosin
text: i know it's all my fault,  and i know i've made mistakes,  but talking me down,  and hating me now,  is making me feel afraid.  afraid of my future and who i can become,  afraid of failure and that i many never succeed.   but who am i to say anything,  my sister is really the gem,  she shines and she shines,  and i'm just left for dead.  you probably don't get my feelings,  and i really don't expect you to,  i just want you to know that i'll work and i'll work,  to be the child who can also shine through

title: My Love
author: tranesha
text: what was once broken and torn apart you came along to bring a fresh new start i was so afraid and very lonely but you came and became my one and only they say love is supposed to be happy and treasured with you in my heart,  i feel nothing but ultimate pleasure though we are not together to hold each other now together our hearts will make a steadfast vow to be there for each other to the very end on each other we shall depend through the night and through the day you in my heart is where you will always stay

title: Its funny how
author: trasandra
text: its funny how you are a different person when your with, or in front of somebody else. its funny how you are one way one day and one way another day. its funny how you want everyone to bow down to your feelings . . but what about my feelings?its funny

title: Would you cry
author: trasandra
text: i wonder if you would cry if you saw that i was shy. i wonder if you would cry when i noticed i had a sty.  would you cry when you realized i cry?would you care why i cry?do you want to know what makes me cry?i wonder what you would do if i died. . .  i wonder if you would cry or just act fly? i wonder why it doesn't matter to you why i cry.  do you even why i cry? would you cry if you see all the hurt you've caused and all the pain you made me gain?would you cry if i were to leave and never come back would you cry?would you cry if someone hit you in your eye and made you cry?  umm. . . i wonder why. . . so why wont you cry when you realize you are what makes me cry?. . would you cry?

title: For the place to be
author: travon
text: i walk forward,  further onward,  living a better tomorrowâ    stick and stones may break my bones but a thousandâ  cruel slanderous tongues will not take controlâ    and god shows me a beautiful light in such glow  saying to myself,  ''without thoughts of grief it's my destiny to hold on strong''  must i remember,  that dreams really do come true   even if pain comes through like pointy screw

title: Allured beauty
author: travon
text: lost in allured beauty  my ears succeeded to the bell's telephone   the tearful sound of the feather cloth continues for eternity   i bemoan this heart that crys out loud   let's hold each others hands just for now  you can forget all your worries if you want to  by eliminating thoughts of translucent dews  life as we know it might become beautifully unreal by tomorrow  deep in the night your image lingers drawing me close to your side   you're the tenderness in the proof of my existence   the spider lilies in september  the beauteous field of autumn for literature   these unraveled words for eyes to remember   i believe in everything you are   i believe in everything you see  without love the blue days of youthfulness would seem hopeless   tender emotions served as the gentle leaves  gathered by the blooming pearl   coloring deeper into the world that confesses grief   nourishing like the wind that kisses the lip-deep skin  if we want to go on living we must understand the wall ofâ understanding to the bitter end   in this dazzling bliss i come forth  with sweet affection  to the precious love  made up of absolute perfection   we tightly embraced the sunlight that filters through the leaves of the trees   the feet of the autumn breeze  outside my windowpane   the balmy scent of the joyous landscape   surprises all   week after week  to become cruel and insincere is to become concrete   the irrelevancy of bad dreams left unseen   even now my strength and courage steps forward to the next page   a echo resounding across this bright stage  i love you more than anything   this marvelous breath is still swaying. . .

title: A thousand poems
author: travon
text: as i embraced the melancholy daysâ â    i became overwhelmed   with tristful tears,   the broken pieces of my heart,   useless in the gloomy brume i fear,   the withered dainty flowers in my hands. .   bemoaning death i find it hard to stand;  my words of woe,   quiet,  and dark.   the truth can't be filled with just a spark.   with neverending pain   a thousand poems caught in the sound of rain.

title: Love is felt by all
author: travon
text: love is felt by all,   â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â  deep in the hour of longing,   â â â â â â â â â â â â â  flowery heart's indulgent kiss forever realised,   â â â â  embrace spring's joyful tree,   â â â  just don't forget these words of simplicity. . .   caterpillars deeply change into butterflies close to the morning sky,   with beautiful eyes it realize that life's surrounded in a overflowing haze,   when there's happiness there's no time to get caught up in sorrowful ways. .   â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â  scattering gloriously;  â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â  a thousand colorsâ    â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â  in the gentle breeze,   â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â  in it's own beauty  â â â â â â â â â â â â  tranquility appears before me. . .   â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â  in the end,    â â â â â â â â â â  spider lilies meet rainy graves   â â â â  as months and days sadly wither away  â â  breathless with no words left to say. . .    â â â â â  forever silent,  death might be the only way.   â there's no need to be sad cause with true faith opens up the heaven's gates. . .       â â â       â   â     â â    â     â â â â â â â â â â â â â â   â â   â â â â â â â â â â â â â   â â     â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â

title: Winter
author: travon
text: ''cold and shivering as the wind kisses beneath my coat''  the abandoned park of glistening ice i love the most. . .   in the thought of this wintry breeze that passes by,   the flowers and leaves far into the night. .   love,  what was the thing i couldn't see, â    was it the self-betrayal that comes with grief. . â â    broken wings float down from the sky above, â    i'm wishing for the wall of understanding just to show me some love.   the beauteous snowflakes of grace forever in bloom,   with everlasting echos of my bright white room. . . â        â

title: Picture the dollar sign
author: travon
text: chasing all these dreams,  living life right in chase for currency  know that longing for fame and pride is not too easyâ    and day after day the scent of flowing money please me   the truth is that money doesn't hang from trees  money comes with knowledge and the things man and woman go on to succeed  ''i embrace the jewels of happiness completely''  someday,  breathing every breath i'll be forever gone,  my death won't turn out sweetly  to all this heart is eternally. . . â      â   â

title: Am i the one to blame
author: tremaine
text: why should i blame myself for what she done to me?i cant remember the first time she  hit me. one day she slaped me so hard i was shoked then she started banging my head on the floor so hard. there was another time when she grabed me by my hair an drugge me from one room to another then she started punching in my face like i was nothing to her like i was trash like i wasnt her gurlfriend. then one night i dont know what i said to her to make her so mad at me she started punchin me in my ribbs then she started puchinme in my face like eight times my eye was swollen so was my jow the following day i had to go to wrk an i went to wrk like nothing had happened that. i pretended for so long like our relationship was so good like i was so happy an i new i wasnt happy at all. i just didnt have the strenght to up an leave her. love can make do the dumbest things you will never understand why you did them at all. somtimes i would cry my self to sleep but i woudnt let her see me cry. i was so weak an dumb over her i did everything in my power to make her happy but i guess that wasnt enough. she controled me an i let her. i guess by her hitting on me made her fell biger an better than me. im not gonna lye i began to fear her i kept asking myself when will that day come when she will hit me to hard an kill me. i loved her more than i loved myself one day i asked myself do i care if i live or dia at that point i just didnt care. she made me feel so low of myself i couldnt look in the mirrior an say u look pretty to day i just couldnt do anything.

title: A Lecture of Life
author: trina
text: he said he wouldnâ’t tell me anything i didnâ’t already know.  and i said i believed him so i didnâ’t bother to take notes.  he said,  he did,  that the human race in full of vanity and grace.  vanity of selfish praise yet graceful love of sinnerâ’s raise.  he said,  he did,  that the grace won the race and in the end the vanity was an old,  closed case.  i raised the question of how yet this is so? when so many villains ensconce the world so low.  how is it that grace really brings to pass the slaying of vanity and the growth of green grass? i didnâ’t understand,  i told him,  how he could be so sure of grace when the world is drowning in intentions impure? pregnant with hate.  loaded with care.  bloated with sin.  drowning in dispute; with iniquity kin.  i laughed and stood up to go for obviously he didnâ’t know that the soil he walked on as a lad where good was good and bad was bad was changed to a bitter mood where good is bad and bad is good.  almost out the door he called to me,  â“come back child and you will see why i think the way i do and youâ’ll begin to see it through.  we have one life whether it is short or long and we are just one note in lifeâ’s great song.  itâ’s easy to think we donâ’t have a chance to take the time and learn to dance.  but we do child! this you must learn! trials knock you down but for redemption yearn! judgment and hardship.  adversity and misfortune.  these are all valid life questions.  you are free to choose the answer to this one thing; what will you do when the birds refuse to sing?â” i gave this a thought and realized the truth  of this discourse aimed at the youth.  for in life we all must court the malicious face of trial but we can decide if weâ’ll frown or smile.

title: The Road
author: trixi
text: the road  the road is empty when the sky is asleep,  but when the night is over.  the skies start to bloom with its dark blue color to light.  the boy riding his bicycle went to the market to buy.  pass the road.   the road is empty.   the sun is rising,  lover pass the road and stop to watch.   sunrise is coming with its dramatic and magnificent color filled the surrounding.      the lady carrying her bag,  on her way to work,  walked in the road.  the road is no longer empty as lover went in their way.   the man and the joggers start jogging.   the sporty and the athletes start exercising early in the morning.   the sun is rising.   dark blue color to light is no longer seen  as dramatic and magnificent color filled the surrounding,   replace by the sky blue color.   tweet… tweet… tweet… a bird start to sing as morning comes.   the road starts to busy.  passers start to pass one by one.  the lady and her dog stretch for a walk on the road  as the cold wind blowing to her face.  the morning breeze started already.   the children started too walked to school.   the girl run as fast as she can leaving her school shoe on the road.   the boy tripped on her shoe as they both run fast to school.  the bus,  truck,  and car are already here.  the road is now surrounded by different kinds of sounds.   minute by minute,  hour by hour the road is filled with people.  soon morning is over.  the road is the same.   the morning breeze is finished the road is the same.   peep… peep… peep… toot… toot… toot… brum… brum… brum… the road is busy as noon come.   people start to grab their lunch as they passed the road on its busy day.  the teacher on her way back to school and the women who just finish lunch walked on the road.   the road is empty…  no one is walking,  running or talking.  noon is already here.   the sun filled up its surrounding with heat.  silence is what the road in this hour.  only the trucks or cars are running the road now.  where could this people go,  after they passed the road?  the boy cutting classes passed the road in this hour.   the breeze of afternoon is here.  run,  walk,  talk and laugh with their friends pass the road.  children eager to go home after school pass the road.  the boy with his bike passed through the road.  the lady with his dog on their way home pass through the road.  the runners start their daily routine running.  a girl is waiting on the road. …  the lady carrying her bag just finished from her work,  start heading home pass through the road.   5â’oclock sunset is coming,  dawn is approaching.  a boy runs towards the girl whose waiting.  a beautiful sunset,  red and orange colors filled the surrounding  with a majestic view of the sky can be seen at the road.  the lady and her baby on their way home passed the two and both went their way.   the road start to empty again! where could this people go? when will they come back? well they come back?  the road is empty.  and memories went on this people.   who walk run jump ride sing dance laugh and cry on the roads.  the first step their making and made will be remembered.  how long will it have to travel,  how much more do it need to finish.   but iâ’ll be back for the step i take the memories it made.   the road is empty.  the road is always the same  but only the surrounding makes it different.  as the breeze of night comes,  peace in it will always be.  soon the sun will rise,  morning will come again.   the road is empty,  the road is busy,   and the road is long,  longer than i thought!  it let you come! it let pass! no matter whom you are.

title: Im the youth
author: tshepang
text: i'm the youth.  born with possibilities.  in order to unleash my potentialities  i got to let go of negativities  free it all in my mind till i'm left  with positivities.  my vision and mission as the youth is to work for the lord while i'm still young.  to know the lord is my ambition and i pray he deliver me from all temptations,  forgive me from all my sins lord this is my prayer confession.  my youth without the lord is like a day filled with darkness,  a day with no hope at all,  all it lead is to is destruction when we fall.  the lord is not to busy to answer your call,  he just say burden and petitions just bring it all.  youths are the hope of tomorrow .  we must hope in the lord so we can have no sorrow.  let's shine bright like stars.  shine bright and let our deeds be the deeds that brings hope to the nation.  let's celebrate and praise with the singing sensation.  i'm the youth,  i'm a winner,  i'm ambitious,  courageous and i love the lord above all.

title: Mandela's wish
author: tshepiso
text: out of a womb nobody thought he would be a fighter.  out of a gloom he saved black south africans.  what do we return to him. . . .  street names,  stadiums,  musiums,  bank notes well another page in history.  use him to make a living. . . .  wishes have to became true  mandela's wish is lost in a fog created by south africans,  a fog of fear.   '' i dream of an africa which is in peace with itself.  '' he said.  stuggle in his life he paid.  peace for mandela is the wish.  mandela on the headlines everywhere. . .  newspaper,  televison and the radio.  is it a new song i hear ''serious but stable condition'' those words gong in my head.   peace is all they ask from his hospital bed.  machines becoming the new hope.  sound it makes brings joy or sorrow. . .  beeep beeep beeep the sound everybody is happy to hear in hospital,  the song of the year.  i can't see through the fog of fear.   freedom he gave.  my head says mandela we still need you,  my heart says mandela peace is all i will give.  i have three wishes. .  peace for mandela,  peace for mandela,  peace for nelson mandela.  i followed my heart not my head.  iv spoken i hope you heard.  the sun always rises and it has to set. . . .   by tshepiso

title: A perfect imperfection
author: tsuseb
text: a perfect imperfection    mother nature is the best florist;  you are her perfection; you are her finest blossom; you are her most exquisite bloom; you are the rose needed; to cure a heart,  cursed with gloom.    a single thought of you; in the mist of the darkest of minds; can bring the brightest of lights…   would it last is a question asked by doubt; if its love it will survive even death; is an answer given by believed…?   beauty is making perfect the imperfections; love is a language not heard but rather seen: so let the preacher of my emotions is my actions; let the teacher thereof be my passion.    a heart seldom seen is missed; a voice worth listening to is one filled with hope; a soul worthy of saving is that of faith; to love means to be brave; for love conquers all; thus let it be known that you are a conqueror; if in love you allow yourself to fall.

title: Two Many Wars
author: tye
text: many wars  stepping outside ears ringing,  burning,  stinging feeling like he just stepped out of a war zone and into a pep rally in his name life at home is always noisy his head hurts…it always hurts when he goes home.  must find solitude,  he has one place  it is of small stature,  beer stains on the floor,  mop stains smearing the floor so that if you look hard enough you could swear look like miniature racetracks meant for daredevil mice.  keys rattle in his pocket……damn …. . forgot the thunderbird keys.  could push it down the hill and try to jump start it,  but last time he remembers screams,   and a broken leg.  walking back his head starts to hurt again.   sounds can now be heard through the brick and cracked siding.  opening the door looking side to side smiling as he sees jessie his 2 month old bundle of something done right in his life.  saying goodbye for the last time his mind made up.   this war is not worth the fight.

title: Zoos, The Antidrug
author: tyler
text: people say zoos are mean and cruel,  i say zoos help people and give them fuel,                                                                                                                               zoos help endangered animals grow,   zoos provide animals with a bro,    animals receive a balanced diet and donâ’t worry about hunting,    they are happy frolicking,  climbing,  and grunting,    vets keep animals healthy and happy,   so they can entertain people like dewey and your great grand papi,    zoos study animals and help them grow,     so that they can show,   how fun they can be,   to people like you and me,                                                                                          they help the african wild dog, eagle,   so we can enjoy watching it fly while walking our beagle,    they also help to save the grey bat,   so we can admire it even when wearing a hat,  zoos especially help the bengal tiger along,  as he recovers from nearly being extinct and gone,  zoos employ animal lovers who care,                                                                               so that you donâ’t have to worry about any of the bears,   zoos work hard to give animals a proper home,   one where they donâ’t feel alone,   and where they can sleep all peaceful like, animals safe and feed even in bed,  zoos help animals big and small,   zoos help animals large and tall,   zoos help monkeys,  goats,  and sheep,   zoos help animals eat,  drink,  and sleep,  zoos help animals one and all,    to pick them up when they fall.      *ed diebold and tom meehan were the accredited zoo associations inspectors of the year

title: THE VOICE OF NATURE
author: udit
text: speak to the earth & it'll teach you,  about its beauty and diversity too.   nature has given so many things to all,  whether it is oxygen,  fruits,  vegetables or petrol.   i wish that it could have its own voice,  and it could shout louder than all our noise.   then it'll mourn on the condition of its own,  because the things it has given are impossible to clone.   humans have destroyed all its loveliness and beauty,  & no one is ready to say,  ''saving nature is my duty. ''  we don't know that destroying nature is killing ourselves,  and natural things look more beautiful in forests than in our shelves.   so from today let us pledge to save nature,  it'll not only help us but all other living creatures.

title: My friend

text: a simple and a perfect friend never intend to pretend  but shimmers with beauties  her smile is one of those,   i would imprint throughout my watch.    she is my legal stamp to oppose a guider who heeds with adore.   every blob of her utter  switches my mind with a gleam wondering a beauty she provided.    being friend with her helped me to get over a hill  thundering world that we won.    stepping stones are paired with us we are the biddies indeed best friend forever   never to depart but to leave a trile of friendship  in peoples kindship.

title: When I see me...

text: when i think of myself i think of shadows of scattered thoughts  brown faces covered with scares  uncontrollable minds full of naughts when i see me   i see a destructive soul ready to blast. . .   when i think of myself i think of chuby faces full of anger   lifeless bodies with unbearable marks  scared eyes runing from danger when i see me i see a human with a zombies mask. . . .   when i think of myself i think of struggling people fighting from the past  hopeful hearts with  deep rooted odds  fake smiles with mysterious locks when i see me i see a child walking on a darkest path. . . . .

text: why does it happen with me.  some days are really arduous.  sometimes things come out awfully.   a bright ! burnished ! brilliant day ! may end with roaring note.  at times the general instructions â‘o life,  do not affirm themselves.  itâ’s our ecstatic heart that trouble us.   when disgrace vow us ,  even angelic hallucinations chill us . bad news derive us aberrant .  when blestâ’s over displeasure accompany us .   four entombments in a row and much pain .  i canâ’t endure any more !  brand new gash distress thy heart.  i canâ’t endure any more ! why itâ’s happening with thy own ? they were dear to me ,  but almighty acquired their ghosts.  we appraise people committing judas kiss ,  treasons ,  atrocities ,  living in armistice .   oh ! heavenly arcadian why donâ’t you take their souls and bid us adieu awhile .

title: Heart
author: vaishnav
text: heart an invisible strand that lit the foreseen nature of human appetite.  neither seen nor touched,  fills mystery to brim.   relations that portray me,  emerge through the heart's blossom.  the fire that gleams through,  battles the ignorance of dark.   when a child gazes at you,  you follow the heart forgetting the moment.  understanding the world around,  doesn't claim that you know more than your reflection.   i asked myself about my heart,  when i nodded with a sweet smile.  i know not about the mystery,  but about the smile which hides my truth.   concluding to this old companion,  fills me with unresolved emotion.  i wonder if i know you,  you who pleased to read me.       \\

title: The Boy
author: vanessa

title: Ever Wanted A Friend?
author: vanessa
text: ever wanted a friend? one to last a thousand lives.  ever wanted a friend? one to dry a thousand cries.   a man as a friend,   with nothing of a lover.  to be their for you,   through fights with the other.   one to lift my spirts,   through tears to laughter.   men are jealous,   men are hucksters.  but men are caring,   men are lovers.   i want a mans love,   want him to be caring.  without his jealousy,   without him wanting. . .  wanting me,   as more than a friend.  wanting me,   as more of a lover.   for i refuse to be,   more to another.    all i want,     nothing of lover. . .   ever wanted a friend?

title: Rise To Be The Sun
author: varsha
text: rise to be the sun  the sun has risen,  where have u been so long,  waiting for the sun to rise why have u been so dull,  reflecting the light of others,  why donâ’t you shine brighter?  u are a passerby in this world of desires,  donâ’t stand apart,  join the race.  maybe u can find a way,  not to be the moon but the sun.   speak your heart,  use your brain,  itâ’s not so difficult to be one of those men  merely standing there at the start of the line.  rather,  itâ’s time to finish the race.   donâ’t stammer,  but realise itâ’s time to speak before its time for sunset dance to the tune of your hearts  before its  doomsday.   thereâ’s the stage,  theres the world waiting for u to explore where have u been so long rise to be the sun rise to be the sun. . .

title: Opposites Attract

title: Why Does It Take Me So Long to Read?
author: victor
text: why does it take me so long to read? to read this word,  this line,  this stanza,   sentence,  paragraph,  page,  book,  this novel? is it because i canâ’t forget about what that word meant on page 36? or is it because everything i peruse dissipates past my eyes? most likely it is the former.

title: Now That I Have You
author: victoria
text: i dreamed of you,  i prayed for you.  i looked for you but seemed to never be able to find you.  all this time you were right there.  every heartache and pain and tears leading up to finding you was worth it because now i have you.  itâ’s like an angel put you on earth for me.  you stole my way to breathe you stole my heart,  but that doesnâ’t seem to bother me because i want you to make me feel like iâ’m the only one in the world.  i want you to wrap me up and kiss me and show me what iâ’m missing.  i couldnâ’t take a step without you; i couldnâ’t breathe without you,  i couldnâ’t live without you,  because boy youâ’re all i need.  youre the reason i wake up in the mornings with a smile on my face.  youâ’re the reason my heart still beats.  boy you make me fall in love with you every time you look at me.

title: The Silence
author: victoria
text: i hear the silence which seems to suprass all understanding,  it's heavy with joy,  pain and discomforting trust.  the silence that screams in my head making me go blind.   i struggle to keep concious.  thought invading my mind like the smell  of fresh pollen.  then suddenly,  smothering darkness.   my breath becomes shallow as i search for light.  the emptiness hugs my naked body.  past dreams of flowers and love consume my blank mind.   when will this silence break? i scream; the silence is broken.

title: Fly
author: victoria
text: in a moment,  everything can change.  your control is either lost or given up.  you feel your feet lift off the groud.  you soon realize that your heart isn't the only thing flying away.   you're soaring above the clouds.  cloud nine is below you.  you can feel the wind wrap it's vastness around you.  it outlines your body as you freely leave behind everything,  yet nothing at all.   you vow to never come down.  is this eternity? the emptiness of space and air,  yet fufillment in your heart.  still wondering what you want and need?  suddenly the cold,  hard rock of your pity smacks you in the face.  you embrace the sorrow that consumes your life.  your thoughts are once again obsessed with help no one can give.   all you have to rememebr is to fly.  be free.  a butterfly.  beauty on wings,  flowing from the heart.   your life is a rainbow of colors.  fly to what you know.  fly to what you need.  just fly and be free.

title: Ode to my toolboxes
author: walter
text: my little old toolbox dents holes drawers smaller and smaller it seems as it fills with harbor freight tools time for an upgrade a new craftsman toolbox no dents no holes and a little bigger as i grow older my tools grow larger and more plentiful … upgrade wow snap on toolbox the cream of the crop the top of the line i could never fill this one bigger badder tools no problem toolbox after toolbox upgrade after upgrade it seems i have every tool imaginable way more than i ever need but everything i ever want with no tool left behind my garage filled to the brim all my cars packed for that emergency nothing i have will ever break without the right tool for the job

title: Sonnet yo
author: wanna
text: \twe call them maggots,  we call them freaky \twe call them different bad names at school \tjust shut your mouth,  please stop being cheeky \ttheyâ’re people just like us,  they are not fools.   states take away their rights,  theyâ’re second class.  theyâ’re fired from jobs,  kicked out of their homes exiled from the crowds,  not part of the mass covered in bruises,  please donâ’t break their bones.   \tsome places donâ’t care,  they let them be free \tdoctors let them be,  give them the things they need.  \tno matter opinion they agree \tsome give them hugs,  donâ’t make them cry and bleed.  we need to love in this world,  do not hate treat everyone like theyâ’re our soulmate

title: How we met
author: warden
text: a walk in the park through young ones swinging side to side  a song created by the rhythm of new born voices  the homeless and birds over leftovers.   lovers hugging,  curdling and enjoying  as i walk through,  wondering to experience the same  there she was,  alone inhaling fresh air  the closer i got,  the more fascinated i was   dressed like heavenâ’s got an occasion eyes as gold as mine commodity  ooh well! about that smile,  i was in love already  unexpectedly,  conversation flew like tears of joy  deep inside i felt something  auspiciously,  she noticed,  yes how fortunate to have similar intensions  right from the start i knew i met an angel,  queen of my heart  obviously,  thatâ’s how we met.

title: Returning the love that was losted.
author: warren
text: returning the love that was losted.  from the two lovers who had love in each others eyes.  to the time when they had their goodbyes.  when one still stood while the other denied the love.  as one night one began to cry.  but the sun still shined more and more that day.  only to find another in a very unusual way.  returning the love that was losted.  he lays down thinking how he let her go.  she lays down thinking how i loved that boy ever so.  he says to his self i loved that girl with all my heart.  she says how can he love me by not showing his love for me.  returning the love that was losted.  even though she's gone and her sun will shine no more.  his light will no longer light only to find darkness.  those two were a perfect couple they say.  he drove her away without ever showing that he really loved her.  she lefted him without saying goodbye only looking the other way without no remorse.  returning the love that was losted.

title: The Invisible Man
author: wi-z
text: like a phoenix from the ashes,  like the smokes after the lit matches. . .  comes a rising light from the fatal night.  with a kiss from the sun to make the grey skies come alive becoming more beautiful than a sapphire through a beam of light.  conscious comes the imperceptible soul,  veiled to the world and undescribable by a word.  from his throne he rise.  to his head,  a crown of lies.  he is well aware,  as he is wise.  but what is reality to a inconspicuous man who never dies.  with so much awareness trapped in his mind,  he walks the earth with no where to hide.  for he is his guide,  a king with no army behind,  seeking for one to call his kind,  hoping with every wish that one day he shall find.  the more the world passes him by,  the less obscure he is.  now he stands in the midst of median beings unnoticed by one.  a god to the hierarchy of knowledge as he believes he understands everything and everyone around him.  frozen in his thoughts while he stands,  he blinks. . .  the motion of the universe decelerates. . .  slowly the crowd walk pass him,  slowly the tears from the clouds drop to a splash,  and slowly he turns to a flash.  simultaneously blinking for the second time.  as his eyelids folds back to place, . . .  he sees her.  standing beneath the stoplight,  shielded from the rain by the black umbrella she yields.  as he stares fixedly in a state of stun at her beauty and difference,  she turns to look directly at him.  immediately he flinches.  perplexed as to how it is possible that he is visible to her.  or maybe she just looks towards his direction.  but then. . .  she smiled at him. . .  she sees him. . .  turning back to face the crossing light as it begins to countdown,  he blinks for the third time.  the universe accelerates back to it's pace.  as she takes a step and begins to walk,  the crowd moved in intersection to her space.  he takes a deep breathe as he looses sight of her and began to run towards his instincts of her position.  intangible to all in his path,  he moved focused in one direction like a bishop displaced on a chess board.  with his senses channeled in the same course,  the sounds from his surrounding faded to a unified tone.  he caught a glimpse of her.  in reflex and panic,  he said aloud. . .  ''hey!'' as he brakes to a stop,  standing in the middle of the street.  for this moment of decree he would give everything,  his hopes,  his love,  his life.  for one thing.  that she draws to a halt.  immediately, . . .  she did.  turning around to look directly at him as she lifts her fingers to brush the hair obstructing her sight gently behind her ear.  ''hey'' she said.  again. . .  she sees him.  with shock in his heart to the level that could quake his balance,  he says,  ''can you see me''.  in reply with humor she responded with the same words as she smiled.  at the speed of light,  thoughts and emotions flooded his mind,  building pressure enough to liquidate and leak through his eyes.  interrupted by the rumbling horn from the taxi while his heart throbs,  he is gestured to progress to the roadside.  now his senses recovers to his environment.  the unified sound dissociates to a chatter.  she walks towards him.  gently her supple hands wraps around his.  ''c'mon'' she said as she draws him to safety.  does the joy devour the confoundment or does the fear devour the faith.  unsure as to what he feels,  he is certain one thing.  he is not alone.  no longer a king to no kingdom he ran,  no longer trapped in the maze no one began,  and no longer a subtraction from reality as an invisible man.

title: I Am What I Am
author: william
text:
i am what i am i am what i must be and with god i am free i am william i am my fathers son and i am currently the old trapped in the body of the young i am damaged i am broken i am one whose feelings may often go unspoken i am one who has escaped the wicked grips of death i am one whose self portrayed as so inferior to the rest i am an athlete that was forced to surrender my every ounce of excellence i am a college student whom misses the comfort of his equality and acceptance i am a man who was forced to grow up in a way that seemed so fast i am also a young boy who wishes individuals could only change their past i am now stuck here <
i am seen so fabulous on the outside but further in i am not well i am forgetful with my memories that will forever seem to smear but even through all of this i am thankful i am here i am ready to face this life with every bad time a rebuttal i am prepared to face my future and surely triumph any struggle because i am a believer in the mightiest of power i am one without doubt that god will support me in my every waking hour i am now what i am i am now what i must be i am and with my god i am free

title: The future?
author: william
text: what does the future hold mystery,  next years history,  who can predict what will happen as the clock continues to tick and tock,  who will be president,  will it be your next door resident,  that is the beauty of the future because everyone has there own version there own song,  and no one can prove the other wrong,  all we know is time doesnt slow it continues to move along,  will they find a cure for cancer,  if they did what was the answer,  what happened to all the pollution,  have we proven evolution as the final solution,  and those who believe in adam and eve were just nieve,  or will there be a correction,  with a holy resurrection,  where jesus takes believers to a heavenly section,  i rule nothing out i use my discretion,  did i ever use geometry in real life,  who will be my wife,  is there fate for me to find a soul mate,  or is belief in something that isnt just a human trait,  if there is on what date will fate have me meet such a mate,  do we have flying cars,  can they take us to the stars,  whats the deal,  are aliens real,  will i ever achieve fame,  what are my childrens names,  what are their favorite games,  will there genders be the same,  will their personalities be wild or will they be tame,  these are the questions that will drive us insane,  who did start the fire,  did brett farve ever retire,  the answer is we do not know these events are yet to transpire,  and we cannot find out despite how huge our desire

title: Sonnet 130
author: william
text: my mistress' eyes are nothing like the sun;   \tcoral is far more red than her lips' red;   if snow be white,  why then her breasts are dun;   \tif hairs be wires,  black wires grow on her head.     i have seen roses damask'd,  red and white,    \tbut no such roses see i in her cheeks;   and in some perfumes is there more delight   \tthan in the breath that from my mistress reeks.    i love to hear her speak,  yet well i know  \tthat music hath a far more pleasing sound;   i grant i never saw a goddess go;   \tmy mistress,  when she walks,  treads on the ground.    and yet,  by heaven,  i think my love as rare   \tas any she belied with false compare.

title: My King
author: xiara
text: you are my king upon his throne.  as long as you love me,  youâ’ll not be alone.   iâ’m right beside you you guide me,  iâ’ll guide you.  making you happy is what i aim to do.   we have found in each other love,  trust,  and respect these very things that matter we will not forget.   i do know i am blessed to find a loving man so pure within my kingâ’s beauty is strength that can endure.   and so i look up to you,  with the whole world at your feet.  the true king that you are you do not accept defeat.   my king,  you do amaze me with the wondrous mind you possess i do not doubt what youâ’re capable of seemingly with ease,  youâ’re always at your best.   just know your queen is with you even when weâ’re far apart nothing will break the bond we share which exists deep in our hearts.   the god that i believe in had the perfect plan,  you see; he made me for you and he made you for me.

title: The little girl
author: yamuna
text: once there was a girl who had it all she was born well-off with everything she could dream of  she would ask for candy and it would be there  she would ask for pretty garments and all the stuffed animals  she had it all she had it all  but nothing in life ever lasts,  and,   this too was a thing that had to pass  even though she loved and cherished it all  everything now started to fall  the love that she got was still there but,   the love that she wanted to unveil was all gone  gone with the wind,  with sorrows of the heart  she was a bird with hopes highest of all that this too shall pass like everything else  she knew a cloud no matter how dark it gets,  has within a silver lining of its  days passed by and she started to grow and so did the fire within no matter how fierce the blow  so naive of her to think it would fade.   for some things are there forever to stay  the bickerings went bad and worst by each passing day and throughout this all the little girl passed away long gone is the girl who fantasized of a prince,  who dreamed of love,  and a happy ending  it seems so surreal how things are now,  how she is now  for she isn't broken but she is scarred  she knows it all,  that only she has the strength  to break the shell that is empty from within it is true that living through the darkest of tides is what makes you strong  it is true that she still has it all  for what came out of the troubles wasn't a broken girl but a phoenix who rose from the fire within  she doesn't need you i promise you that but she loves that you are there with a helping hand.

title: NOW, NOW, NOW
author: yash
text: now,  now,  now,  look at thy valor mr.  gomes,  you look none like a wickedest one,  but a nicest man,  like a shooting star,  the noblest one,  for the next 1000 years sire,  your resting in spirits none less than a trillion men would follow thy pathway,  look at thy braveness,  how thou has finished your ifrs,  topest scholars marked you up,  for you are the divine comet,  makes me jealous of thy bravery.  like a coward we are,  but you sire,  nonetheless the father of all accounts.   now,  now,  now,  let me vouch to the world,  your a sire to be remarked none lesser than heathen,  but sire,  you not look beneath but above,  striking a change in this world through thy brisque ranks,  descended like a commoner amongst the gaelic,  rose to be the brightest prism and thy salvation is none lesser than the other richest salvations,  thou kind of man are rare sire,  deception,  infidel,  harm,  hatred put aside,  betrothed them and led the salvation army. .  thy sire is the only sire and the only sire my fellowmen.   (this is a poem about myself written as a gift to my dean)

title: Conversation with my heart
author: yonike
text: conversation with my heart  am proud of you you finally took the chance  sheï¿½s in your life now,  donï¿½t let her go  youï¿½ve been waiting for so long,   now youï¿½ve got the chance donï¿½t blow it  look at you,   donï¿½t think iï¿½ve ever seen sadness in you,  since she came  she cater for you so well talk to me its alright,  am your only closest friend,  donï¿½t you feel special?  even when you sleep at night,  her thoughts run to you,  itï¿½s just as if it was bluetooth  you think and talk of her all the time,  itï¿½s like you can paint a portrait of her with colourful words of passion that makes you urge for her,  wow sheï¿½s even turned you into an artist  i understand how you feel,   because i hear you struggle for breathe,  hear you make soothing noises as if you were playing an ancient african drum,  but donï¿½t you worry its totally natural,  she takes you breathe away  you seem to forget am part of you,   donï¿½t you think i feel when the hot red substance passes through you? o yh donï¿½t get blotted up,  because sheï¿½s now part of you,   she can feel your emotions matter fact better than i can  hmm now you feel so superficial donï¿½t you,  you use to believe in fate,  now sheï¿½s in your life,  itï¿½s like a miracle happened  answer me this simple question,  what has come over you so positively? youï¿½ve change so much over the last 8 months,  i know yes,  donï¿½t answer,  its rhetorical  yes i know your morals ï¿½to be with you altogether or never to see youï¿½ because you think no one else can ever posses you.  but embrace yourself,  cheer up you done well well farewell my friend,  i have too much to say and therefore i must close this letter,  so that you can receive it immediatelyï¿½ be calm; for only by calmly considering our relationship can we achieve our goals to live together--be calm--love meï¿½from the very first day --yesterday-- today what tearful joy do i long for youï¿½for you-are-my heart--my good wishes to youï¿½is that you do continue to love me--never underestimate your lover's most faithful heart.   forever yours   (explanation iï¿½m in love and the only person i can talk about it is me,  so it seem like two people was talking,  but i was talking to my heart as if it was a very close friend of mine,  so i was telling my heart how it feels. )

title: Was there ever a time
author: yonike
text: was there ever a time  was there ever a time,  that you smile that i never blushed you made me feel so good and have lust over you.   was there ever a time,  that your lips don't resemble a speaker box,  flows out pure musical vibes,  that quavers my heart  was there ever a time,  you looked into my eyes,  and you never intended for me to have butterflies  was there ever a time,  that your pretty dark brown eyes don't make me feel drowned and lost,  i search but there was no sudden pulse  was there ever a time,  that your sweet smell of seduction,  never caught up with my innocence,   only to see you right in my arm and made me feel like your husband and not your friend.   was there ever a time,  that you never showed me openness,   be caring and seeks to be honest  was there ever a time,  that you never made me inspired,  you vowed to forever give me your love,  because thatï¿½s what my heart require  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . am thankful for you being in my life. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .   was there ever a time,   was there ever a time,

title: One Little Bird
author: youngmee
text: one little bird is  sitting on grandma's shoulder babbling until the stars twinkle dreaming until the moon waves saying

title: To Start the Day
author: yvonne
text: when iâ’m done snoring,   \ti wake in the morning.  \tfor almost an hour,  \ti wash in the shower.  \tbrush my teeth,  \ttop and beneath.  \tcomb my hair,  \tthatâ’ll get the stare.  \twhat should i wear? \tdoes anyone care? \tpants or a skirt? \tpink or blue shirt? \tiâ’m thinking wow,  \tiâ’m looking good now.  \tbreakfast at last,  \tiâ’d better eat fast.  \tif i hesitate,  \ti could be late.  \tto walk would be far,  \tbut canâ’t drive with no car.  \ti guess itâ’s the bus,  \tthis day is such a fuss.  \tiâ’ll do it again tomorrow,  \tgetting ready,  what a sorrow

title: Winged Fruit
author: zachariah
text: the butterflys i see.  are the ones i now seem to seek.  so neat,  so sweet,  so very pretty in pink.  blueberry eyes,  bannana hair,  cherry red lips.  the way she seems to sway her hips.  angel like voice.  soft as summer rain.  where has my angel gone? i can't ignore this terrible pain

title: First love, last love.
author: zachariah
text: your heart makes me smile your soul gets me wild hearing just your voice you will always be my first choice hear me now and hear me forever we are always going to be together hold me now and never let go our love is hidden in words untold loving you,  i will always hold close to me you make me bold melting my heart you did this from the start you know it's true you gave me your heart and i gave you mine too.  forever and ever i will always love you.

title: Rain on Teardrops
author: zachary
text: rain on teardrops outside,  alone,  drenched winter is coming,  but the storm is peaking all i can worry about is when i will get warm again.  the thought of summer days,  puts me in a summer daze.  inside it is pouring even harder.  anguish,  pain,  hopelessness.  cold and running on empty,  why do i keep proceeding? thoughts of warmth and love bring out a light a light barely visible but still there.  is that hope i see? or is it a facade? a lie.  a lie that everything will be ok one day.  but today,  i am standing alone in the rain with my teardrops.

title: I'm Not Alone
author: zack
text: a teary eye,  a worried frown,  occurs as my feet,  my tired,  weighty feet walk down the white hall.  iâ’m alone.  iâ’m alone.   heart pounding,  tear falling,  as i enter the sterile room.  sleepy patient,  breathing heartily,  iâ’m alone.  iâ’m alone.   quivering mouth,  shakey hand,  sweating with anxiety.  but then a warmth,  washes through the room.  iâ’m not alone.  iâ’m not alone.   peaceful feeling,  hopeful air,  coming from my right.  as i look,  i see a sight i have never saw before.  iâ’m not alone.  iâ’m not alone.   heart lifting,  tears drying,  jesus is here to help.  jolted breathing,  glory feeling,  iâ’m not alone.  iâ’m not alone.   sleepy smile,  awakened patient,  once again all well.  warm touch,  gentle words,  iâ’m never alone.  iâ’m never alone.

title: Suicide prevention
author: zack
text: sometimes we feel worthless and unwanted with no purpose to live on scars can tell thousands of stories but life can tell one. .  yours

title: PRECIOUS PRINCE
author: zahir
text: precious prince  far in the backs,   of city fargo lived a large family,  amidst cargo.   a child was born,  one fine day forty years only,  he was to stay  father's prodigy,  the beloved one what said he.  all had to be done  ''not a teacher,  don't want a guide want to be mine,  my very own pride''  handsome and young,  all full of life our baby boy,   wanted to take a wife  jewels and gold,  wanted the dame full of shame,  the marriage became  not even his child,  did she spare taking it away,   without a care  wandering alone,  drowned in sorrow.  he went about,  not a care for tomorrow  in a dark alley,  lying in pain he was found,  almost insane  no sun,  no wind,  no snow,  of any weather could put precious prince,  back together  quietly and calmly,  between his soft moaning he took his last breath,  on a peaceful evening.   his mother and a sister,  and one aunt only were there with him,  not leaving him lonely  their beloved baby boy,  a beautiful soul he bade them farewell,  from across the wall  to show him the way,  and how to fly angels of heaven,  came down from the sky  goodby our baby boy,  farewell for now all for maybe,  one day we might meet thou!

title: My Hands
author: zain
text: taken for granted the workers toil away night and day whether it be work or play never fighting simple,  complex,  effective my medium of expression my begetter of pleasure what they do is my measure in time they speak to me and not just to others they remind me of things left undone and things that should have been left undone they are my tools and my aids they are a representation of my heart they are more me to you than i am me to you.

title: My life
author: zainab
text: porem by zainab khalil in the day of darkness we lost our friends.  in the day of madness we lost our faith.   in the day of happiness we made memories that will never forget.  in the day of hope we lost the smiles that we will never get again.  in the day of nightmare we cried rivers which was unfair.   in the day of hopelessness we dream in a miracle way.  in the day of mircale we just denied the feeling we used to to pretend everyday.  in the day of weakness we blame others for or mistakes.   i n the day of sadness we lost the chance that we had to say.  i n the day of happiness we prtend that we cared all the way.  i n the day of losness we never expect to vanish and go far way.

title: The White Lie
author: zainab
text: i woke up in the morning  the sky was so annoying  i asked it what is wrong  she told me i am strong  my mom called me out  she screams in a harsh sound  zainab come around  it is time to clean your messy room  and clean up the ground  before your dad come see what you have done  i did not come,  my mom kept screaming very loud  the ground started to shaking   a white lie come cross my mind  i told her that i am sick and cannot stand out  my moral and my mind kept scolding me  my anxiety started to tickle me  then i told her the truth  and felt very well afterward

title: Monday,Monday
author: zane
text: i woke up truly late on a monday ten minutes past i heard my alarm bark wishing it was the morning of sunday showering lights went out twas in the dark  remember twas pajama day at school running late i couldn't find my pajamas it turns out at school i wouldn't look that cool i wish i could go to the bahamas  but then my oatmeal i made was so good it brightened my day and made me feel warm the best part of my morning was the food i didn't wear pajamas twas in no harm  it turned out to be a regal morning even first period wasn't that boring

title: Arrival
author: zane
text: i hate when i arrive to things so late  whether i overslept or i get lost  i get into trouble and miss my date  when i show up late i will pay the cost  i try to please everyone all the days  no excuse is good enough for people  i do make it sometimes but not always  on sundays i am late to the steeple  try as hard as i can but cannot please   so many things are put on top my plate  people don't understand i need some ease  people hold grudges i need a clean slate  the worst of  the days may be hard and long but these make me stronger and that's not wrong

title: To all the Poets
author: zechariah
text: your works of poetry enspire within my heart a deep desire to do good for all mankind until true peace i really find but don't let these words of cheer  lure away that hidden fear  of being scorned  or misunderstood or abused  in the mental neighborhood now to finish up this sagistical thesis of my knowledge acrued  through my cerebral genius i sincerely auspice this rhymatical narrative with my own appellation which is in apparitive

title: The summer meadows
author: zechariah
text: in the summer walking through the polder i breathe in the redolence of the inexorable power  of the resplendant flowers that i cannonize through guise of mangled grandeur in this epoch of complacent disconnection  my soul doth descry its resurrection  and in that espial of inherent accord my existence feels planned by the loving steward

title: Computer
author: zoe
text: my computer's very neat it's got cool colours to match my seat!

title: I say
author: zz
text: i say hi,  you say lie,  then we say bye.
